TgyeaAXPHuMl5_VhyAoD9g.text: Delicious Italian! We order the same meal each time we go: shrimp cocktail for an app with the complimentary garlic bread, then for your entree get the meatball with ricotta appetizer (one HUGE meatball) and an order of spaghetti with tomato and basil sauce. Do this instead of ordering spaghetti and meatballs - better deal. Then, save room for dessert and get the Oreo Zeppole, 6 fried Oreos that you dip in a vanilla milkshake. It's sinful but oh so amazing and you will be craving that meal until your next trip to Vegas!   My only complaint is the really loud, bumping music. Take it down a notch!

aWKVAJe8EjzZtRISTFgBYQ.text: RESTAURANT: I went to Lavo on a Saturday night with my sister for dinner. We made reservations the day before and was surprised the restaurant wasn't completely booked yet. We shared  the caesar salad and the four cheese ravioli. I had read on yelp that the caesar salad was great so we decided to try it. The caesar salad was the business! It was huuuge and delicious. I think it was the best salad I've ever had.  The pasta was okay, I think we should have got the spaghetti insead. For dessert we got gelato - vanilla and caramel, which was amazing. Our server could have been more personable and friendly, not so matter-of-fact but he did his job and we were happy with our meal. The restaurant is very beautiful and has a sopshicated, sexy vibe yet laid back. I will definetly come back on my next trip to Las Vegas.  CLUB: My sister and I decided to check out Lavo after we went to Tao on a Thursday night. We weren't hotel guests, weren't on the guest list nor are we locals but we got in for free with no fuss which was nice. The club is upstairs and very small/intimate. It was pretty packed.  The go-go dancers looked bored and had no rhythm. I was surprised the the DJ was playing latin music, since I thought the club played top 40/pop/hip hop like most other clubs, but maybe it was latin music night? Not sure if I would go back to the club, unless the music was better. I think this place is probably hit or miss.

Vh7VMhRV2Poaw1VDHkQIAg.text: This is a review for the club only.  I definitely give Lavo bonus points, because I once met a guy there named Elvis (checked his driver's license). You can't buy such an experience! On my most recent visit, it was unbearably crowded, but I'm not sure it's fair to fault a club for that. The crowd itself is quite friendly, and everyone is having a good time. Be careful if you're really drunk or wearing very high heels (high probability for that in Vegas), because you have to go up quite a bit of stairs to get into the club area.

YE6-EtQ-7LwmxZtIaEJbJw.text: Five stars because one of their "props" is a white midget guy chained to a very large black lady...she just chills on a couch as he fans her with a giant fan. Best thing I've ever seen at a Vegas club.  Music's good, drinks are quick...can get a little crowded, but it's one of the hottest clubs in Vegas...what do you expect?

-_mx6EP0gPo-hzF750Vktg.text: Everytime we go Vegas, Lavo is our Tuesday night spot. We love our host Henry Wang - 100% VIP SERVICE!  Beautiful venue.  One of my favorites.  Bottle service was very pleasant.  We had to leave Blush after 4 bottles and horrible service to complete our night at Lavo.  Should've started and ended night here.

UGrBzgJtx5JYR1yvV0CpEw.text: NIGHTCLUB REVIEW ONLY:  GREAT SERVICE!!!!! NICE STAFF!!!! BUT------ If middle-age, mid-western women with no rhythm are your cup of tea, this place is for YOU! One almost broke my wrist when she tried to use my 110 lb self for leverage as she tried to climb onto one of the ledges you can stand and dance on...    lot's of literal "ho's" looking for the next John... you might not realize that is what she is to start, but as the night comes to a close, she hopes that you are drunk enough to take her home and pay top dollar.  if you are a people-watcher. you'll love it.

8xS7XZMJ742SDUMFSkVS5w.text: AMAZING Food! AMAZING WAITERS! We were with a HUGE party like 100+ people and it was the best time i've ever had in a fancy restaurant. Food was soooooo good I can't even begin. The waiters were all A:so cute b: so nice c:soo funny. We were playing games at our table with them and they totally just played along. I didn't have to pay for this meal so price didn't matter to me, but for a NICE begas restaurant the prices didn't seem to bad!

77dygHoi5FAexIP62LQyKQ.text: While on a girls vegas trip we ventured in for dinner. We ordered several different plates for everyone to share. The food was great, the decor is amazing and the service was good. After dinner we ventured upstairs to the club, they had great music  but like most everything in vegas, it caters to men. Half naked women in roman attire were hired as eye candy for the men, I think they forgot that we need some eye candy as well.

aXhE8g_-Bq2fap1f8p7M7g.text: this was my second nightclub in vegas.  my first was XS.. sooooo this place wasn't that great after going to XS first. probably shoulda done it the other way around.  well overall, this place was.. okay. don't know how much cover is because my friend and i got on the guestlist through a friend so it was free for us :)  bouncers weren't nice but not rude or anything either. just emotionless. and didn't say anything. o_o but ANYWAAYS. it's super dark inside. wish it was a bit more lit. couldn't see anything for a couple seconds. downstairs is the lounge area with a bar. and you go upstairs for the dance floor. drinks weren't that bad, we got a big glass of tokyo tea for $12  dance floor is small. get's crowded very easily. there's kind of like a dance floor at the back of the room where you go up like 2 steps. it's where the reserved seats are located also, and that area was okay. not as crowded so a lot of space to dance and move around and BREATHE.   there were seats along the walls in certain places where you can sit and finish your drink or just chill which was nice because you don't want to bring your drink to the dance floor. you'll loose half of it by spilling it around on other people.   bathrooms were SUUPER dark too. can't fix your make up because you can barely see your face -_-  it's really not a bad place. it's still a lot nicer than clubs anywhere else. but small and too dark for me.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hall way after going up the stairs. leads to dance floor.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. downstairs dining and lounge area

og_HtAOSN_pYQk5ySDacvQ.text: came in after some gambling.... got seats at the bar and had a good time with my bf. the bartender is super nice, recommended a few really good drinks one is pear base martini, another is grape martini.. YUM! He also recommended a few places for us to go to as LAVO isn't open on Thursday night for dancing... score!

L-Xne3dhPGoh-LW8o5Ti9Q.text: I love coming to Las Vegas. It's loaded with celebrity chefs and fine dining. My first stop was Lavo. I have eaten here before with co-creator Matt Harwood. It's places like this that inspire us to replicate what we ate.. Read more here: bougiefood.com/?p=316

JkznT2I_MeJd11fz798LvQ.text: Oooh Lavo... how I loathe thee! I'll start off by saying thank goodness we were comped entry into this place! This is a review for just the nightclub not the restaraunt!  TINY, Cramped, and Terrible!  My girls and I met a promoter who put us on a guest list so we got free admission and free drinks... well, they told us be there at 10:15 but doors don't open til 10:30. Fine. We get upstairs, free drinks don't start until 11 pm. That was annoying because that was all we went there for. Actually, it wasn't even worth the free drinks.  This club shouldn't even be called a club, it's just so small. Few bars and not enough bar tenders. I'd never buy VIP at this place because you get a tiny little table and maybe 2 seating spaces. For me VIP is about having your own little space, well you don't get that here.   The music was TERRIBLE! The DJ was horrible, didn't know how to mix the music, and it was a total buzz kill. Thank goodness we stayed less than an hour and made our way to Surrender...   I'll never go to Lavo again!

35mZC-YWAvE6QFiyTIJs9g.text: Tried their brunch for the first time and it was amazing! We had the chicken and waffles, eggs benedict, and chocolate chip pancakes.  Everything we had was amazing, but the chocolate chip pancakes were the best!!!!  The service was amazing as well.  Our server was so attentive and gave good suggestions while we contemplated on what to order.  He was so nice and friendly.

GrQb4ZmWJFXCOArJmDsCgw.text: I have to admit, it's been a while since I've thoroughly enjoyed myself at a Vegas club/lounge. No wait to get in, free drinks, and good music. When I mean good, I mean good as in not 100% house. Props to DJ Morsecode for laying out the variety. It was enough to get me on one of the platforms and tear sh*t up. We probably could have left and hopped over to another place, but we were comfortable with staying here. Smaller venues like this seem to produce more memories for myself and the people I'm with. This is something to consider if you'd like a break from the larger, more crowded clubs.

_VSYbDwkve3sYJRto0z39Q.text: I had the Linguini w/mixed seafood and it was amazing! the staff was really nice and VERY attentive, I would totally go back and highly recommend it to everyone else

tZFDBbGvtAf5RUZ1R1UREw.text: While I didn't have dinner here, I went clubbing to Lavo and had a blast. Located at the Palazzo on the Las Vegas strip, Lavo is one of the newer hotspots in town. As you walk in, you cross over the main restaurant via an overhead walkway. On both sides of this walkway, small marble fountains illuminate your path. As you enter the club, at the base of the stairs, two hot dancers are feeling each other up seductively in a bath tub. Drinks are strong and the music is fantastic.   Only reason for the 4 stars - too crowded. There wasbhardly room to stand let alone buy drinks, walk to the dance floor and dance. Someone spilled their drink on my shirt. This was on a Saturday night, but the next one we went to, Tryst was not as crowded.

SxYwpuGeHkDP65fgYoAO1A.text: Food was delicious. But was overshadowed by the scavenger b!tch waitresses at the bar as we waited to be seated. The waitress was asian with tattoos all over her. Real classy huh? She shouldve tattooed her ugly face so i couldve kept my appetite a little better. Anyhow my girlfriend, another couple and I were here for vday and the night was ruined when we were kicked out of our seats so 5 caucasian males in suits can be seated. We did not spend over $300 for dinner to be treated like this. NEVER AGAIN WILL WE COME HERE TO EAT UNLESS I WANT TO BE DEGRADED LIKE ITS THE 50's again.

QYSFioFeFOIKahLq7RTthw.text: The service was a bit slow (especially considering that we were there at 5:30 and the place wasn't even that busy yet), but the server was friendly, the ambiance is great (trendy upscale without feeling Vegas-cheesy), and the food was good.  In particular, my friend couldn't say enough good things about the lobster bisque soup  :)  I would definitely eat there again.

2G_3X04y4O9bGSiQtzfFpg.text: Enjoyed the food. I had the tuna tartare for appetizer and spaghetti and meatballs with a glass of "the riddler" for my entree. All were delicious. Before we got any food or drink, a waiter tripped and dropped his serving tray on my shoulder. It startled me and it also bugged the crap out of me that he never apologized. My own server said she was sorry but he did not. Usually when something like that happens the manager comes by to make sure you're ok, but here, nothing. I let my server know I was bothered by his lack of interest that he conked me on the shoulder but she didn't seem to really care that much. If I really wanted to get into it I could have gone to the manager but due to the fact that I was with a larger party and uninjured, I let it ride. The music during dinner could have been more quiet; we had to shout. Nightclub was fun, since we ate there, we could walk upstairs for free. DJ was really good, and the vibe was fun. Note: This is not a sit-down club. Its very small by vegas standards, but it was still a great time!

chqTi0C83IByDXIL0arn1A.text: Food was basic. Olive garden could serve better. Service took forever and they charge on soda refills. Will not be back.

hz9chRsTuNtD8q0GtxSEXw.text: Was there last night. Empty. Drinks were not good. Oysters were served at the size of one inch.  Bolognese sauce was terrible! Over powered with  Fennel and Basil! Very Disappointed!!!!

5BLz47bWR_eUcqsohl4ZBw.text: Yum! I came here with a co-worker because we were staying at the Palazzo and he remembered this Italian restaurant that he loved where they had "the best meatballs" made with kobe beef. Personally, I don't think that you should waste kobe beef on meatballs but hey, it's his life and he wants a damn kobe beef meatball. The appetizer meatball is one huge one and the spaghetti meatballs come with smaller meatballs. I tried a piece and it tasted just like a regular ole meatball to me. Sorry, don't know what to tell you haha. I ordered a cream pasta with zucchini blossoms and shaved truffles. It was as good as it sounds. The decor inside is beautiful and I could just sit in there forever because it was so nice.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

21UoN-wl20fHGGAks6CH_w.text: Eh. Pros: Seating was very comfortable. Entrees were delicious & perfectly cooked. Cons: Prices are crazy. Which maybe is expected at the Venetian/Palazzo in Las Vegas. House Salad was 1/2 a bag of mixed greens w a drizzle of red wine vinegar for $17. Antipasto was not tasty. Overly pickled w hummus. Which is bizarre & tasted way too strongly of cumin. Garlic bread was ok. Staff was too big for their britches. Music loud and not in sync w ambience.

a0lvg81th6h5_Ww8eGR_cg.text: If I were able to rate the water guys, then yes I would fully give them 5 stars easily. They gave our party of 9 the best service ever. Our server didn't seem too fond of us or trying to convince us that our experience at Lavo was exceptional. She was not attentive and warming whatsoever. The food was OK and nothing really jumped out saying this was amazing and wanted to have it again.   If asked to return, then I would kindly decline.

a_u25t7L0XJfpLusf-4V5w.text: We had Saturday brunch here. At 10:00a we practically had the restaurant to ourselves. The staff were very friendly and eager to serve. You literally have a team looking after your every need - which thanks to their alertness, are few, if any.   Our primary server was helpful in making menu suggestions. We enjoyed the almond-crusted french toast very much! The fresh squeezed orange juice was a delight and the coffee had just the right amount of kick to ease us into our day. The restaurant itself is beautiful, adding to the enjoyment of the meal.   The breakfast panini looked nothing like the picture of it on the website and was a bit flat. The fruit plate was flavorful (particularly the persimmon), but the plating was disheveled.   We will happily return and urge you to make it part of your next Vegas itinerary!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stunning restaurant and delicious plates

i9YxPf-adhd66SbprfZnQA.text: Clearly there's nothing Italian about this place. And if you think the food here is anything Italian or good you must be from the flyover states. The ambience and atmosphere is kind of nice but the terrible food and service make up for being a terrible place

z7IYfC3nzgiKccWmK-fCxw.text: Had a great dinner at this restaurant... the meatballs are amazing! DJ on the deck is awesome. We can't wait to return.

KEMAL0zVx4tt293NX2u7pA.text: Valentines dinner was amazing. We had a very friendly waiter and buser. Meet a very nice couple who was seated next to us. I've waited my entire life and I'm surprised I've never eaten here. The grilled octopus is amazing. And of course we had to try the 20 layer peanut butter and chocolate cake.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Valentines day
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must have dessert but easily feeds four. 20 layer peanut butter chocolate cake

TeH0TXKXECKerniwxMl6yg.text: Had drinks here on a recent Saturday night. It's very fancy and rather expensive. Kinda like once in a lifetime type of places, for me anyhow.   Service was awesome. Not sure why it doesn't get better reviews. Must be the Internet trolls like the South Park episode where Cartman plays a professional Yelper!

Ih0wdIcPONrBPADZBR73LA.text: I'd say 3.5 stars is accurate  but I have to say that I'm disappointed with Lavo. I called to make reservations and was excited to go there as a late dinner because we wanted to hang out at the lounge after our meal. I specifically asked the girl that I booked reservations through what time the dj comes on and made our dinner based in that (she said 10pm). we get there at 9pm on a Thursday  (it's pretty empty)and have a drink at the bar and ask the bartender where the lounge is and he says "oh he lounge is currently closed for renovations". So that was a major bummer be we had based our night around that. So anyway we had dinner and it was Good-shared a bunch of things from the grilled octopus to the meatballs to pasta. All food was good but overall I was disappointed based on the lounge situation.

p0nrEmO1a7paZIejZm6Lqg.text: Great location & beautiful restaurant. Excellent service. Went for Brunch. Best deal, bottomless Mimosas! Unfortunately food was just ok, but price isn't expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless Mimosas

HiML5Oh4jkKnJZ7NYNo-fw.text: We made same day reservations and were seated immediately when we arrived. Our seats were sooo close to the other table I felt as though we were being listened to and there was zero sense of a romantic evening in our future.   We sat down and our waiter soon came, very nice guy (forgot his name) ordered our drinks and then took our orders. We started with the polenta fries and the complimentary garlic bread. I loved both but hubby didn't care for the polenta fries, he's super picky. Then on to our dinner, my hubby ordered the chicken parm and said it was just meh. For $28 it should have been wow! I however loved my dinner! I ordered the spicy pasta with clams, scallops, huge shrimp and mussels. It was spicy but I loved that! Oh and the scallops were sooo tiny but there was so much other yimmyness in my bowl I didn't even care! Overall, this place was nice but we won't probably be back. For $200 for a nice dinner out we should have been wow'd and there was zero wow factor for us! Way to many amazing places in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LRLN3Hw_WENVK8JGcDia1A.text: Great restaurant.  They have a great selection and great service.  I love coming here to eat then later it turns into a night club.  It's conveniently located in the Vanetian.

HapAengErWz6MVyhRMgKbg.text: We are locals and support the 3square restaurant week. We narrowed our options for the last night to Charlie Palmer or LAVO. We decided LAVO. When we arrived we were asked if we would prefer to sit inside or outside. We said inside and then the hostess proceeded to walk us to our table. She took us outside. We told her we asked for inside and she said she misheard. We told her it was a nice night so outside was fine. She then had us wait for her to go and talk to her manager? So then when we finally were sat we felt like we were unwanted and rushed the whole time. Our waitress seemed annoyed that we were there. She had an attitude when we told her we didn't need the full menu because we were there for restaurant week and literally made me feel like she thought I was poor and not worth her time. She didn't even take the menus when our order was placed, like usual. When she did come back for them I told her I'd like to keep the cocktail menu and she threw the rest of them back on the table with the same "I'm wasting her time" attitude. I ran out of water and she passed my table many times and never noticed, while addressing the tables around us regularly. Finally I had to ask a passing bus boy for more water after I got desperate. (Sure asking for water isn't a huge deal but LAVO is supposed to be elevated and not cheap). The food was delicious but when it came time for dessert, we ordered the tiramisu and without telling us they ran out, they just brought us 2 of something we didn't order or want. A Nutella cake..... again it was tasty but not what I wanted and to bring it as a replacement without even asking or telling us about the mishap is unprofessional. They finally offered to let us choose a new dessert option after the manager came over and apologized for the dessert  but it didn't make up for it, and I'll never be going back. That didn't make up for the rest of the night. The 2 stars I gave were for the food taste only. The lack of the 3 were based on the unprofessionalism, and attitude towards customer service.  We should have went to Charlie Palmer steak or a Jose Andres again.

lht26a6KRzgdfSiRYWg9bg.text: Very good Italian food with very generous portions! Obviously when you're in Vegas you need to do some carb-loading before you go out for the night. That is how we chose to go to LAVO on a Saturday night. Between four girls we ordered the meatball with salad, truffle fries, margherita pizza, spinach and artichoke pizza, ravioli, and rigatoni. It was SO much food. We could have split two pizzas and the meatball. But, the food was all delicious. My spinach and artichoke pizza was one of the best / most unique pizzas I've had in a while. The ambiance of LAVO is really cool and they play good music, just loud enough so you can still chat with your friends easily. Service was friendly and attentive. I'm giving four stars instead of five because the inside of the meatball was cold and the truffles fries were a bit cold too. The main dishes were awesome.

1WaGwb_mqKzrbIzDqFZJkg.text: We made reservations to treat our friend who lives out in Vegas, surprisingly this was his first time.   I ordered the chicken, it was literally a half roasted chicken. While my friend got 6 pieces of amazing ravioli. Other friend ordered chicken/mushroom ravioli I believe. I was a bit scared on how we were going to finish it, but we did!   Service was great, our waiter was really funny (along with most of the employees). The ambiance is very similar to the Penthouse Floor of Mastro's (Beverly Hills). They also had a nice selection of wine which I did enjoy. I was really pleased with the service and will be back. There was no attitude towards the guests dining which was noticed and appreciated by myself.

KeAuBXiVU9l-SaJdU7Zvwg.text: Great dining experience in the upstairs area. Meatballs were the best I've had! Will definitely come back

cyFAncgHCTmwLfYWYNSz2w.text: The place was really nice. Has a DJ and great ambience. Although we got sat right away... we got put it in the corner next to a lot of traffic coming through and it bothered us quite a bit. Since it was very crowded, we got bumped a couple times and complained about it but got ignored a few times until the table next to us also complained. So they finally moved us towards the center of the restaurant and gave us and the table that was next to us complimentary desserts.   Other than that the food was pretty good and I'd give the place a second shot. Hopefully it was just one bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The husband and sister in law seated very closely to the other table.... with very little room to move around haha

jZcd4I_QsFAKzRforiGOCQ.text: I wanted this to be an amazing night. Not. Pros: The calamari was good. The wedge salad yummy. Portions size big. Cons: The service was terrible. One waiter for a ton of tables. No coffee refill EVER. Even when asking. The main course yucky. Don't order Chicken Dominick. waited and waited to be asked for dessert or check. We had to flag the manager to get it. Oh and seating...be sure to request a nice seat. Ours was an end booth where the wait staff stacked all the dirty dishes on trays all night. Crashing down 6" from my head. The manager was nice and offered to comp dessert but at that point we were so annoyed we said no thank you and paid for an overpriced crappy meal.

KjMheY_9wBm26_6AYOTlWA.text: So this place is technically located in the Palazzo and not the Venetian. It's better to walk on the street to get to the entrance than trying to go through the casino to get between the two. We went here for a New Years Eve party and I have to say I had a great time. The food they had was standard bar fare, but delicious. The tempura shrimp was the best part. Honestly, everyone was more interested in the drinks anyway. Luckily, they had multiple bars set up all over the downstairs and the upstairs part of the club so the line wasn't too long. the bartender mixed us some pretty amazing LITs all night long.   I think this place would be really nice as a regular restaurant during the day as well, but by 12 on New Years Eve it was just trashed. They really needed to have a better clean up staff. There were empty cups and half eaten food everywhere. Having a hallways filled with sinks with running water is a nice decorative touch, but to drunken guests on NYE, its just another place to vomit. Also, after midnight, people started to leave to the sister club, Tao, for Snoopdog's New Year party so the place cleared out pretty quickly. The patio was a nice place to watch the fireworks, but obviously way too crowded to be pleasant. Also, you can't really see the fireworks on the rest of the strip from there. We had a good time, for the time that we were there, but clearly, this was just a place to start the night for some people.

oSf4rQMQjA_WwMLzjKFsOg.text: Nightclub review: Surprisingly not too bad  Vegas during NYE weekend is always a hot mess. We were staying at Palazzo & had a pretty crappy ratio (more guys than girls overall, though last minute, some of the guys decided not to go clubbing & we had an even ratio) so we decided to try our luck at LAVO. Especially because it was FREEZING outside and no one wanted to trek out of the hotel. If you are a guest at the hotel, you can get yourself on the Concierge's guestlist. But honestly, I'm not sure how strict they are with guestlist because the promoter/bouncers didn't even check a list. All they cared about was how many females are in your party.   the good: - guys can (potentially) get in free if you have at least a 1:1 ratio. which we did have, but SOME SHIESTY PARTY OF GUYS in front of us absorbed our party and TOOK OUR FREE GUY PASSES. What d-bags. So our guys had to pay $30 each.  - we were there for Vice Sunday and the music was REALLY GOOD. Mostly hip hop & the mixes were awesome.  - Lines were pretty short around 10:30pm.  - they threw out free glowsticks!!!   the bad: - dance floor is ridiculously small. packed like sardines. which is serious buzzkill for those of us who likes to dance!

JxPWj0BCJRlBffWiU07HuA.text: Service & drinks were wonderful but unfortunately we were a little disappointed. Started with the wedge with heirloom tomatoes & pancetta.... Huge & Very good. Both of us ordered spaghetti & Kobe meatballs. Spaghetti was cooked well and the meatballs were very moist however it was all too salty. The server informed a manager after we told him it was salty...which we were not making a big deal about just a honest answer to how things were. They were very apologetic and offered to bring something else but both of us were full from the amount we ate so we declined. I will go back & give it a second try because I really like the place.

XuSo6lWSk80bKwn9u33fAA.text: Went here for the nightclub on a sunday night. Short line, no cover, but super crowded inside! The dance floor was small, but they had tons of good music!   However, since the area was small and it was jammed packed with people, it was hard to navigate to the bar or to anywhere! Thus, once you're in there, be prepare to stay there or else you'll have trouble finding a room to dance!!  Overall, it was alright, would I go back again? Maybe.

I_O9AubyCMdnUaDJhdSoyg.text: My fiance seen a restorante, but forgot the full name. So we walked around and could not find it. So we came across Lavo. This was a nice place and pricey. The food was ok. We started with oysters and was delicioso. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs was awesome, it melts in your mouth. My fiance had the spaghetti carbonera and it was ok. It was buttery and it had bacon. The service was good, they kept checking on us. Probably thought we would dine and dash. Might be a place to go back.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti carbonera with bacon bits.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs with feta

jYrozQrMHyCHJUFhqQJS7g.text: Lavo is my fave place to dine in Vegas! I love the Kobe beef meatball, the creamy lobster bisque soup , the garlic bread w sauce, everything is so YUMMY!! Quality of food is top notch! Def go and eat any occasion!!! It's the best!!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k2Wk6GJyqPh1Z3k5rSLoYQ.text: I haven't eaten here, but I've definitely partied here.  LAVO has got to be the best place to be on Sunday nights- VICE Sundays. DJ Vice is the sh*t. Before heading out, my buddy asked me what his DJ style is like, and the best way I can describe it is high energy the whole time, except this last time when he rounded off the night with Drake/The Weeknd's "Crew Love."  If you can get on a guestlist, you won't have to wait in line and can probably get in free, and girls can get free drinks until midnight.  Whatever your plans are for Sunday nights in Vegas, cancel them and go to LAVO.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VICE Sundays with DJ Vice

4evK035zyh2aNUsSfoeCiQ.text: Nice restaurant/club/lounge. Italian food is good, but not great. Noisy atmosphere. DJ plays in the restaurant while you eat. Hard to have dinner conversation.  My biggest problem with Lavo was the service, from start to finish. Checked in for my 830 reservation & was told they were "running a little behind". Fine. 45 minutes later we finally got seated. No apology. No "let me buy you a drink while you wait". No manager checking on us or offering anything for the inconvenience.  Tables are, of course, on top of each other. Waiters do a good job, but are over loaded. They are running constantly. Do not look for too much attention.   Lastly, we had a "mystery charge" on our bill, which I assume most people pay unnecessarily if they don't read the check. I understand mistakes happen & I wouldn't mention this as a negative except that I noticed the same waiter had the same "mistake" with the couple two tables away from us immediately before we paid our bill. I guess we weren't ordering enough to run up the bill so they did it for us. Of course, no apology was forthcoming from, the manager upon his correction of this error either.  With all of the restaurant choices in Vegas (or just at The Venetian for that matter) I am surprised this place is surviving.  I'll never go back.

FTdP76lFBqLCbALV47RvQw.text: This place has the best Chicken Parmesan I have ever had. And this is my favorite meal ever and I have tried this at hundreds of restaurants! Wow, this blew me away. It was served as a huge portion in a square shape. Very thin, and creative the way it was cooked and presented. I am planning a trip back to Las Vegas in the coming months just to have this again!

nvJN0hpIWFM3OfmeSLyv_A.text: Complete trash and they had my table split our own checks and figure out the tax on it and write it down

SoApXj4fDaSAaAqB5X9zBQ.text: THIS PLACE IS POPPIN ON SAT for the Champagne brunch.   Went there around 215-230 no cover for our group of guys.  The ratio was literally 4 girls to 1 guy and more girls just kept coming in.  Once 3:30pm starts the lights go down and it becomes a nightclub! Super fun and chill environment.   Food was good at the bar and the drinks are strong. There is an outside patio too which was nice.   Tiesto was there when I went and he was partying it up. You get Champagne goggle glasses to protect your eyes and it's just one crazy party!   Definitely coming back during non-pool season

8U2egizDaJcCAMNTiIpBUA.text: We sat outside for a nice dinner for my sisters birthday and while we were eating the main course not 1 BUT FOUR COCKROACHES WERE AROUND OUR TABLE!!!! I complained to the waiter didn't even offer us anything in return, i explained i have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world and never ever experienced such an occurrence!!  I am truly DISGUSTED and i could not finish my meal... i love palazzo and venetian equally I have been coming back for over 16 years but this is a new low!!!

FRzMkBnP18Iwig6ZY5kNpg.text: Items selected:  Illy Coffee Balsamica - Rum, Rhubarb, Basil, Strawberry Pastry Basket - Everything Bagel, Focaccia, Oreo Scone, Cronut Chocolate Hazelnut, Strawberry, Creme Anglaise Dip Breakfast Mac & Cheese - Two Fried Eggs, Truffled Shells, Pancetta Almond Crusted French Toast - Cinnamon Panettone, Fresh Berry, Banana Chicken and Waffles - Cap'n Crunch Crusted Chicken, Bourbon Maple Syrup, Spiced Pecans Warm Chocolate Bread Pudding - Vanilla Ice Cream, Duce de Leche Sauce  A favorite of friends for their signature meatballs, thumping bass, and eye candy I'd never paid much attention to Lavo until I heard rumor that a "proper" Sunday brunch had been introduced - an interesting menu, beautiful strip views, and proximity to both Bouchon and Ferragamo making it a worthy destination for 2pm brunch on my mother's last day in town.  An ornate space clearly befitting its trendy nightclub roots with friendly, though somewhat cocktail-pushy service and excessive hyperbole (no, your chef did not 'create' the cronut, nor was he the first to coat chicken with the cap'n) it was with the aforementioned bread basket, freely refilled coffee, and a cocktail that our meal began and with the basket particularly impressive given its complimentary nature it was much to my delight that the rest of the cuisine followed suit; substantial delay due to our waiter flirting with two tables full of sorority girls notwithstanding.  Electing to sample two sweets and two savories it was with a trio of selections and the smooth, dense, and semi-molten-centered bread pudding to follow that our meal progressed and attempting to abstain from exaggeration I will simply say that if I returned I'd be hard pressed not to order the exact same thing, the French Toast harkening a fruit infused Bostock and the pasta a peerless example of knowing how to use truffle oil with restraint, the end result a dish warranting an extra slice of focaccia to sop up every drop of the eggy aromatic cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry Basket - Everything Bagel, Focaccia, Oreo Scone, Cronut
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry Basket - Everything Bagel, Focaccia, Oreo Scone, Cronut (complimentary)
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Balsamica - Rum, Rhubarb, Basil, Strawberry

IijPP5z7-0MbsUIYXxIvhw.text: Service was outstanding. Food was fantastic . Great ambience with great music for dinner. Will definitely be back !

BDKTiDz-C_Lj-5xeHjtqng.text: Been to Lavo a few times before for the nightlife and nothing really caught my attention except for the open bar before 11pm and the guaranteed walk in to XS right after, but Lavo sure left  a lasting impression the last time I was there.  Winter in Vegas: Ever find yourself bored as hell during the day without summer's Tao Beach, Wet Republic, Rehab, Encore Beach, etc... ? Now presenting Lavo Brunch... untz untz untz. Yes it is your typical nice brunch with fancy shmancy table settings, classy food, mimosas, champagne, etc. Imagine that... BUT add dimmed lights. strobe lights. excessive amounts of alcohol. glow sticks/bracelets. neon colored sunglasses. bumping music. aaaaaaaaaand girls dancing on top of these fancy tables.   Lavo just took brunch to another level. Love it.

ScOYUdf94NUg7gizpJGgMA.text: Had a reservation got right in. Was seated inside even though I requested patio seating. They sat my table of 4 right next to a huge corporate event it looked like. So we ended up with all the servers behinds in our face and them bumping into us to serve the huge party their food. My fiance had us moved and to where? The patio. Was basically empty and more quiet. We started off with some female server then another server came up to her and accused her of stealing his table? So we ended up with him instead now. The other wait staff was really nice and attentive. my fiance had the "Dominic crispy chicken" there was nothing cripsy about it - merley browned if that. I had the chicken parmigiano and it tasted great but the chicken didn't look cooked. Looked extra white. Next day both of us woke up with stomach issues. For the price of Lavo they should know how to make chicken. Come on. We are locals and will not be back. I would recommend to go to maggiano's instead. I always read about how they make birthday desserts anniversary desserts - I put on The reservation we were celebrating two anniversaries and we got offered nothing

-SHytl9X7uIeUbFNDlbNtw.text: Amazing as always. For those who complain about reservations and getting pagers, they can't control when people sit there talking for hours after they're done eating. The experience is worth the 10 minute wait. On a Friday night at 9:30pm, we were seated in 2 minutes.   The restaurant has a live dj, and the atmosphere is a little loud. There was an older couple next to us who really didn't like the music (typical dance music with some 90s remixes), but there was a few bachelorette parties who seemed to enjoy it.   Their signature drinks are amazing (try the white tiger) or call your own. The bartenders are friendly and have a heavy hand if you put your phone down and talk to them.   Food. Beef carpaccio is worth every penny if you're into the raw stuff. After trying it at dozens of restaurants in Vegas, I can say hands down, this is the best. The pizzas are to die for, and the spinach and artichoke is no exception. Spaghetti and meatballs is great to if you want pasta, and the steaks are just as great if you're craving meat. I'm not a seafood person but people I've gone with, rave about the fish as well. The (free) garlic bread they bring you, will fill you up as well because you can't stop eating it.   When you're done, try the Oreo zeppole and hope you've saved room. They're battered and deep fried and come out very soft. The other desserts are good, but this one is the best - ask your server, it's the most popular.   Needless to say, I will keep coming back.

MgpQbML3YbQo7eNdGv8zcw.text: Since I am a local, I come here all the time for dinner with my girlfriends and they never let us down. the food is amazing!!! everything on the menu is delicious. I've tried all sorts...garlic bread *drool*, calamari *drool*, flatbread pizza *double drool*.... then to pasta, salmon, and chicken. You won't be disappointed in my opinion.   At Lavo, you can have dinner downstairs at the restaurant and then head upstairs to start the night away. Super!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon dish
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pizza

tKU18GD2q-Aqeyb-82YgIg.text: Dinner was delicious. Started with the meatball with whipped ricotta and ended with an amazing shrimp scampi. Second time here and will come again.

t0m4WanPPY6NVej9hkQbUQ.text: I had no idea this place was also an italian restaurant aside from the nightclub. I think next time I'm gonna try the food here =P  But anyway, came here on my last night in Vega$$$ (sunday) with 4 others and had a good time. My friend's friend was celebrating her birthday and apparently got a table so that's why we decided to hit up LAVO or else I would have had no plans and just chilled for the last night since I went clubbing both Friday & Saturday nights and my feet were sooo beat up from being stepped out, my new heels breaking in..etc. =T  But nonetheless, had a good time with good company. Pregamed with captain morgan (ugh) but it did its job and got me prettty buzzed by the time I got in the club. ^_^ Luckily, my friend was a promoter so got us in pretty quick. The lines weren't that long yet 'cause we arrived around 10. The club has a nice interior, much smaller, and it was poppin'.   Drink prices are the usual. Forgot what I ordered for my homeboys, pineapple and vodka/rum? I forgot.. and they don't even remember. LOL  The reason why I'm giving it 3 stars though... is the crowd. Mehhh. Got to the dance flo and wasn't that pleased even when I was buzzed! But it's all good, still had a good time!! Danced with my girlfriend all night long :o) Got so tired around 1 and left 'cause we were getting hungry.. so we missed DJ Vice's birthday celebration.    P.S. I loveeed walking through Venetian. Sooo purttty =)

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. buzzzzin&#39;
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. twinzy :)

6z_t3MZgoODXpIoPm9SMDg.text: This review is for the nightclub, as I didn't eat at the restaurant. I came to Lavo during my trip to Vegas right before Christmas. A promoter stopped my twin and I in the street and invited us to go so we said why not.   It was a Sunday and I had no clue what the parties were like on that day, or how the crowds or bouncers would be. But the bouncers were nice and we got right in and headed up to the club. When I hear "nightclub" I think monstrous open space. That would make Lavo a lounge...a pretty small one. We got there at a decent time and it was already pretty full, but an hour later it was just too cramped to enjoy (I'm more of a sexy lounge type of girl).   As others noted, the crowd was most definitely Asian. I was there with my sister to have fun so I really didn't care, but people looking to pick up someone (or be picked up) should keep it in mind if they're expecting a more diverse selection.   But regardless, I did enjoy myself (without alcohol, I might add) and might check it out again if I was in town. The DJ was pretty awesome that night and I still have my foam glow sticks = )

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavo Nightclub
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foam party
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go-go dancer

gErLxAL5axD1Yo9Q-XWLoA.text: Went here last Wednesday (12/28/11) Got in at Midnight with promoter hookup. I went with my wife and some family. We had a BLAST! Danced until 3:30 am. The dance floor was crowded, like, just move your shoulders up and down crowded. We did that for a couple of songs and just headed to the bar. The entire club was packed and we actually got good service from the bar tenders. We found a little area by the back bar and just danced there and ordered drinks.  Dance Floor = Small, but fun MUSIC = I liked it! Bunch of great beats for Dancing. DRINKS = A little pricey, but, it is Vegas! My wallet wasn't hurting after a night of drinking. VIEW = Lots of good looking peeps to check out.  We had a GREAT time here and would come back again. Others may have been disappointed or upset, but, I don't go out to clubs as much as I used to, and this was just plain fun! You do need to get over the fact that you get pushed and sometimes there is a line for the rest room, but, it's a club and you will find that at any other club, no matter how nice it is.  I would definitely suggest finding a VIP promotionto get into this place. We did not wait long in the VIP line.   Looking forward to going back!

Rq9VukNIBo3TG_-F9wN1jg.text: As guests at the Palazzo, the wife and I got free line-jump/no cover coupons, so we just visited the club on Saturday night. Decor is sweet. Like the name implies, it's going for a bathhouse motif. Walking across a bridge with running faucets that overlooks the restaurant and up a staircase where two scantily-clad hotties in a bathtub are making out and into the club which features about 40 tables, two go-go dancers doing their thing, a moderate size dance floor and a bar area. Awesome.  A more mature, sophisticated crowd. Everyone seemed to be having a good time, I know I was. DJ played it safe and inoffensive, nothing but classic hits.  I will say that the drinks were pricey. I get that it's a club, but $19 for a gin and tonic? Really?! I haven't paid that in SF, NY, or LA, so why is Vegas charging that??) I also find it interesting that they apparently have gender-based prices: my wife and her male cousin both ordered the same beer: hers was $5 and his was $9. Huh. Never seen that before.   Bottle service starts at around $550 and run upwards of $3k, but the table hostesses all seemed hot, friendly and they dance at the tables, so you're probably paying a bit more than usual but you're also getting more too.  But at the end of the day, I had a great time and I'd go again.

xXX_u2TiwPi41iJs_uaq6Q.text: Lavo- came here on sunday and the crowd was late 20's and up. This place is pretty small but for a sunday it is really crackin. Barely have space to walk around and get around the dance floor BUT i love this place. Good crowd of people on sunday and good music. This place really topped my weekend at vegas. From what i have heard LAVO and Vanity are really good places on sunday.

ShLwUoFYJ551WnVEPzPtbA.text: I came here last Friday for dinner (see Public House review).  I'm Local, and this was my 2nd visit in 5 yrs or so. ATMOSPHERE- Just the way I like, dark, rich and great decor.  We were 'walk-ins' around 7pm or so.  Hostess did not 'insult' when we said we did not have reservations. We were seated at at 2-top in about 10-15 min. No bad. But 2-top so close to next 2-top we almost had "dinner guests". We had a glass candle holder-nice, two glasses of water along with salt/pepper...I asked the waitress "where are we going to put our plates, and salads on this tiny table?"  Note to self: NEVER AGAIN. FOOD- (my guy and I usually share because we don't like to take food home). I told our waitress we planned to share and would need extra plates.  She was very kind and upbeat.  We enjoyed the garlic bread with marinara sauce --complimentary. Our order: wedge salad, eggplant appetizer and of course one of their famous  'Meat Balls'  ($22), we both had a glass of ZIN.  What a pleasant surprise- the waitress had our salad divided BEFORE serving.  This was the largest wedge salad I have ever seen.  I am sure the price was high, I don't remember- but I was impressed... And the taste was also great.  Here came the 'meatball' (we ordered the one with Ricotta on top and it looked like a mtn of whipped cream)  YUMMM IS ALL I CAN SAY! and this 'ball' is big enough to share with 4 if needed.   Now to the eggplant, our waitress said it was her 'favorite', but 'heavy'.  She explained the eggplant is sliced lengthwise in very,very thin sheets and layered like lasagna.  This was delicious, but a meal for 2 hungry or 4 to taste and enjoy--yes very filling and I had to take home and gave to my daughter.  So, with that said, the salad and meatball would be perfect for two. SERVICE- great. NOISE- NOISE and, oh I almost forgot-NOISE- This place was the loudest with yelling people trying to talk over each other that I've been in for longer than I can remember.  The music in background, OK, the yelling, crazy.  Our 'almost dinner guest' next to us actually screamed to get some friends passing by to see them- this scream right into my ear, I actually jumped.  The friends then huddled around our teenie table and one actually used my guy's chair back to lean on all during their over 5 minute visit.  Yep they were going to 'Old town' and yep they would meet up later and yep they reviewed their food YA-DA-YA-DA. This, not the fault of LAVO, just rude people. PRICE- "Vegas Gourmet"...you got it... $$$   That's a mea-ta-ball!

qMa9b313pdmZccl2xnQ6bQ.text: Still not a fan of LAVO nightclub. Went here for our comped drinks and danced for a bit and left. The dance floor is very small and doesn't compare to the energy you'd find elsewhere. There's not much going on here, nextttt.

M6U5muF3JKvxod2s-8mSzQ.text: My review is only for the nightclub and reads like the musical experience there.   If my group hadn't thrown down for bottle service ---LET ME HEAR ALL YOU OUT OF STATERS ---there is no doubt this place ---- YEAH, YEAH, YEAH, UUUUUGH ----would have gotten one star ---RIP MICHAEL JACKSON---. It was really crowded ---PUT YOUR HANDS UP IF YOU WERE BORN IN THE 70S OR 80S-----and the dance floor is really ---WHO'S FROM CALIFORNIA-----small.   The DJ spinning the night we went was horrific, but he seems to love to hear himself talk and somehow he thinks he's "world renowned". For the entire night, there wasn't one song he didn't interrupt. There are some songs that just shouldn't be messed with or interrupted but he couldn't make it 45 seconds without hollering. It messed up the groove and wrecked songs.   Luckily nothing can get a bachelorette party down.

HzXZTJOID6rBQCmBjk39_A.text: Free for local ladies (not sure if it's only on certain nights). Music alternates between hiphop and house. (I wish they played more hiphop/top 40 because I hate house music). Every hour or so they blast foam bubbles onto the dance floor. One time when we were there, they gave out free glow sticks to the people on the dance floor. Dance floor starts to get packed around midnight and there's hardly any room to move around (this was on a Sun when they used to be open on Sun).

ZZcB6NVNuarrSEhWwT08OQ.text: Reviewing the club here.    This is, hands down, the WORST club I've ever been to in Vegas.  Even if I could get in here for free (which, being a reasonably unconnected regular dude, that won't be happening), I would not.  I don't know what is wrong with the bartenders here, but when you get not one but two AMFs that taste like water, that's a BIG red flag.    Also, the club itself is pretty darn small so it gets crowded VERY quickly.  Trying to get from one side of the club to another anytime around midnight is an exercise in futility that only the brave and flexible should attempt.  This makes it extremely uncomfortable when you're trying to do anything useful like, say, breathing.  Or moving.  Or getting away from the drunk cougar who's trying to put her hand in your pocket.    Which reminds me, the crowd here is definitely older.  Avoid this place entirely.

88gqei42TxZSD7C-FCf09g.text: went here with a group of friends and we were able to catch the open bar, so the girl's in our group was pretty happy with that. This place isn't the best and it's not the worst!  if you're looking for a small & chill clubs, this is probably your best bet.

GNEbj72LGrfWP5LfbLXeeg.text: This place has super nice decor.  Not that I want to come off as an Italian food expert, but for the price and the time, it simply was not worth it. If you compare this place to Carluccio's Tivoli Garden or Buca di Beppo, the quality should be better, and it simply was not.   I was here when the club was packed. Lines were filling up the entire casino corridor and I felt like I had to get through so many people just to find the group to which I was joining.   If the dinner wasn't free, I would have been an unhappy person that is for sure!  Comped dinners probably don't allow you to order whatever you want, so that may be a factor in my experience, but I was still not impressed and this is what I have to share about this place...

Ko8acgNVrtjW-pPCg9_t1A.text: This review is for the restaurant, not the nightclub.  Lavo was recommended by a coworker, and it did not disappoint.  The atmosphere was nice, albeit crowded.  We actually had to wait 30 minutes beyond our reservation, but the resulting choice of a free appetizer was complete redemption (calamari - best I've ever had.)  I had the Spaghetti with Kobe Beef Meatballs.  As a huge Italian fan, I think spaghetti is the real measure of a restaurant, and this was as good as I can remember.  The portion size is overwhelming, so eat the meatballs early, or you will suffer pasta remorse.  As a side note, my wife's Chicken & Mushroom Ravioli was great as well, but couldn't compete with this.  Dessert sounded appetizing, but as much as we wanted to, neither of us could handle it after the main course.  I'm coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

05jjP98_ZJRJUlkJg5bncg.text: Stopped in for just a drink after a show. The bartender, Bree was fantastic.we had a Pinot noir and a prosecco. The place was pretty busy with diners even at 11:00 pm. We asked Bree if there was outdoor seating and chatted about the restaurant. She was very very personable. She offered to take us outside for our second drink (both Proseccos as we are celebrating our 40th anniversary!)  we sat outside on comfy couches with a view of Treaure Island and theit pirate ships all lit up. t was a nice way to end an evening. Will definitely go back next trip to Vegas but it will be for dinner. Thank you Bree for your excellent service!

HOUhUMAEmsu1ru9Fxsx-Eg.text: Went here on a Saturday night for dinner before a night out in Vegas. To be honest the setting is great - nice lofty, extravagant restaurant feel you want when you're in Vegas but the food was just a bit 'meh' and the worst thing was the air-conditioning. We had to ask to be moved to a more central table just to get body heat off the rest of the diners and we saw other tables do the same or put their jackets back on.   We were a group of 4 and share 2 pizzas and 2 salads - which were all just ok. The pizza's were fairly dry as they only seemed to use chopped tomatoes as a sauce base rather than any passata and the salads were measly for around $18-19 a pop!  It was Ok but I wouldn't rush back.

CF55dm98c5GDriBGk-XNTw.text: So disappointing!  The food was average - I've had much better Italian in little ol' Columbus Ohio.    Highlights: the garlic bread and the service.  We were about to order WAY too much food and our server stopped us in our tracks.  He saved us a ton of money and waste - it was greatly appreciated.  Lowlights: the famous meat ball - good but not fabulous and the salmon was fishy.    With all the great restaurants in Vegas this is not worth it.

dBUpUMliC6J7PmrN89VNgg.text: $1350 for bottle service.  Terrible.  We had a table, but they don't have a really defined area, so people were milling into our area.  They just put up ropes, which people move.  We basically kept getting shoved into our table.  Not good.  And a fight broke out.  Classy.  Is was SO crowded (even the staff was complaining)...it took forever to even walk to the door because of the mass amount of people.  I'm sure it was a fire hazard.  It was claustrophobic and awful.  The place is small, so you'd think they'd limit the number of people allowed in.  But no.  We were sardines...that paid $1350.  Avoid avoid avoid.

NT2rI4XOklaUCu-sgt8CoA.text: I travelled about 3000 miles to eat at Assagio's...oh wait, I'm eating at Lavo??? So the food was just ok.  I ordered the fettucini alfredo that could have come out of any Italian restaurant.  My sister's pasta was overly adante....or more like undercooked.  The service was slow and inattentive for a popular restaurant.  They brought out the appetizer before giving us any plates.  We even had to ask for plates haha maybe they wanted us to go at it savage style.  The best part of the meal was the complimentary garlic bread.  The decor and atmosphere was very nice.  Good for business meetings, dates and friends' outings.    The reason for the extra star is because we came back for the nightclub and they put us in front of the line and gave us a complimentary table and drinks :)  Way to make a customer feel special!  The club area was small as well as the dance floor.  The music wasn't really my style as they were playing some random oldies.  The stairs on the way out were poorly lit, or rather not lit at all, causing my sis to fall.  But a second after, we were surrounded by flashlights and 8 gentlemen catering to our every need so plus to them for noticing!  I would come back again for the club, maybe not the restaurant.

DYzzSFe3V-GDDhH6ITlO7g.text: I only know about the restaurant, and frankly it's all I need to know.   I ate off of a special restaurant week menu, which thankfully had everything I wanted to try on it. But before I get into my ordered food, I have to discuss the garlic bread. If I told you there was crack in here you'd understand and still eat it. This is the best garlic bread in the world.   For an app I got the calamari, which was excellent. Entree I had a chicken parm that was only 10% smaller than my plate. I was shocked when it didn't come with a side of spaghetti, but honestly it would've gone to waste. This was the emperor of chicken parm.  And lastly but honestly you should probably eat this first because it's so good is the Oreo zeppole. Dip it in the shake, eat it whole, take small bites, do whatever you need to eat this little piece of heaven.  Whenever I'm in town again I'm guaranteeing another trip.

c9bdmm5qpKjBebBK5R-LmQ.text: We kicked off girls weekend here with some family style food and pitchers of cocktails.  The food was excellent, specifically the Kobe meatball (which was huge), polenta fries, and fried zucchini.  We shared a huge pitcher of the cocktail 'Sicilian sun' which felt bottomless.  The pitchers of cocktails is the way to go if 3 or more of you are going to drink. Our waitress was awesome and we had a great time.  All in all a 5 star experience.

sdauLP7dyCrsO5lwpVJPjA.text: This review is for the club only** Forgot which night I came here but the night that we came , there was an open bar for the ladies which was pretty cool . This place is alright but kinda small . Also , I tripped when going down the stairs upon leaving due to the darkness which was embarrassing . I could barely see the steps because there was no lights on the steps to make it stand out or anything .

84jC8RtSHCgomD028Ap9ww.text: Service terrible. We waited forever to get our food.  Would not recommend!  Coming from NY -  food was just OK.  Nothing to write home about.  Rice balls had to get sent back. Kobe ricotta meatball was good. The spaghetti with the whole lobster de shelled  was definitely not a whole lobster.  The yellowfin tuna was good. Definitely was not worth the money.  You had to ask for a glass of water. Drinks were watered down. If you have a few hours to kill and not interested in a good meal this is the place for you.

EXysnZw3dF1tcaGqMXOCdA.text: Beautiful ambiance, and very accommodating despite of us being late for our reservation. great food and Tyler our server fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kGGwEsf8zzAmk42dueX2uQ.text: This has to be one of the top Italian spots in Vegas. Live atmosphere with an open floor plan & this unique energized feel. I went with 6 friends and ordered off their family style menu and it was an awesome way to experience everything they offered. Highly recommend it - $65 per person and gives you a well rounded group of items. A few included : 2 cuts of steak - Filet & Bone-In Rib Eye - which were the best items we had. The Center Cut Filet literally melted in your mouth and came with an amazing home made steak sauce. So much favor. Also included their famous Meatball (with that we were all literally eating the excess marinara sauce off the plate by itself once we finished the meatball, it was that tasty), Chicken Parm, Salmon with zucchini noodles, 2 types of pasta, pizza, calamari, and more. Perfect spot for a group of friends, family, whoever. Epic!

6HbFc76M2WEQLhb4KhsbLw.text: This is a great spot in the Palazzo Hotel near Morels.The food was superb and the portions large.The arriving at a decent pace although very busy and the service was impeccable.Pastas all done to perfection and the sauces amazing.So many adjectives can be used Come and try this GEM.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b-7OqCZ26yQrdmAirS7oFQ.text: This review is for Saturday Party Brunch (2-6). Club like environment with a DJ, dancing, table/bottle service but a little more casual than night clubs. I loved it! DJ played a great mix of house and hip hop. Service was amazing, so attentive and fun. And the FOOD. The food was unexpectedly great!   My favorite was the almond crusted French Toast. Cut from thick slices of panettone with a nice soft bread and studded with fruit but an awesome crunch on the outside - this was my favorite French toast I've ever had.   Pizza (Margherita) was good but not the best I've ever had. Fries were amazing. Omelette was perfectly satisfying. And the waffle was really really tasty.   I almost went again the next day just to repeat my French toast experience. So good. Do it.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch - French toast with panettone and almond crust - The. Best. Ever.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita

vXcjZz2evKDsLb7KZzIfww.text: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants on the strip , the food is great, very nice portions and the prices aren't outrageous. There's good music playing and the restaurant is gorgeous. The customer service from the servers and waiters is great as well As one of the managers which I believe his name was Pascual he made sure we were taken care of after not being greeted or attended too by the front desk.

PghzcM-2r1n1_z6PNDC52A.text: My bae and I recently came here for a late birthday dinner celebration. We made a reservation prior so there was no problem getting a table. I was a bit disappointed in the ambiance as I was expecting it to be a bit more intimate, but it turned out to be pretty loud and club like. The decor was still beautiful though and very well put together.  As for food the portions are definitely worth the value. We ended up sharing the meat and cheese plate which was more than enough for the two of us. Entree wise I had the penne seafood alfredo.  I enjoyed all the seafood that came with it, but didn't care much for the sauce. My bae had the crispy chicken Dominic which was very good and perfectly cooked. I also loved that they brought out a complementary birthday treat.   Overall I was happy with my experience, but would probably come back with a group next time to make sure we finish everything. The meatball looked and smelled great too to try for next time!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne seafood alfredo
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary garlic bread &amp; sauce
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary birthday treat

MMtCPQQmVDVQ3djeX7SERQ.text: Disappointed again. Gave LAVO a second chance out of convenience since we were staying at the Palazzo. With all the restaurant options in Vegas I won't be giving it a third.  First...host was rude.  Second...the tables are just way to close together.  You are practically bumping elbows with your neighbor. Third... they had one house Cabernet by the glass option and it was $25 a glass!  However, they had 4 other red options for $15... most people who order red wine  by the glass just ask for a Cabernet so this seems like deceitful.  The food....was cold and over priced.   We got the grilled octopus appetizer.  Lacked flavor. We also got the sauteed mushrooms.  Luke warm at best and again no flavor.  How do you mess up mushrooms?!  We also got the beet salad.  It was ok.  We decided that since we were unimpressed with the apps we were not going to order the $40 dollar entrees.  Server was inattentive and after he realized we were not going to order entrees he put the check down and was rushing us out of there.   They need to work on their customer service and although their menu is really nice, their chefs might need something to get them excited again.

m9GbiMwd-HEiY540nYJWsA.text: Went there on a Monday night and we were offered a table outside. Best decision we ever made!  The weather was beautiful and the noise level was perfect.  Our server was delightful and just the overall ambiance was perfect.  We ordered "the meatball " and it was amazing. The pasta dishes we both ordered tasted great. My husbands only complaint was he could have done with more shrimp in his seafood Alfredo. Definitely will visit this restaurant again the next time I'm in Vegas

GoqoCAWO6WNNw7AU9-pWwg.text: This was the friendliest staff I have ever came across! Maya went above and beyond to fulfill our needs. The water staff was so friendly. We were even given a free 'calamari' for our table!

PH-EX0ZaVrLBWjS_Ez-joQ.text: I see and read about situations such as this in the news, and I know people say it all the time, but it is True! I NEVER thought I would be a victim of racial profiling.  I am an honorably retired veteran who was forward deployed to 4 war zones to uphold the rights and freedom of all Americans!  This is an injustice that I must speak out about.  It was simply wrong!  On June 29, 2019, around 11 pm.  I entered the Lavo restaurant at the Venetian/Palazzo casino to meet up with some friends.  I went to the hostess desk and said that my friends were already inside seated and I wanted to join them.   After I finished my sentence, the manager that was also standing at the hostess desk, said that I could not enter the restaurant.  I asked him why.  He said the restaurant kitchen was closed.  I replied that my friends were already seated, and they ordered my food already.  He repeated that I could not enter the restaurant.  At this time, I called one of my friends, who was waiting for me and said, the manager will not let me in, please come to the front so that he can see that I am not lying.  Shortly after my friend came to the hostess desk.  When he arrived, the manager told him she could not come in.  My friend asked him 'Why?!"  The manager did not respond.  My friend then looked at me and said, "OK, do not worry about it, we will pack up your food and bring to you."  I replied, "OK,"  then my friend went back to his table.  I pulled out my cellphone camera and began recording in the direction of the manager, and asked again, "Why aren't you letting me in the restaurant?"  He did not respond.  I asked him again, and I said,  "There have been others entering the restaurant since I have been standing, why can't I enter?"  As he moved, I continued to follow him.  Then, HE PUSHED MY ARM that was holding the phone and said: "Get that out my face and stop recording me!"  Once he pushed my arm, I asked for security to be called and continued to record him.  As I continued to record him and follow him around, he pushed my arm a second time, and this time he knocked my players card out my hands and my ticket voucher.  I repeated my request to call security.  Once security arrived, one of them went directly into the restaurant and spoke to the manager who assaulted me, and three others stood by me.  I continued to record as the security guards stood with me, and I informed them that the manager assaulted me twice and knocked my items on the floor.  None of the security guards responded to me. However, I was advised that the manager WHO LIED, told the police officer I choked him and that was the reason they called.  I said are you kidding me?!  The manager assaulted me and knocked my items out my hand!, I asked for security to be called! Lavo, it is not OK to racially profile!   It is not OK to push anyone!   It is not OK to LIE!  My daughter was awakened in the middle of the night and hauled off to Child Protective Services, was not told what happens to me and was not able to call me and did not speak to me for over 40 hours. She thought she was never going to see me again.  For what?!  Because the LAVO Manager on duty profiled and lied on me!  A great thing I have video!

lHP_btThgYBeFUe5KtRO2g.text: This was my second visit to Lavo and once again the food was delicious! The prices are great for Vegas, the portion sizes, and the quality of the food. I would give them 5 stars, but the service was a bit off. We had 3 people stop at our table before our actual waitress did and the table location wasn't the greatest as we were sat next to a huge group that was congregating for some sort of a corporate function. With that said, the food came out promptly and as ordered. Another win for Lavo!

gzh7fHTdEBhaULco-RtHFg.text: I Am Always In Vegas. It's My 2ND Home.   I've Been To LAVO Restaurant Plenty Of Time In NYC, But Never In Las Vegas.   Came Here For A Birthday Dinner Party. I Hate Large Group/Dinner Parties. To Many Horror Stories. However, I Still Attended The Dinner.  The Food Is Great, Like Always. The Italian/American Cuisine Was Served Family Style.   The Restaurant Is Pretty Prices. Not For The Cheap Lifestyle. Like The Deep Pockets & Short Arm People. Just Live Alittle .  I Would Definitely Come Back, But In A More Intimate Setting.   LAVO Is The Sh*t

mtxjcF6-D5qdDHsQ0LVDCQ.text: Meh. Sexist - they don't allow men to dance on the tables, only women, even if you're the birthday boy. It's 2018, y'all. Can we treat the sexes equally?

C0hi9TXLsYcgwzGhn0d0ZA.text: Tyler was the most wonderful, helpful, hands on server! he gave us great suggestions of what to do and where to go and was attentive and insightful throughout our whole brunch! Great food great service! Nothing beats Tyler's Georgia southern hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uJgVjMtp90qSB0DhEx90xQ.text: Visited Lavo last night with some friends and the service and the ambiance was the best thing there. The food was very disappointing. The salads and meatball was the best. The Chicken Parmesan . and the Chicken Marsala was the worst that I have ever had. Came out cold and over cooked. The Marsala was also dry over cooked and no sauce. Worst Italian in Las Vegas!

uWXNK_NmDBZzOLKRfKOoDA.text: I came here for a birthday dinner with a group of 10 and it was fantastic.  Quite honestly, we chose this place based on rave reviews of their garlic bread (one of the birthday girls has an obsession).  The garlic bread was tasty, but I think what made it so great was the delicious marinara sauce we dipped it in!  The sauce was some of the best I have tasted.  We ordered a few of the 16 oz meatballs for appetizers and they were covered in the sauce as well - they didn't last more than 2 minutes on the table! One of our friends loved it so much he even ordered another one as part of his meal.  Highly recommend.   For dinner I ordered the filet mignon with truffle butter and it was fantastic.  The meat was cooked to perfection and the butter came on the side so you could use as much or as little as you'd like.  Each bite melted in my mouth - well worth it.  My boyfriend got the veal parmesan and it was massive.  Literally the size of the entire plate!  He devoured it all and said it was tender and delicious.  The only complaint from our group was the snapper, but other entrees included various pasta dishes and seafood Alfredo - all of which were thoroughly enjoyed.  Our waiter was also very nice and attentive.  He even brought over dessert for us at the end!

u258BeCsrjCsLmy1r3KijQ.text: Atmosphere is sexy and fun. Food is incredible. Service is great. I've been here a few times and never had anything but great service, drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

HzOkT1ufMFGw_5tGcPr8ig.text: I LAVO this place. It's one of my must visit restaurants when I'm in town.  The appetizers are amazing.  The kumamoto oysters are great, the Meatball, the grilled octopus, and many others.  This is almost one of those places where you could order a bunch of appetizers and feel satisfied afterwards. Our waiter recommended the Cavatelli Bolognese and it was fantastic.  He also recommended the spaghetti and meatball but we ordered a meatball already. The house garlic bread is second to none, it's nicely seasoned and it comes with a marinara sauce on the side for dipping.  Don't forget the yelp check in for the Oreo Zeppole which is like a deep fried battered Oreo.  I'm not sure how bad the wait is if you just walk in, I've always made reservations through Open Table and I've never had any issues.   Can't wait to come back to Vegas to eat here again.

GRVFrUc8AoRgTFlsmbbvyw.text: My experience here with my partner was extravagant (again). We were celebrating our four year anniversary and LAVO did just that for us. A celebration. Our server Danielle was the sweetest person I've literally ever come in contact with. She made amazing suggestions and didn't try to up sell us. We will definitely be back again to see her.  The food was astonishingly good and don't even get me started on the dessert. Danielle was nice enough to send us out the fried Oreos and they are to die for.  The lighting in the restaurant is crazy because there is so many light sources. Excuse my bad pictures.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Oreo zeppole (fried Oreos) was absolutely amazing. I wanted to order a few to go. It comes with vanilla gelato and an extra Oreo.

70Hn_dZRtzNbSdzBzi1X_Q.text: This is located in the Palazzo and was so good! I had the Breakfast Mac n Cheese, and I will forever want eggs and truffle oil in my mac n cheese from now on. The eggs paired sooooo well with the mac n cheese. It was also very rich, but hey, we're in Vegas so it's all good! Haha! We also ordered the Wagyu meatball and Seafood penne Alfredo. Both were good as well, but the Breakfast Mac n Cheese was the best one. I would definitely return here again! Prices weren't too expensive either, considering this place is located on the Strip and inside one of the big casinos.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Mac N Cheese was uber delicious
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu meatball

sJPNYYJCRXMHCyrwirl4qQ.text: From the time we walked in the service was mediocre at best.  We had a 9:30 reservation and weren't seated until almost 10:10.  We were asked if we wanted to sit outside instead of waiting (there was a high wind advisory in effect).  We waited at the bar until our table was ready.  We checked in twice with the host and both times he acted like he didn't remember us.  As the host you should remember a guest when they ask multiple times if their table is ready. Once we were seated, the candle was out at our table and we asked a member of the staff to light it.  Instead of just doing so he and another staff member started arguing right next to our table about who would light the candle based on who gets the tip for our table.  Appalling! Very petty behavior at an establishment such as Lavo. We were told roughly four times that our garlic bread was coming, finally we got tired of waiting and asked for it but it took almost 25-30 minutes for it to get there.  The bread was amazing though.  Finally our waiter came and took our order, but by this point we were already tired of the poor service.  As soon as the food landed on our table (I say landed because the person who dropped it off was in such a rush that it felt like the plates were just tossed on the table while walking by) our waitress asked how the food was so far.  I hadn't even grabbed my fork yet.  The food was really good though.  The pasta was amazing and the lobster my wife had was also really good.  Service was so horrible we didn't even want dessert though a few items did look very appetizing.  Very disappointing night for the amount spent.

EIh_CDBR2lahNX2Mixyg4Q.text: Very average food - over priced -  . Service was slow . We had brunch on Sunday- Place was empty, waitress forgot part of our order- started out with a small coffee bundt, tasted good but found a hair in it. avocado toast was burnt , the eggs Benedict should have been good- one of the eggs was over done, the toast was chewy and slightly burnt, we had hopes for the lemon ricotta waffle - could have made better ones at home. Disappointed.

CmjfuhHglSICZc7Zfpz1Hw.text: I had a delicious meal here this evening served by a wonderful waiter---Thomas C.  The sea bass was perfectly cooked.  The wait staff was helpful and attentive.   In fact, it was the best service I have had in quite some time.   The fried oreos for dessert were out of this world.

jHPNMcl7uYyR7-ud-AO1WQ.text: **4.5 stars for dinner at LAVO**  I went here for dinner on a Tuesday night and it was very busy. I highly recommend making a reservation because we didn't have to wait. The place is beautiful with a bar/lounge area and lots of tables in the back. My friends and I started with the meatball with whipped ricotta ($24). It was amazing. Literally the best meatball I've ever had. The sauce was on point and tasted great with garlic bread. The meat melts in your mouth. To drink, I had the cocktail (meadows-$14). It was ok, a little to sweet for me and reminded me of a mojito. For my entree, I had the penne seafood alfredo ($33). I loved how light the sauce was and there were 3 large shrimp and a couple of cut up scallops. Overall, an excellent pasta dish without making you feel bloated. The service was also wonderful. I'll definitely be back for dinner!

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DiLpvouvH__m8Z6n7VwvEw.text: Unbelievable dining experience. Food was amazing, service impeccable, and atmosphere classy and fun. Looking forward to my next visit to LAVO!!

UFzc7xjLiPLiYJZHW_SqLA.text: LAVO Brunch was absolutely INSANE. I went for my bachelorette party and we had a blast. First off, the food was really good! I got the omelette, which was awesome. I honestly think that the price is worth it with how expensive mixed drinks are in Vegas. May as well get your own bottle and dance on the table after you're done eating!! It was crazy and the music was awesome. We can't stop talking about the experience and are so glad we did it!!
