bgGKDQneogWbKdvoCkYgUw.text: We have been there over a dozen times when we visit Vegas. This Restaurant is exceptional in all ways from the great drinks to the amazing food and incredible service. You get more than you pay for!!! BTW don't leave without a taste of the meatballs!!

P4qf-kNhdBYXO5N6vBKHrg.text: Had a really wonderful multi-course birthday meal here! The decor is classy, modern, and exciting. The staff was extremely friendly and the manager even checked in with us several times. We ordered pitchers of drinks to start, like a champagne and berry one and a margarita one. The appetizers were delicious especially the calamari and the meatball with marinara! The main courses were equally superb and the group favorite was the rigatoni. Pictured is the dessert platter with tiramisu, cheesecake, fried oreos, and bread pudding. I'd never actually had a fried oreo before and they were to die for, especially with the mousse that they brought for the top. A lovely meal perfect for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert plate

_l7oUknrBvv2oCQPZ7bPVg.text: If you're looking for a place that will satisfy your hunger and put you in a coma, LAVO is your spot.  Unfortunately for my group, we were headed out to a concert after dinner, but we were ready to curl up and dream about the meal we just had because it was that good!   The restaurant is dimly lit and had fun music playing in the background.  This restaurant is legit Italian, but I don't think I ever heard Italian music which was a bit weird, but playful.  They bring freshly baked garlic bread and marinara sauce to the table once you've placed your order.  And, bless their hearts for having mocktails on the menu since I was prego - I could still join in on the fun with my girls!  I ordered their Penne Seafood Alfredo dish that was packed with jumbo shrimp, scallops, and lobster butter....uh yeah...melt-in-your-mouth delicious!  I started with their Lobster Bisque though which was like fireworks in my mouth.  So creamy!  We had so much fun here and were still talking about the food on the plane ride home.  A definite must-stop while you're in the city!

W9mRGHt6Bx7d3o_6uEoCvw.text: ***EDIT: I was written an email by a manager, who offered a free dinner at one of their restaurants in Chicago. When I replied back and was told what restaurant I wanted to go to, I was ghosted and never heard back from them!!!! They tried to fix things, but again, goes to show you how well they care about their customers.   Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is for the food when it was finally right. Service was the worst I've ever experienced in Vegas. Restaurant was only half full, and it would of been faster to go out to the casino.. sit at a slot.. and get a drink. There was a specials menu put on the table... and when I ordered from it, they informed me they no longer serve the item. What a joke. Then, for a party of 7, everyone ordered and he ended up walking away not taking my order. Food came out and all the staff looked half baked while they were trying to figure out who ordered what, and then a item had to be sent back because it wasn't right. There was a manager walking around aimlessly the whole time and never once checked on us. Bottom line.. you're better off elsewhere. Food was good, but not worth the horrible service

mvCUGeM4dtSuEuhoxSooeg.text: We went to LAVO for my birthday dinner, and it did not disappoint.  Definitely the best of the three restaurants we went to for dinner during this most recent trip to Las Vegas.    For an appetizer we had THE MEATBALL and it was super delicious.  How could we not order something called THE MEATBALL!  And I had the Chilean Sea Bass, which was so perfect with a crispy outside and tender inside.    And to top it all off they brought a Happy Birthday dessert with enough for all four of us to have a good portion.  Thanks LAVO!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday to me!

WnJ-MaxjkqC0cxO0CgoAaQ.text: The staff is friendly and the inside is inviting. We went for a work dinner with 12 guests, they accepted our reservation but when we showed up to the restaurant it was then we were told a private party rented out the entire inside and if we wanted to eat it would be on the patio. It was about 50 degrees out so they had patio heaters everywhere but we were all still very cold. Deduct 2 stars for not letting us know in advance.   Food and wine was excellent. The meatball appetizer was freaking amazing... and HUGE! I was very impressed with this being cooked perfectly given the size! And the sauce was delicious as well. Main course I tried was carbonara which was prepared exceptionally well. The pasta was al dente and sauce was thick and rich! I was very happy with this meal.   Would go back but would make sure we could sit inside if it was cold.

wbIpWwmsecfIKGBPUgwS3g.text: Food was disgusting- had an octopus that tasted like plastic and lobster - served cold, butter or oil was not hot either placed a salad with croutons on top / a lobster at The mediocre Red Lobster restaurant tastes so much better and served with more customer service! Overrated and overpriced!

xAQ-M7vq6co-8Hpo3YfpTA.text: Great place to have dinner, we sat outside and saw the sunset. The drinks are good, and We also go appetizer pizza, charred octopus, and fish and steak dishes. My steak dish was great, especially by adding butter, I'd only recommend that next time I'd get off the bone . And of course bread. I was a bit confused that every table also got a giant plate of calamari.. such a waste since you could see many didn't finish it, having already ordered the appetizers they wanted. They also have meal dinners where you can chose options for a less pricy full meal.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Pizza
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Fried Calamari

U3nIUGgzoyHTc3coX0xodg.text: First time having the new brunch buffet here.  It was really very good.  It's beautifully arranged and there is a nice selection.  There are other items included that are made to order, like the great eggs benedict.  We also added the meatball for a small additional charge, but at a huge discount to its usual price.  The bottomless drink options are a great deal too.  My only complaint is that our waitress was very slow to check on us.  She was out of sight most of our time there and hard to find.  We were able to sit out on the patio on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and relax and enjoy ourselves.  Save room for the desserts.  They all were amazing!

IGsVkQO-4oRPAIfyM0poPA.text: I have a very long-standing history eating at Lavo restaurant in New York, so I thought it was a safe bet to impress my client; I made a reservation a day early.   I must say that my experience eating at Lavo in Las Vegas was honestly the worst dining experience I've ever had in all the years of visiting Las Vegas.   Yes, it was that bad.   First, even though we showed up 10 mins early, we were asked to stand around and wait for 50 mins while other parties of same capacity were seated. Maybe we didn't fit the demographic they like to see as patrons? My clients felt unwelcome.  Literally as we were walking out to find a different restaurant, we were told they had a table for us... but, actually upon being lead toward the table area, we were asked to wait again another ~7-8 mins. It may seem like a short time, but after the 50 mins wait, hungry and embarrassed, those 8 mins were horrendous. We were told that they would "comp some great appetizers since we had to wait so long". So they admit poor treatment, and hope that comping an appetizer will make things better. Interesting.   Our waitress arrives another 10 mins later, we just want to eat. We order, the food arrives, my client does not like his food. He doesn't touch it. Our waitress didn't hear me call for her when walking past our table to address the food, so we all just shared our dinners and gave my client some off our plates.   It's concerning that when the waitress saw that my client didn't touch his food, she doesn't ask if everything was ok? Or if there was a problem, nothing. Second guy, asks if we need a box for it, "no", and also doesn't ask why on earth an entire entree is untouched.   This was the theme, the staff just didn't care at all. Literally the expression on their face was complete indifference.   This restaurant would not survive in New York, not in a million years.

HJVzSIZ6XIPVf-aW7rzJFA.text: We went for brunch as we normally do for almost any restaurant! Let me tell you that brunch lasts until 4 pm which is a major win especially when you are hungover!  The place is huge and very classy. Our server was Josue and he was heaven sent. We told him we were on a staycation and he made it his life's goal to make sure our glasses didn't reach the bottom!  The meal starts off with water (bottled or tap) and a fresh basket of bread appetizers such as pretzels or croissants. As for the food, I ordered the steak and eggs with home fries as a side and my wife ordered the chicken and waffles. The steak was already pre-sliced which makes it so much easier to enjoy. Seriously, who wants to spend most of their meal cutting their steak ?  The chicken was breaded with captain crunch which is a nice difference from the norm. Our order was cooked to perfection while being nice and hot as it was served. We lucked out since the place wasn't busy at all so there was little room for error.  We didn't get to experience outside since it was so windy but we hope to next time!  Be sure to come by especially if you are staying at the Palazzo! I can't quite put my finger on it but there is something missing which is why I didn't give a Five star rating. Definitely want to see what their dinner service is looking like so we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My skirt steak and eggs.... mmmmm yum

1Rz3CC4kp-9RQZWn6BIYzw.text: LAVO was great! We had made a reservation for 630 and we were ushered right in, on time and the table was ready and everything!  We started off with some wine (pics attached) and Tuna tartar! The wine was really good for the price! The tuna tartar was good but a little cold, which took away from the taste for me a bit. Usually, if it's at room temperature, it tastes a lot better! Well, finished with the appy's I got the Chicken parm. The weird thing was that the pasta had  to be ordered as a side but I wasn't really hungry and just decided to go with the Chicken parm and man o' man did I chose wisely! The chicken parm was the biggest I've ever had! It was HUGE! I have a picture of it on here somewhere and it was big!   Overall, LAVO was good! It isn't fine dining but the portion sizes are good and the staff was really friendly and great with us! It's a great place to grab a good dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartar!
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good selection!
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm... Holy!!!

T9wXdBxuNVxN910QS9Uf2Q.text: Food was excellent. I had spaghetti carbonara. Very rich. The meatball appetizers were great. Service was excellent. The place was open and loud as it was very busy.

44C_GhJ5kgcsEHE1NTaHMQ.text: Sucks, dont eat here....we had reservations, and we had to wait til they were done cleaning a table I quess, whatever....waiter greeted us fast and left in a rush, we had the THE MEATBALL-$25 wasnt worth it, because it was like a regular meatball in tasting, nothing great had their Chilean sea bass....over grilled it , Dover sole good, mushrooms aaaah... I make better ones and I cant cook but I do know how to sautee mushrooms , could have been maybe they were to busy and the waiter took forever to bring our check

SKLypsC4yiQ5ZHDbe9NO9A.text: Food overpriced and average taste. Service was good. The drinks nasty. Atmosphere was nice but that is all.

GTou_om8IRvshf-zoFlPkg.text: Levels restaurant... Is an incredible fantastic place to dine when in Las Vegas everything is made fresh from scratch, and if you get the chance and it's a nice enough evening to sit outside and enjoy the strip as it's meant to be. Definitely try out the 20 later peanut butter chocolate cake you will not be disappointed.

qfm8mubiASdKsUZfoX_smQ.text: Gorgeous restaurant inside of Palazzo! It is a little bit more on the fancy side, so don't come here expecting $12 entrees. I had the prosciutto pizza (it had some fancy schmancy name, God knows if I'll ever remember what it was). Although it was salty, it was a big portion, definitely big enough to share! I also tried their famous meatball and some amazing oysters. Next time, I probably wouldn't order the pizza again, but everything else definitely hit the spot.   I forget what the drink I had was called :( Are you noticing a pattern here? Ok I admit I was a few cocktails in. So sue me, it's Vegas! LOL

vkjRu5A-I81oUHKgQJDUXg.text: Amazing atmosphere and even more amazing food! Customer service is hands down the best over experienced. Our servers name was Scott and it was as if we've known him for years! Very polite man and a pleasure to be around. 5 out of 5 stars!

G3hpQmwqRhx-bYl8a3cvcw.text: We went to LAVO for our anniversary dinner and I couldn't be happier that we chose to celebrate there. The atmosphere is beautiful and feels both fancy and comfortable at the same time. Our server Jojo was incredibly kind and knowledgeable. Other notably friendly staff included Leo, Jack, Jayro, Zach, and Josue. The manager Pascual was very friendly as well, also charming and handsome for a guy his age! (I'm 22 he's not actually old just older than me lol). We had the meatball, the lobster, the chicken parm (all delicious) and when we finished our meal they brought us out complimentary desserts (the tiramisu and oreos- both delcious) which said "happy anniversary" in chocolate! Everything we had was so tasty but the portions were so big we had to take some of it home! We are headed home with our hearts happy and our tummies full. At LAVO you come for the atmosphere and the food but you stay for the staff that takes the time to make a great impression. We will definitely be returning.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qwqYzVOLfumWEf-cBI0hSw.text: My boyfriend and I ate here during our stay in Las Vegas and it was nothing short of perfect! The ambiance was beautiful, we sat on the patio. Service was great, she was very attentive. Food was AMAZING. We shared the eggplant parmegiano, the truffle gnochi and a margarita pizza. Everything was sooo good. Everything was very well priced and I would definitely recommend eating here!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WUny76N7P9OMK8oUZ0UB1g.text: Let's start from the beginning I've always wanted to try this place so I think. "Hey why not now better late then never " head inside and I really like the atmosphere of the place. Go up to the host and let him know it'll be for two people he then asks if I have a reservation I responded with no and. He responded with a dirty look while rolling his eyes. I then proceeded to look to the side of him and the place was dead ! Maybe three others parties four at most. I was just thinking well this isn't a good start so he says it'll be a few minutes I was ready to leave at that moment but my gf was hungry and tired so I stayed. We were seated after a couple minutes after that moment I wasn't even hungry anymore but decided to have a small bite. The service was good but I can't speak if it's always like that cause like I said. Place was a ghost town all of not most servers were just standing around talking so it wasn't to hard to get service when needed. I just went for a Caesar salad nothing special about it tasted bland I've had better salad fro a bag. My gf went with the meatball and we shared a baked potato. The potato was cold the butter seemed like it just came outta the freezer. I didn't even it wanted anymore so my gf tried it with some bacon bites on it ( I don't eat pork ) they looked hard and over cooked and I was right that's exactly what she she told me it tasted like. As for her meatball (pork again ) she said it was okay nothing special just average. To sum it up this place is overhyped , unwelcoming and underwhelming I won't be back at all but hey don't let my review stop you.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EeeRAgibRfnZNnP9UlusPA.text: I went out to brunch with my girls and Tyler, our server, was amazing! He was so accommodating and I'd love to sit in his section again! definitely recommend Lavo for Brunch!

-dRAUJk1lvb4TMK_soZeKw.text: We came across this restaurant thru Facebook. The only reason we really came here was for their 20 Layer chocolate peanut butter cake. My husband got the Chicken Marsala and I got the Chicken Parmagiano and we were not disappointed. Probably one of the dinners we've had in Las Vegas. We finally got to the dessert, we got the 20 layer cake and the Oreo Zeppole Dessert, and they are to DIE FOR!!!!!! Both had the most amazing taste my husband and i have ever had. If you're planing on dinning her I would highly suggest leaving room for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jI0ZozKoyZuJEU6T8v1NYg.text: Came here with 5 girls for dinner and had a great time! We were greeted at the front with a smile and our server, Tim was super friendly, patient and helpful. The food was delicious and the garlic bread that comes at the start is everything.  All the portions were large and plenty big to have on your own or share a few. We used the yelp check in for the Oreo dessert and they were also great. There are a ton of Italian options in the Venetian/palazzo but we were able to get in here last minute and had an awesome time.

QnB5WFYSNbpqWKCbhW3KlA.text: Went here while in Las Vegas. It was pretty over priced for what it was. Could definitely find better Italian food back at home. I understand there's an expense for being in Las Vegas but not worth the price. The pasta was nothing special for the mixed seafood linguine. And the tuna was decent. Service was good at least. There was an obnoxiously loud table that arrived after we sat down and ordered. And the waiter accommodated our request to move to a different table. It was just a blah dining experience though nothing to hit home about when it comes to other places I have been for similar price.

nxJuQgWamWnDvotvPhuSfw.text: Meatball was outstanding and it went downhill fast from there.... I ordered the seafood linguine and cannot even believe they served me what they did.  What little seafood was in it was bad and the noodles were so dry. They didn't have any sauce on them.  How hard is it to do pasta right?

OmtB3TdApHVIeDkUNxO-HQ.text: LOVED IT! HANDS DOWN BEST RESTAURANT TO BRUNCH & DINE ON THE STRIP!!! A month ago, I visited LAVO with my girlfriends as we were celebrating a bachelorette and I can't emphasis how much we enjoyed our time being there with the experience we had with them. We had reservations for brunch and once we saw our food and tasted it, we were amazed and in awe how delicious the food was!! After our brunch, I asked the server to grab us the dinner menu to help us decide where we wanted to dine. Seeing the menu, I was rest assured that LAVO would be the most ideal place to dine at. At dinner time, we were mind boggled with the yumminess of the food, servers, and the beautiful ambience. When asked, what we were celebrating, we were given a free round of champagne to enjoy with our Italian food. Cant complain to host the most perfect bachelorette with the most amazing food!!! When in Vegas, I definitely won't leave without having a meal at the LAVO!!!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YwuN8JnkvZgi7s3vmaHLTQ.text: Tim was so lovely. He is so knowledgeable and answered all of our questions about the menu. Every one of his recommendations were amazing. He is super friendly and just an overall great person. Lavo is my favorite restaurant but it is my favorite now even more because of Tim !!!!! Request him when you come for sure.

AEwWb6qru52CA9nKSB8yQQ.text: Two weeks ago I had the pleasure of re-visiting Lavo in Las Vegas on a work trip! Not only were the drinks and the food superb as always, the service was absolutely incredible. Three employees that specifically stood out to me and my coworkers were Barbara, Kristina & Michael. They were constantly on it and making sure we were well taken care of. They were kind, fast, funny and helpful whenever we needed. Special thanks to you guys, will definitely be back. (Coming from San Diego!) P.s the meatballs are FIRE

0NbiSUIUHdyerBpyKZtlSg.text: The "brunch" party was Falsely advertised. They advertised that there would be brunch and a party so we bought tickets online only to get there and it only be a party. They said the only way to get brunch was if you purchased a $300 table which was never stated in the advertisement. Needless to say we left angry and hungry.

iNGaqk0szQAODHzRvu2AHw.text: Came here on a Sunday night recently and it was just dead! Stayed for about an hour and the party just really never got going. They didn't hold up the lines or anything, so even guys got in pretty quick. Alot of the ladies in line got open bar wristbands, so it's nice that they show love to the cute girls and the grenades here lol.   The venue itself is really nice, but really small! I do like the layout of it; with the bar being on a higher level then the dance floor. But if anything i would classify more as a lounge with a dancefloor rather then a nightclub.  Maybe because it was a Sunday? Don't think I would come here again unless I got the 3 in 1 wristband for Tao/Tao Beach/Lavo.  Really a 3 star rating, but an extra star for good music. The DJ played Sisqo's THONG SONG! hahah

8sxrSc-gpUwkmF5cQGI81A.text: The review is for a restaurant, although, frankly, I'm confused why you'd combine an Italian restaurant that serves very comfort-food dishes with a night club. It's not like you can dance to the techno as you're eating. So what do you do during the dinner portion of the dinner? Stare awkwardly at your party because you can't really talk.   The food is fine, although a bit too salty, and expensive. But the atmosphere makes the place rather unbearable.

6HdZ9MLdA5oUna44bQRGtA.text: We went here to use a coupon that the palazzo had given us for buy one get one house wine. When we asked about the coupon the bartender said that it was only for casino bars, which the coupon said nothing about. There were 10-15 people in the restaurant while we were there and at least 3 people working behind the bar, but it took 20 minutes for them to get us our drinks to go, even though all we ordered was wine. The cherry on top was that the pours were tiny. We may have been unlucky and gotten a bad bartender, but it was still a bad experience.

DD-cteg3UKbI8LK3U0oOaw.text: A little small club... extremely crowed... can't really dance  Awesome bartenders!

Rm1OpXFUkoCGoYdEvLgikg.text: Elton our sever  was so helpful when needing to be steered in the right direction for our selections.  My fiance and I still remembered the garlic bread and sea bass from years ago and it pleased the pallet once again!!! The chopped Louie salad was amazing!!! Fiance dove head first into the calamari! Super cool!!!

ExXG0oGBLwTv92adnvGWig.text: The food was amazing. We ordered multiple different pasta dishes including the carbonara and bolognese that were both great. Love the presentation of the dishes and they all came at a very timely manner. The bread was so great we ordered multiple. The meatball is definitely an attraction. Worth ordering to share between a few people.

Mlywq9AcF-bOL0P94Asohw.text: Service was extremely slow. Entrees took almost an hour to get on our table. That was a huge turn off for me. Taste was really average. New York strip was bland and the sauce tasted like A1. They charge you extra on bread by the way, which is extremely rare. The dessert "strawberry shortcake" tasted ok but cream was too heavy. I hated the service whatsoever.

fS6oZcLtpKjTg7Ife-N90w.text: The food is ok as I'm half Italian I'm really picky about my Italian food. Food is really pricey but I wanted something good.  Appetizers I always go with Calamari if its on the menu. It was surprisingly bland to me. I had to put extra lemon on it and pepper. Main dish went with Spaghetti Carbonara it was good but wasn't there to really grab me the only thing that really made me like it was the cream sauce and bacon. My date got some food to and she wasn't impressed much either.  The night club we went after we walked our dinner off and pre-partied with some friends. its nice and much better then 1 Oak but it was good. Music was well rounded and the DJ was good. This spot isn't as packed as most but its still really worth the time for the Night Club food I'm not so impressed.

iGQsfh2xEa1IfELqHFRGKA.text: Not Just a Night Club! - During the Fall and Winter Season "LAVO BRUNCH" takes over 2pm-6pm in the restaurant area downstairs! Don't let the title fool you.  This is a crazy party! Time to Drink! - If You eat here for Dinner you must try the World Famous Meatballs!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #lavobrunch - Dayparty!
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front Door

ZcKcksqSk_oFFMVvgN8e6A.text: We went during Las Vegas restaurant week. It was the worst dining experience ever.  We were invisible to our waitress. Food was served cold and was not good.  There was two business tables of 20 and we were chopped liver.  Go to Gordon Ramsey's Steak House or Giadas, both are excellent and far superior to Lavo for food and service.

fSrqXS_roRtwpIe9liNN0A.text: Went to Lavo for my birthday dinner on Tuesday and it was pretty good. The service is great. The food was great. I ordered the mussels and clams in a salsa verde sauce for my appetizer... Amazing!!!!! For my entree, I had the linguini with mixed seafood and that was okay. It was supposed to be spicy I believe but lacked spice. My bf had the seafood Alfredo and I tasted a little bit of it. He enjoyed it I preferably didn't like the lobster butter sauce they added to it. Just wasn't something my tongue appreciated. Lol I would definitely go back for those clams!!! After I ate, we went up to Tao, the nightclub and we enjoyed that since the atmosphere was "loungy."
