We started with a couple aps- two of the outstanding 1lb meatball with ricotta, the octopus, and the fried calamari. All were excellent, except for the octopus- it came out cold. Other than that, solid choices. They do give fresh flavorful bread with some antipasto, yum.   I personally ordered the pasta with shrimp and scallops. It was absolutely delightful. Bravo. I did have to ask for ricotta because I'm extra haha. Flavor was definitely there.  Also, we had many sides of the truffle Parmesan fries- YUM! Warning: the portion is a little big, you will be tempted to eat all of it.   As for the other 10 plates, delightful. Everyone in the party was truly satisfied.   We did skip dessert because we were so full, but once I come back- I definitely will not miss out.   Great service, warm decor, fresh food. Win.   I absolutely cannot wait to come back. As I am a regular to Las Vegas & The Palazzo.   Thank You LAVO for making my experience superb.  Savannah

lG-TuTV2juFAZMeBSdl4-g.text: Spaghetti meatballs with ricotta !!! The best on earth !  Everything on the menu is so good. The wine list is nice and you can find whatever you want The staff is very efficient.

kt7AiRHIksJ5z3cHf5P06Q.text: It was ok, not great. Basic Italian food at very high prices. The patio seating was very nice though, as was our server. It took a long time after our reservation time to be seated. The best part of the meal was the dessert - deep fried oreos - free if you check-in on Yelp!!

Jh-6rQITscs3VAHftDCZ2A.text: Atmosphere - 5 Stars Our hostess directed us to the outdoor terrace overlooking the Las Vegas Strip. Amazing view!  Service - 5 stars All servers were very friendly and nice. They escorted us to Casino Club after dinner.  Food-2 stars  Price-3stars

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DxLvL-6tJwY9vfy7pAWqJQ.text: We had such a great time at Lavo. Something to know - they only do the party brunch on Saturday! We made reservations for brunch on Sunday, thinking we were attending the party brunch. Turns out we missed it, but the staff at Lavo still made sure that we had a great time! Gary made sure we were never low on bottomless mimosas, and he was so attentive and accommodating. Also, Kat, at the bar, was incredibly attentive as well. Great service all around. I can't wait to come back!

wRyGSWGUS-QNk3xNVLWXHQ.text: Experienced Lavo in NY. The LV location measures up. Just when I thought the meatball appetizer was the only way to go along comes the Eggplant parmigiana. Yes it was delectable and plenty for 2 or even 3. Crispy chicken prepared like crispy duck. After all they are owned by the same owners as Tao. Service was excellent and servers suggestions on the mark. Not super expensive. Definitely a good choice if you are confused and have no definite plan. Give it a shot. You won't be disappointed.   No room for dessert. But coffee was good.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert?  Sorry I AM FULL.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken. Oh yeah.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm appetizer. Yummy. Really yummy.

xowUyP5Vq-JsshNPMl_NyA.text: 3.5 stars  I met with a group of friends here for a birthday brunch. Lavo has several brunch options depending on the size of your party. We ended up at a good sized table, but the chairs were a bit to crammed together on the side I sat on leaving not much wiggle room. Our servers were nice and good about checking on our group. The decor is really elegant and nice in some areas and then it can look really ugly and twisted. For example if you go upstairs to the Lavo Casino, the last hallway of stairs you go up has these lanterns filled with feathers inside it. It straight up looks like a birdcage where a bird exploded inside of it and was really disturbing to see in my opinion. There's a hallway just before the previously mentioned disturbing stairs, but what happens in that hallway stays there, so no comment! Then they have chandeliers with lampshades on top of them in the downstairs restaurant, wtf?! It's just a real mix of decor like they couldn't pick a theme to go with. The waiting area right where you enter has a very beautiful and peaceful setting. I really loved the sound of water and design they did there.  Coffee ($4.50) - Very good. Tasted great and complimented my meal nicely.   Almond Crusted French Toast ($17) - Cinnamon, panettone, fresh berries and bananas. French toast is one of my go-to choices for breakfast, so I had to try it. I'm a girl who likes real maple syrup with my french toast and pancakes and I was very surprised that this dish did not come with any! Kinda weird, but my friend who got some with her pancakes shared with me. The berries and bananas were very fresh and delicious. The french toast was thick with a tasty, sweet and crunchy crust. Overpriced for the portion, but delicious.   Applewood Bacon ($7) - I figured they would only bring out 2 pieces, so I was surprised to see 4 on the plate. Our group had yelpers in it, so naturally we were taking pictures of our food as well sharing our food with each other. Having 4 pieces meant there was more to go around and I personally thought it had great flavor with the sweet and crispy edges being my favorite.   Chicken Apple Sausage ($7) - Sweet and tasty flavor. Comes with 3 sausages. Try this if you are going to eat here, trust me. It's really good.   Margherita Pizza ($19) - Fresh mozzarella, tomato and basil. If you know me, you know I love pizza. This pizza was not legit. Maybe they don't serve the pizzas hot here or maybe because we had a large group it was sitting out before being brought out, but the pizza was barely warm. I can't even get into the crust it just wasn't legit.   16 oz. Kobe Meatball ($22) - Way over-hyped and a total novelty in my opinion. They have a larger one on the dinner menu (32 oz.) and these large meatballs are what most people come here to try. I was really excited to try it and then not so excited after doing so. It just tasted like an average meatball and it wasn't very moist, at least the section I had. Folks, it was mini meatloaf covered in tomato sauce instead of ketchup.   Blue Skies Pancakes ($16) - Blueberry compote, yogurt pearls and whipped cream. The pancakes were fluffy and delicious and the blueberries tasted great. Not sure like the french toast if the portion was fair for the price, but it did taste great.   They have bottomless mimosas for $30 during brunch which isn't a bad deal and they have other drink options also if you don't like that type of drink. I like that they offer a variety here instead of just the mimosa giving people options.      Depending on the weather, you could ask to be seated outside on the patio and enjoy views on the Strip while you dine. I definitely enjoyed more than I didn't and wouldn't rule out returning at some point in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where you wait to be seated @ LAVO Italian Restaurant &amp; Lounge - 1/15/17
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are on either side of this upstairs hallway@ LAVO Italian Restaurant &amp; Lounge - 1/15/17
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @ LAVO Italian Restaurant &amp; Lounge - 1/15/17

3wymCK6oYW1fgjvRikGw7w.text: Great atmosphere, the view of strip and really good Italian food. Our waiter was phenomenal , recommended great appetizer, was attentive and helpful.   Food: 5 Service: 5 Overall: 5

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CK5OUWDnifbCCJu1CX-VXQ.text: My favorite restaurant on the strip by far! Meatballs are amazing and love the ambiance :)

YN8ij8ehniKTx7_N3OmP9g.text: one of our favorite restaurants in vegas  3rd time back   spaghetti and meatballs are the best! and the deep fried oreos with a cup of vanilla ice cream is the best way to finish a meal!

pTn4EHKOT5HoWJzgSkA6tQ.text: I came here last Memorial Day Weekend because one of my local friends wanted to hang out. She was able to give me some Free Passes for the girls in my group but the guys had to pay $30. It's a pretty nice venue with decorative splurges on the same level as Tao but not as nice as XS or Tryst. There's a catwalk to the second floor that has all these sinks with water faucets turned on. This bothers me because I consider myself an "Environmentalist" and this wastes a lot of water. In my drunken stupor, I was frantically turning off all the faucets. WTF? There are some cute Go-Go dancers and the girls rubbing on each other a la Tao-style.   Pros:  -According to my friend, on Sundays, ladies have open bar until midnight.  -Nice venue.  -Decent music. Hip hop and Top 40 but nothing new. The typical popular songs that have been played in clubs for the last couple of years.  -Bartender was fairly quick with the drinks.  -Doormen were pretty friendly. Very rare in Vegas.   Cons:  -Kinda ghetto crowd. Younger people, early to mid-20s.  -WAY too crowded. I felt jostled to death. If it wasn't for my hubby looking out for me, I probably would've caught a dozen elbows to the head on the dance floor.  -Bouncers yelling "Can't stand here. Keep it moving." It's so annoying even though I know they're just looking out for our safety and keeping it clear.   Overall, Lavo is a-okay. It's not my first choice but I wouldn't be opposed to going again.

H153rp5_axFYtc0dmpAxNw.text: Small small club for Las Vegas standards. We had table service so I can't speak for the bar service. Overall it was not the level that Vegas usually is when it comes to table service. We still had a great time. But if I did not have a table I would not come back. There were no standing room and the dance floor was packed!

rsrlpgKqDpUOlzuXpeHZ6A.text: Delicious!!!  A group of us gals came here to start my sisters bachelorette party. We hadn't heard of it before and we were staying at Encore so it wasnt in our hotel. We just found it online and booked it!  I am so glad that we did. The service was very good for a large group and our drinks from the bar came very fast. My sister and I shared the mozarella balls and my god they were so good! We still talk about them! The portions are good sized and its authentic Italian food so if you order the shrimp scampi youre gonna get shrimp. Not olive garden style where it comes with pasta and never ending salad and breadsticks (shout out to the party pooper of the group ;D )  Its in the Palazzo so if you are staying there or are in Vegas and want some good Italian food give it a try!

09QtXeGnFthufKALrJ2kFA.text: These jerks spam people.  I received an uninvited email from them advertising the restaurant and I willNEVER dine there thanks to that breach of manners and lack of integrity.  Really, why would anyone choose them over another?

_R7LSfcm_WqvSzyBkeSq6Q.text: This place was AWESOME! My boyfriend and I had dinner here over Memorial Day weekend! Our waiter KC was so hospitable, he recommended everything we needed up ordering and we were so delighted with all of his choices! We started with kobe meatball with ricotta. My boyfriend had the sea bass (melted in your mouth), I had the spaghetti carbonara with chicken which was to die for! Then we had the fried Oreo's with Vanilla ice-cream for dessert! KC also recommended a drink that wasn't on the menu that was made or Rose wine and some type of blueberry vodka that was just absolutely divine! Omg this place is soooo yummy and the service was the definition of impeccable we will definitely be going back to LAVO with all our friends on our next Vegas trip!

TDErv1HCeUH6QZ_72F0ePg.text: I have never been here for the club portion, but came here for Dinner on a couple of recommendations.  On with the review!  So I came here for a date with the special lady because I really wanted to get some good food and I figured I would give Lavo a try.  So the best thing about this meal for me were two things: the garlic bread that is fresh baked and served with marinara sauce, and the DAMN KOBE MEATBALL.  Both were so freaking good.  I had most of the garlic bread myself and had to fight off my lady with a butter knife for it.  The sea bass and tiramisu are pretty good too, but most definitely come for the garlic bread and stay for the meatball.  On a side note, their in-house cocktails are really really good.

X16rDgHAS_XhVBsWJTToCw.text: I've only eaten dinner here, I have not gone to the club, so if you want a club review, read another review.  Dinner here was perfectly adequate for an Italian restaurant, however it was nothing special.  Price wise, I would say that this place is rather overpriced, as I don't feel the meal we had was worth it.  Also, the waiters can be kind of iffy, which I felt was a shame.  The portions are large, but not family style large.  My cousin and I split two appetizers and one main and were plenty full.  Decent wine list, but I would actually expect something better for an Italian restaurant on the Strip.  Overall, was perfectly fine, but nothing special.  I'd say save your money and go elsewhere.

WAlAK8CRzstp3rTftzyyvA.text: The first thing I heard about Lavo Nightclub is that it is small, and compared to other Vegas nightclubs, it is pretty damn small!! When you first walk in, you walk over a little bridge that overlooks the bottom floor and leads you into the main dance floor. The bar area is very tight especially because most people find themselves just standing there to stay away from the overcrowded dance floor.   The drinks were odd... gin and tonic tasted like rubber and my jack and coke needed a heck of a lot more jack! I think the reason why I didn't enjoy this place as much as I thought I would is because half the people here were terribly uptight.. kind of reminded me of LA which is a big turn off for me. This is Vegas people, be drunk and loosen up for crying out loud!  Besides that, the staff at the front door were really nice. Yea.. that's it.

MHYv49Rd-jKyMNy8ioBYrg.text: The worst... Messed up our reservation so made to wait an extra twenty minutes. I can overlook that.. But then it took over an hour for ONE appetizer to come out. Asked for GM and he patted my shoulder and said "Nothing I can do, enjoy" verbatim ... Wtf? Walked out without paying. Horrible service. Avoid

Qb17eVSOaa-T6sHTCiaWkw.text: This is a review of the Lavo Night Club ONLY.  We arrived at the door with passes for Lavo with our group of 17. We spoke with the door man and he told us that he could not accommodate 17 people, unless we purchased bottle service ($1500 minimum)....as they were letting about 20 people into the club who were not together. We asked if we broke our group up into smaller groups could we get in and and the bouncer said "No you already said 17, so you have to get bottle service or we cannot let you in" WTF!? Trying to force bottle service is tacky at best. What a joke. So we got out of line and wondered over to V Bar, where they were more than happy to accommodate our group without bottle service. Later I was told that Lavo was run by the same people who ran Tao Nightclub and it all made sense..... both places radiate douche bag ambiance. I expected more...

cTHbTMyUYDWGKmlAReuwGQ.text: Unfortunately, I had a pretty poor experience at LAVO despite of the great interior design, funny bathrooms, good music, and above-average desserts. I think the problem with this place is the price/performance ratio. The complimentary garlic bread was decent. We ordered 2 appetizers: calamari and eggplant parmegiano. Calamari was barely OK but eggplant was good. The main platter that I had was seafood pasta for $38 and the dish was super salty and acidic due to overuse of tomatoes. My wife ordered one of the fish dishes over which they poured balsamic vinegar without double checking with my wife. She was so disgusted with the fish she had to send it back. The next fish she got was salty as well but at least she thought it was well cooked. We finished the dining experience with an order of 2 desserts and both were above average. Overall, pretty average food that you can probably get elsewhere 1/3 of the price with a much better taste.  My biggest problem was our waitress. After she took our drink and appetizer orders, she disappeared for 20 mins. When our appetizers showed up, I asked another poor fellow whether we are gonna be able to order the main dishes if our princess waitress decides to show up. She came over in another 5 minutes, didn't even apologize and pretended like nothing happened. We had to wait for the main dishes for another 30 mins. We didn't get water refreshments and I think we have been only asked once if we need more drinks in that time. When the food came, I was already feeling filled but ate the whole thing because I was very angry (and it is super hard to make me angry).  When my wife's food turned out to be bad, the manager came over and apologized so +1 for the manager.  Overall, we paid for 4 people about $350 w/o a bottle of wine or anything like that. If we only paid $150-$200 I could have been still OK but at this price range I expect high quality services to be delivered. Really disappointed in LAVO, never coming back and never sending any of my friends there. Sorry, Palazzo.

cyVsQDe5TTFveCRjVGfPUA.text: Review is for restaurant, not club.  We were seated a few minutes after our reservation, which wasn't too bad. The interior is very upscale, gorgeous, and loud. The DJ was okay but not memorable. Service was very good and very friendly.  What we ordered- KOBE BEEF MEATBALLS and SPAGHETTI: Delicious. Really great. The meatballs were soft and flavorful. Sauce was thick and hearty. The whipped fresh ricotta really pushed it over the edge too.  MARGHERITA PIZZA: This was better than expected. Nothing too great, but definitely good. My only complaint was that it had a lot of crust. So I hope you like crust if you order this.   GARLIC BREAD: Complimentary. Very garlicky and delicious, but a little too toasted. Almost impossible to chew.  WINE: I ordered a glass of prosecco which was delicious.   DESSERT: Skipped it but menu looked good.  MY ONLY COMPLAINT: The tables are so close together that the waiters can barely move. They have obviously tried to make the most of the small space and it shows. I think they could stand to lose about 1/4 of the tables in the place in order to give patrons a fighting chance in case of fire or flood. ;)

7XUFHp3_5Bq1A7fmKFZh3A.text: We went here for dinenr before seeing Jersey Boys and were amazed at how good the food was.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine list.  We had the kobe meatball as an appetizer and it was the best meatball I've ever had.  The garlic bread was amazing.  All of our pasta dishes and the carne pizze were very good.  They even brought out a tiramisu as a birthday desert for my fiance.  The decor was beautiful inside - we ate outside overlooking the strip and got to watch the treasure island show from our table.    They also give you a stamp to come back to the nightclub for free - which is worth a lot in Vegas.  We did come back for the club but it was way too crowded to hang out.  We waited at the bar for 5 minutes before going back down the restaurant bar to get drinks.  We went back up to dance but it was just too crowded to stay.  I think you definitely need a table on a saturday night to have a good time here.  It reminded me of Tao since there were women washing each other in a bathtub.  Overall - dinner was amazing but the club would only get 2 stars for me.

IR3PhF4OW5xY1mhZvTtikA.text: This place is amazing! The meatball is out of this world!! The Chilean sea bass is MY FAVORITE

hvjDTYLrt8sRysg0tla8Ww.text: This is very hard for me to say but... Lavo Day party might be my most favorite thing to do in Vegas.  I have done ALL the pool parties, night clubs, ect.  Everything is great but Lavo day party is amazing.  Table service here is great and they are very attentive.  Starts off as a brunch and the food is pretty good.  The prices are all VERY reasonable for Vegas standards and bottle prices are the best in Vegas.  Beautiful crowd here and the party gets pretty wild after an hour or so.  When they drop the curtains you know its about to go down!  Music here is great and the atmosphere is one of my favorites in Vegas. Def a MUST go and good luck getting in!!!

bSbpHXBBz30VhqSctyd8SQ.text: Lavo is going down hill.I rated 5 stars on Tripadvisors about 10 months ago.The staffs looked exhausted and no smile on their faces.The meatballs were bland...no fresh herbs? Oreo Cookie desert was overly fried and oilly....used to be light and airy.Sad to say,Lavo used to be my must visit restaurant in Vegas.

YuJ7q5wsZTUAA4NTsDXUIQ.text: Nice beautiful place. The food was okay. Appetizers: Calamari, Beet Salad, and Lobster Bisque - total recommend Entrees: Penne ala Vodka and Penne Seafood Alfredo was under cook.

9UeMy-JCrlyb8GVAh6Nz_A.text: I am a Vegas local and I never really get down to the Strip that much because I work 40+ hours a week, but when I do, I go big.   I love catching up on all the gossip mags and I have noticed a lot of hype for Lavo Restaurant and Nightclub so I knew that was my next destination. If the celebs go there I want to be there as well!!    One of my girlfriends was having her birthday dinner at Lavo so I was very excited to try out their food.  I was stunned at the amazing decor and ambiance of the place.  The pictures that are posted do not do it justice.  Its AMAZING!   I love the vibe dining feel with the DJ spinning great tunes and the buzz of the Lounge/Restaurant itself.  We all grabbed a drink at the bar before our dinner reservation and I was impressed by their speciality cocktail menu.  I tried two drinks and highly suggest the Uva Bianco (white grape vodka martini) and the Lavolini (passion fruit style bellini) YUM!  The bar staff was very friendly and its hard to find that in Vegas.    The menu was amazing! Everything sounded so good it was hard to decide.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable with the menu and their extensive wine list.  We had some Vino and some really great food.  I highly suggest everything we ate: Calamari Kobe Beef Carpaccio Ricotta Stuffed Meatballs Veal Melenase Chicken Parm Chilean Sea Bass Oreo Zeppole for desert! Apple Cristata YUMMMMMMMMMY!  You better believe I was tasting everyone's dishes.  The portions were very generous vs. the pricing of the dishes.  I am all about value :)  After our amazing dinner we went up to the nightclub to check that out.    I love that this nightclub is more like a boutique style nightclub. I really do not like the huge monster clubs so this had a nice intimate vibe.  The bartenders were very attentive, fast, and attractive.  Its nice to see smiles on the faces of your bartenders! As for drink prices, very standard for Vegas if not a bit cheaper than some of the bigger clubs.  For all of you that are upset at the cost of drinks, Welcome to VEGAS!! Its like this all over the strip so ask prices before ordering to save yourself the shock.  Other venues charge $20 a drink!   All in all, we had an amazing time with amazing service and I will totally come back to Lavo.  A+++++  to the service, staff, and management.  Thank you Tao group for another great concept!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding bday!

ur5sGkae3wAuc5d70SpDhQ.text: If you want some amazing Italian food on the strip with a view Lavo is it!  The service and food were amazing!  First, you have to start off with "The Meatball" which is a 16 ounces of Fresh Ground Imperial Wagyu, Italian Sausage and Veal. Served with Fresh Whipped Ricotta.  I am telling you this is amazing with all the seasonings playing together then you get the creaminess of the Ricotta.  Next level Meatball.  Then for pastas I could not just pick one so I got two.  Haha.  The first pasta dish was the Cavatelli Bolognese which is Sausage Bolognese Sauce, and Fresh Ricotta.  Once again amazing flavor and the noodles were cooked perfectly.  The second dish in my opinion is the best pasta dish and that was Spaghetti Carbonara which is Pancetta, Prosciutto, Bacon, Onions, Light Cream Sauce.  This is one of the best pasta dishes I have had.  You get the creaminess of the sauce then the saltiness of the bacon with the Pancetta.  This was the money dish.  For dessert we had the 20 Layer Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake which is devils food cake, peanut butter mascarpone.  This cake was massive!  The devils food cake was super moist.  So, moist you can set the fork on the cake and the fork will just sink and cut you your own piece.  Then you get the richness of the chocolate mixed with the creamy peanut butter that just melts in your mouth.  Amazing, moist, very rich cake.  You will not finish it.  I do recommend that you sit outside on the patio where it is a better view and more intimate.   The only knock I have for Lavo is that it is very loud inside the restaurant and you cannot hear the person next to you talk.  They do have big portions but this is not a family style Italian style restaurant.  Highly recommend.  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20 Layer Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake - devils food cake, peanut butter mascarpone

PabRZS2vceD0fWL4AbpyMg.text: Located inside the Venetian/Palazzo (more Palazzo). Amazing Italian food made here paired with awesome service. The waiter was extremely professional and friendly, as it should be in a place like this.  They offer a variety of fancy cocktails and drinks. Me being a simple guy, opted for the classic jack and coke. Drinks came in pretty fast and seemed to always be refilled on time.   Ordered the Wagyu meatballs as an appetizer and they were delicious. A little pricey, but worth it. Most of the dishes here are served family style, which means the portions are big enough for everyone to split and share and dig in. No complaints here though, as doing so helps everyone split the check and get to try different kinds of selections from the menu.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

njeYYBd2y-o9yZxsV1oVHw.text: I am EXTREMELY disappointed in LAVO. My boyfriend and I are from Brooklyn, NY. We were on a list for lavo's brunch party through a promoter since last month. We arrived at 1:30pm and waited on the long line for people on a guest list. The REDUCED cover for guys was $40 and at 1:30pm LAVO looked packed! As I got my bag checked I was told I wasn't allowed in with my GoPro. I was confused and asked why. The guy who checked my bag said they don't allow cameras like that inside and I'd have to check it in with the bell desk. I tried to check it in but since we weren't staying at the Palazzo they could not check it in for us. I told the guy and he said I can't go in with it, I'd have to bring it to my hotel room or car. We stayed at the Luxor which is on the opposite side of the strip. I have NEVER been denied to go to a club for such a ridiculous reason. Don't people take pictures and videos on their phones? The same thing a GoPro does? I forgot I had my GoPro in my bag. Had I known I wasn't going to be allowed in with it I would've left it back. I would've never paid for a cab to go to the Palazzo, get denied, go ALL THE WAY BACK to the Luxor, drop off my GoPro then go back to LAVO. I'm very upset with how I was treated and there were no accommodations made. If you plan on going be careful with what you bring - they might not let you in because you have a phone that takes pictures and videos!

xFkUbaQ7luRkssBVd2CteA.text: Went to Lavo for dinner last night for my 30th birthday and had a wonderful time. Erin was an amazing server. She was very kind and fun, and gave us great food recommendations.  I have been to Lavo once before also for my birthday. A lot of my friends got the spicy lobster bisque that time and they passed it around because it was so good everyone had to try it. I got it last night and it did not disappoint. It has nice chunks of lobster in it and a very light spicy flavor. Sometimes lobster bisque just tastes like a bowl of butter but this had a lot of flavor.  For an entree I got the spaghetti and wagyu beef meatballs. OMG mouth watering. Also insanely filling... or maybe that was all the garlic bread I gorged myself on.  The meatballs are of course delicious, the pasta is perfectly al dente, the marinara sauce is the perfect mix of flavor, and then as if that wasn't good enough, they put the smoothest ricotta I've ever had on top. Sometimes ricotta can overpower a fish, but this ricotta is the perfect complement.   You do get complimentary garlic bread with marinara.  The garlic butter was perfect and soaked all through the bread. The crust was chewy and yummy.  They also brought me a complimentary strawberry shortcake which was great.  I wish I had seen the check in offer because that dessert sounds even better!  I loved my drink. It was the Vecchio Stile which was an old fashioned with rum. The rum had a light, delicious flavor and there was just enough sweetness along with the bitters to make a delightfully flavorful drink, that wasn't sickeningly sweet and just smoky and smooth. Yum yum!   Lavo is one of my favorite Vegas restaurants in my favorite Vegas hotel... so I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shortcake
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan and Spaghetti and meatballs

uCyqP_7EL94NT5CjrCYmiw.text: LAVO is so much more than I expected: brunch, dinner, and late-night food served in a huge open space with a beautiful bar, a large traditional dining room, and a whole upstairs lair with table games and sports viewing. Great design throughout, even the bathrooms are gorgeous.  Came with a large group for Cathey K's birthday brunch and was pleasantly surprised by the food quality and portions after several lackluster Strip brunch experiences. Dishes are about ~$20/ea but portions are hearty and everything was well executed. The menu has several options from traditional griddle fare to Italian specialties and shareables. Neli T and I split the breakfast pizza (with scrambled egg and smoked salmon), the 16oz Wagyu meatball (still unfinished despite the table of ten!), and the Louie salad (with two small crab claws and tons of shrimp). Everything was super fresh and we had plenty of leftovers!   Service was at times spotty but they were fairly busy with several large groups- I recommend making a reservation, family-style meals are available with flexible rates. Their Yelp check-in special updates seasonally to allow for a free dessert, so don't forget to use your app.  NOTE: Though they're really pushing the Saturday Party Brunch, Sunday's "regular brunch" was a better choice for us. I come to brunch to catch up with friends and share some tasty dishes, not to dance on a table to ear-splitting EDM. But hey, if that's your thing...

mRzraOWj-nLgpnIAKBbsxg.text: We arrived a little early for our reservation for Sunday Brunch. Our reservation was for a patio table, however since the only tables available were in full sun, it was decided to go for indoor seating in the dining room.  The dining room has a beautiful decor and soft lighting The room is very conversation friendly. Immediately after being seated we ordered water and cocktails. This was followed a complementary dish of garlic/butter bread with a bowl of red sauce.  Next our server Josue explained the menu and was helpful to determine our selection.. Many items are large portions that can easily be shared. We finally decided on sharing two items. The  meatball with sausage ragu is made from fresh ground Wagyu, Italian Sausage and Veal. Handcrafted with fresh herbs, imported cheeses and topped with whipped Ricotta. The meatball is 16 oz (yes 1 pound). The second item was a side order of Pene Pasta with tomato sauce. The meatball was cut into four pieces table side We managed to eat half of the meatball and half of the pasta. This left enough for a take home meal. The kitchen accommodated our request for extra pasta sauce.   Las Vegas has no shortage of great Italian restaurants and  Lavo certainly serves one of the best meatballs in town. Juicy and tender Waygu accompanied by a rich sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sauce &amp; Garlic/Butter Bread
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining Room

NdgUN3O5SMDPW8gQTKs2_g.text: A great experience from top to bottom. Greeted immediately and sat in an intimate quiet corner. Beautiful atmosphere. Our waiter came over immediately and gave us a tour of the menu and favorites. We had the grilled chicken which was so very yummy. Also the Louie salad was great. The tiramisu was the best I've ever had!  I don't even like it normally!  The waiter...Q... heard us cheers to a happy birthday and brought us tiramisu without anyone asking for it...that's outstanding service!  Highly recommend!

9AqeAD8P4GpPIwvceSDeqw.text: Lavo is a really cool place to spend time and catch up with your friends or family. I was here with my colleagues and we had a great time. While it appears at first that Lavo is designed for larger groups, you can request a more intimate setting to celebrate your anniversary even on your first dates! Keep it PG though!! No "smoochin" on the first date!! When it comes time to order, may I suggest their Fresh Whole Main Lobsters? It was mouthwatering and comes with butter sauce. My choice and favorite here would have to be their Chilean Sea Bass. It was quite tasty and love that there was a bite of crunchiness to it. Full of goodness! And whatever you do, order their special grilled octopus. Man, it was so tasty that the tentacles slurped right in my mouth and even goes great with salad (see my photo). If you are considering steaks, definitely their Filet Mignon. It was so tender and moist. For dessert, get their Mascarponne Panna Cota with Pineapple Anise sorbet. Mmmm, mmmm good! It wasn't too sweet which was very refreshing. Ambiance here is definitely primo. It does get very loud and busy so you may need Ethel Merman's projecting voice to hear each other. But after a few of their New York State of Mind drinks which is a concoction of Knob Creek Rye Whiskey, that puppy will for sure send you to the moon and back, smiling and wanting a few more glasses thereafter! Remember what they say, "Everything Stays In Vegas." PS - checkout my review with LAVO in NYC here (yelp.com/user_details_re...). That location was fantastic and their PREFIX menu was the best!! Cheers!

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lqft8r5Xxv4BnsTgEdKrxA.text: Nice place for large group meetups.  As we did for a birthday brunch; Lavo is able to accommodate even 15 or more.  On our Sunday morning visit there were several tables with large groups.  Their dining space is like a luxury home's open area concept with a bar and lounge.  The walkway leading to the casino sports bar lounge is a centerpiece above the dining area, rather than in the middle of the room.  During brunch, menu items available are breakfast, lunch, and dinner type of meals.  There's a bottomless mimosa option and a pre-fixed menu at special pricing.  Ask about them if you dine here with a good sized group.  The food portions are average, EXCEPT their known-for 16oz. meatball.  The dinner size meatball is a ridiculous 32oz. meatball.  I dare you!  My choice was their Margarita Pizza.  I'm still on a hunt for the best flavored one.  No, this didn't meet the mark.  It was okay and I almost consumed it all.  My pizza wasn't hot.  The difference from others I've eaten was the oblong shape of the crust, which I think is common in Italy.  It was served on a flat board with a handle.  They spend time on food presentation which is something I would expect for this type of dining.  Table set-up appears semi-formal, but you can dine in casual attire.  We received good service for our large group.  Water and coffee refills.  Waiters checking on us.  Upstairs is a sports bar casino lounge, so casual is okay.  Interior decor has a lot of fusion going on for an Italian restaurant.  I saw influences from Asian or Mediterranean flare especially in the design of the shutters above, the pottery fountains, and what appeared to be a thin wooden curtain with candles.  Wasn't sure what to make of the different style chandeliers above.    Lavo really has a beautiful interior.  Let that at least invite you in.

When you leave they even give you one to go! The outside area is very nice, we sat there for the first time today and it was beautiful!   Their large meatball is definitely worth the price. We also ordered spaghetti, lobster benedict, chicken parm, and steak and eggs.  One of my favorite places to go, definitely recommend.

RoXwwtcFhGweqmEh0rd6zg.text: Food The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't spectacular either. I was in a group with ten people and we were told that it was a menu designed to be shared. Although most of my party opted for dishes such as Chilean sea bass, the meatball, the eggplant parmesan, and the chicken parmesan. However, I found it strange because the portions sizes didn't allow for all of us to share. Then a few of us opted for the pasta, like the chicken agnolotti, penne seafood alfredo, and the carbonara. I personally had the agnolotti and it wasn't bad, but the fontina was a little too overpowering. The texture was crumbly and I didn't mind it but I tried searching for the taste of the wild mushrooms and sage. The sauce with the agnolotti was sort of sweet which helped to cut through the cheesy taste. The other two pasta dishes were also heavy due to the creamy nature of their sauces, and they weren't bad either. Although the main dishes felt as if they were missing the overall 'wow' factor. I should've mentioned this earlier, but the appetizers like the complimentary garlic bread and antipasto, the Caesar salad, and the calamari were all pretty standard tasting. The only real redemption of the entire meal had been the tiramisu, it was moist but not to the point where it fell apart. It also had tiny dark chocolate malt balls for texture and overall it was the best-tasting thing I've had in the entire meal. We even did the Yelp check-in, and we were limited at one oreo zeppole per table. I understand why they limit it (and I shouldn't complain because it is free), but we were a party of ten so I wished they would've allowed us at least two of them.   Service Our dinner reservation was at nine, which I understand it pretty late and people get tired. But for the price and location, I expected a lot more. Our waiter, who didn't even bother telling us his name, was older and he just wasn't approachable. I felt as if every table touch was forced and uncomfortable. The other servers who helped seemed more approachable and significantly better than the one we were assigned.   Ambiance The interior is dimly lit and gives off a classy but not uber classy look. The design was cool and I really loved the bathrooms (which even had an attendant), however, the music didn't completely fit in with the image. It was cool to see a live DJ, but the pop music with the image of the restaurant was just a little off.  Overall, I wouldn't go again. It was a nice to know what a dining experience would be at LAVO, but with the okay-ish food and the not so great service. For the price points given, I'd rather go to another restaurant.

Xz3MutX_o0D2XWL_eSAtWw.text: The decor was my favorite part... the restaurant is very chic, loud, and extremely crowded. The tables are uncomfortably close to each other. The drink menu is large and creative- drink prices are very fair. They're famous for their meatball... but I'm vegan so I couldn't tell you about it. They bring out antipasto and garlic bread with sauce as house starters. I split a beet salad with no cheese with someone and it was INCREDIBLE. Who ever has fond memories/ cravings for a salad?! (Me). The spaghetti with red sauce is vegan, and some side dishes. I ordered mixed mushrooms, and garlic spinach with my spaghetti. The mushrooms were very good, the spinach was boring and oily. I'm giving 3 stars because there seems to be no thought in the vegetarian option... I always feel strange paying stupid money for one serving of spaghetti and sauce.

-BGNKdG98SqnLTEetm5oxw.text: This place was fantastic! Food was excellent and wasn't overly expensive. We sat outside on the strip! The view was great. The staff even offered free entry to the clubs next door. Highly recommend!

xd4vF-PIP2kZijBmCBeL5g.text: Unfortunately, very underwhelmed by the food here. The atmosphere and aesthetic is nice so I really had high hopes and wanted to like it. I had the chicken Marsala which was not good. I got it with sauce on the side and it was a still extremely salty and tasted like bad Chinese food. The brussel sprouts were ok - but again, too greasy. The focaccia and side sauce was a nice complementary side dish, but should be served warm (it was cold). I don't mind paying high prices for food - but I just expect the food to actually be enjoyable and it was not.

BSP2tWleMmm5HAz6EWQQzQ.text: Tonight was my second visit to Lavo. It's was incredibly busy but the host and manager did an excellent job moving the crowd in and accepting as many guests as possible. I sat at the bar which isn't something I typically prefer, but it was the best option on a crowded night. The full menu is available and the bar tenders were very kind. Aware of a the patrons and excellent at timing their visits. I enjoyed the Chicken Parm, side of pasta and garlic bread. All very delicious and worth the 2 mile walk from my hotel.  My first visit was with colleagues and we enjoyed the meatball app, eggplant parm app and different entrees. If you've never been, you have to try the meatball. This will probably always be my go to place when I'm not sure what I want. Reliably delicious and a nice but casual atmosphere.

trUhWP12gOoOjMwo7X38iw.text: Came here for a work function. So this was a prearranged meal. Food was good. For appetizers there were moazerlla fried balls which was okay, some guac with smoked salmon and a veggie based pizza which were all okay  Next was a cesaer salad which was what you expect.  Next there was some sort of skirt steak which was verty tasty and baked salmon which was also tasty.   Desserts were an assortment of mini brownies, macroons and fried oreos.

6a0op1P3ckbXZKgRBQm5oA.text: MUST HAVE THE MEATBALL APP!! Holy moly people, this is a home run! Amazing atmosphere and the food and service were fabulous! We will be back next time in Vegas!

x6fb2l97vZjm6kedJa6yPA.text: TINY little club located above the beautiful Lavo restaurant. The nightclub has definitely lost some of it's luster over the years, but I still find myself coming in for several reasons.  1. Free entry and OPEN BAR for girls 2. They pour pretty heavy here, which means....lot's of free booze for the girls.  3. Really sweet bartenders (PAUL: You're awesome!) 4. Open on Sunday nights  Yes, this place isn't nearly as nice as XS or even it's sister venue, Tao, but it's pretty low key (so you don't have to wait in line FOREVER). It's a great place to start your night :D

htcxLiXCy_L5T_ykgL7WyA.text: Another masterpiece, great job, great service, amazing food.   My wife and I had dinner here for the first time and let me tell you something;  Service - excellent  Food - excellent  What else is there, this is all you need at a restaurant.

Captain crunch crusted chicken and waffles and the meatball panini were both to die for and the service from the hostess, the server, and the manager was very personalized and easy.  I also love the Bloody Mary served with a meatball/mini grilled cheese/blue cheese stuffed olive!  Did I mention bottomless mimosas?

The ambience, the food, the fine service of Ahmed made all the difference! He really took care of us and made us feel as if we were his special guests. Thanks for the experience! 1SlFbRWyXN58xkcpUgYiJQ.text: This gem inside the Palazzo blew my fiance and I away! The customer service was excellent as our waitress/bartender (we sat at the bar) was very attentive. We received free garlic bread (delicious) before our food came, we ordered fries and wild mushrooms as we mostly came for dessert. The fries were good, nothing too special, but the mushrooms were fantastic! They were perfectly soft and mouth watering mixed in with olive oil. I then realized we could get a free Oreo Zeppole for checking in to yelp, so I did. I checked the menu and thought I saw it say the Zeppole is a milkshake, my mistake. So, mistakenly I ordered the strawberry shortcake with our free Zeppole. When they both came we knew I'd misunderstood...the Zeppole was much bigger than I thought! It included 6 hush puppy sized balls with a cup of ice cream to dip them into. They were so DELICIOUS! They taste like funnel cakes with soft Oreo sweetness inside, they went perfectly with the ice cream. We finished the Zeppole and had to take our entire strawberry shortcake home with us. I was very surprised Lavo gave such a tasty and large dessert to customers for free. This is probably the most delicious dessert I've gotten free from a restaurant by checking in on yelp. Try Lavo out, you will not be disappointed, I promise! I will definitely be paying them another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mixed wild mushrooms were fantastic!

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Oreo Zeppole we got for free with yelp check in. It is quite filling. I still can&#39;t believe we got this deliciousness for free!

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Strawberry shortcake we took home because a yelp check in included a free Oreo Zeppole which was deliciously more than enough.

C5buEwgoxN2hFzK3qsvtVg.text: Best. Meatballs. Ever.  Nuff said.  Okay, I'll say more. Seriously this place was amazing. I'm getting hungry again just thinking about how great our meal was. We were in Vegas during restaurant week and 4 out of the 5 of us ordered off the pre-fixe menu. We shared one of the kobe beef meatballs with ricotta and tomato sauce to start. This was amazing!! Served in a mini cast-iron skillet and served piping hot. Gah. Amazing. We were also served fresh garlic bread, right out of the oven. One of the best starts to a meal I've probably ever had. We also had a bottle of Malbec which really set off all the rich dishes.   For my pre fixe menu, I had the arancini, penne ala vodka, and strawberry shortcake. Unfortunately the rest of the meal didn't quite live up the start, but everything was still fantastic. Arancini was soft and fluffly, and penne had a great vodka sauce (penne was a little al dente in my opinion). I only had a couple bites of my dessert since I was so full at that point, but that was also wonderful.   Service was absolutely fantastic. We had several different waiters buzzing around us throughout the course of the meal clearing plates, filling water, and checking on us. Our server was super friendly and outgoing- even bumped my mom out of the bad mood she was in. Wonderful Italian on the strip!

TM8Ca4HnTBLrtSDkW4R7sQ.text: Omg food is amazing. Great price, friendly service. High quality, highly recommend to everyone.

h5b5WX30flIUfO0VugtLEQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to dine at while in Vegas. Since my husband and I usually stay at the Palazzo Hotel it's very convenient to grab a late night bite before heading back to the room. The restaurant is very elegant with dim lighting and several beautiful chandeliers throughout. I always order the signature meatball, which is the size of a small child's head, and the veal parmigiana, which is also plentiful. The entrees are a bit pricey, but everything in Vegas tends to be, so the large portions are a plus compared to other restaurants in the area.

pH91KGcb63qWbVaa9690rw.text: We came here at 10 am on a saturday. Try to had brunch before it turn into a day club in which I came back in three hours!!!  Had a bloody mary. Not bad but not as good as morels.  Had lobster benedict, mac and cheese with an egg and pancetta, and Kobe signature meatball. Must have!!!  Mac and cheese is best I ever had also.  Definitely coming back.

zva4zDzgDX9iBvkoQA1kSg.text: Came here on a Saturday night with a group of 12 people.  We forgot to make reservations but they were able to accommodate us at such short notice.    I ate here twice for dinner and  I can now say that I am not a fan of their food.    The first time I came here I had raw oysters (which I enjoyed- then again I love raw oysters) and their rigatoni sausage pasta dish.  I felt that it was a pretty "heavy" choice of a meal since we were going out afterwards.  In Italian cuisine, the sauce is what makes the dish,  their tomato sauce lacked a lot of flavor.  This dish tasted like the pastas you can order at the Italian fast food joints located in shopping centers/malls.  The second time I came here, I had the roasted chillean sea bass and it was okay.  The portabello mushrooms were over powering the flavor of the dish..unless it were meant to be the "main" flavor.     The pasta portions are pretty huge, so if you're going to get a pasta dish, you should probably split that with your friend/date.  Make sure you pay attention to your bill because they charge for garlic bread.  The waiter brings it out to your table, as if it were free, but it's not.   The seating is pretty close to each other. I feel like I can sit and hear the conversation of everyone around me. Excellent wait staff and Pinot Grigio.

-gN__0s6EvBt84sA73ZB4g.text: Average to poor Italian food. Poor service, as the bread, and olives, and nibbles, all arrived with our appetizer. I have never had carpaccio with vinaigrette on it before, and now I know why, it ruined this dish. My daughter had the meat ball with ricotta, they claim is their signature dish, everyone serves it, big deal. I love veal milinase and was very disappointed, there is only one way to make this classic, and Lavo did not bother to do it. Just go down Paradise to Ferraros and be done with it.

6_Wnc8vjUOpej1F8H3NHbA.text: One of the best on the Vegas Strip... Kobe Meatballs, Veal Parmesan and the Ricotta Cavetelli were the most outstanding!  Also check out the Peanut Butter chocolate layer cake.. out of this world and can feed a table of 8.  Great atmosphere too. There is a lot of competition, but this one you will not be sorry for if you are looking for not your average everyday Italian restaurant.

gGwsn-jLA5BooVt82zvA7g.text: I visited LAVO with a bunch of friends on our final night in Vegas. Maybe it was because we had just gone to Marquee the night before, but I left the locale pretty disappointed.  LAVO has a deal where you eat dinner at the restaurant, and then get free admission to the nightclub that evening (if it's open). It seemed like a pretty good deal, and since there were a few of us, we decided to jump on the deal.  Dinner: 1.5/5  We asked for the latest possible reservation so as to just head over to the club right after dinner and were given a 10:45pm table. On the way to the restaurant, we hit a little traffic in the cab and were running late. We called the restaurant to inform them, and they told us that we had a "15 min grace period" to get there. I found it hard to believe that we'd lose our table, especially since the restaurant wasn't exactly packed on this weeknight.   Anyway, we got there right in the nick of time and were seated right away. We ordered a variety of entrees, ranging from pasta to pizza. Average price was around $25. The waiter informed us that we'd have a "better" chance of getting comped at the club if we also ordered cocktails and appetizers. Since the hostess said that all we needed were entrees, we declined.  The food -   meh. Some of the portion sizes were downright comical, including one friend's ravioli, which we joked the waiter must have dropped on the way here, since there were only about 4 pieces of ravioli for a $24 plate.  No one was really "wowed" by the taste; in fact, I think the happiest of us were the ones that ordered the carne pizza ($24). It came on a long bread (think loaf of French bread as opposed to circular pizza). Not bad, but definitely not worth $24.  The ambiance was nice and the waiter was friendly enough. We paid and quickly went on to the nightclub  Nightclub: 2/5  The hostess had informed us that we would have to wait on line again for the club, but there was a separate, shorter line for dinner guests. She also said that we could just show our receipt and get our free admission into the club.  We went outside and waited on a short line (the general admission line was about 50 people long by that point). One of the men at the door decided to give us a hard time because we didn't have any stamps from the restaurant (which no one mentioned). He then asked to see our dinner receipt, and said that it would only be good for 2 people (even though we paid over $30/pp at dinner on a night when admission to the club was $20).  We didn't want to make a huge deal, so we went back to the restaurant, asked the hostess to stamp our wrists, and then got back on line. From here on, we had no more issues and were able to get inside with no cover.  Inside the club  The club is often advertised as an "intimate" club. I guess that's a nice way of saying "small".  In fairness, it's not exactly tiny, but after having visited Marquee the night before, the place felt like a watered down, smaller version of Marquee.   Music was almost exclusively electro/house.  The dance floor was decent, but not as lively as other places I've been to in LV. All in all, not very happening, even though the place was decently packed.  Downstairs  The downstairs bar was also open and had some music, but there were very few people down here. It made for a quick escape if you needed a drink (or wanted to smoke, as there was an adjacent outdoor patio section overlooking the strip).   In the end, we wound up leaving after about an hour. The decor was certainly very nice, but give me a fun place with average decor than a fancy, dry place any day.   Overall  I definitely would not bother eating here ever again, and the club itself was nothing to write home about.  Overall 1.5 out of 5, rounded up to 2 because the decor was nice  Pros  Very nice Decor Free entry to the club if you have an entree at dinner  Cons  Overpriced entrees Small portions Feels like a junior sized, watered down version of Marquee  Protips:   make sure to wear a collared, button down shirt at minimum for guys. They specifically said no polo shirts at the club (although I sported a blazer with a polo and was not given any problems)  make sure to get your hand stamped by the hostess before leaving dinner and going to the club in order to get free entry.

c7U3UzQjNVpapeG8qFlb-w.text: Beautiful place, very classic with perfect professional service .  The food is super fresh and tasty and I enjoyed every single dish .  The desserts are less good over there compare other places I have been eating . But I am deff recommend to go eat there - you will love it !

fkCbft2BvFa3mRusdHljNg.text: Nice and swanky! The food is good also. It's pretty much a bar scene, but hey, it's Vegas! It's loud so probably not the best place for a romantic meal or a business meeting.  You go here to have fun, eat good food and drink until you black-out. Ok maybe that's a bit extreme, but the place could do it to you. Oh and the selection of food and drinks are enormous. You will find something here to satisfy you. Don't forget to try one of the delicious desserts. Yum!

FWp6PbjWY_cY2ivq-0YGHg.text: We waited 45 mins for our table, even with our reservation. The restaurant was highly recommended, so we were disappointed with the wait. The hostess did offer us a free round of drinks to compensate. We had the pomegranate limonata, which was made well. The restaurant does have a nice ambience upon entering, but looks much bigger than it really is. They had a DJ playing good music in the lounge area. Once we were finally seated, the restaurant manager came over to apologize for the wait. Luckily, the food was very good. We ordered tuna tartare, beef carpaccio, meatballs with ricotta, creamed spinach & a 12 oz steak, which was more than enough to split among three people. Service was great & attentive. Bathrooms were clean, but a little dark inside. We were able to access the nightclub after eating.  As for the nightclub, the music was horrible! It was rap all night. Not r&b that you could dance to, but rap that you couldn't understand the words with disgusting lyrics. The DJ did not know how to transition from one song to another. There was an older crowd there, so with it comes creeps. The comped drinks we had were not good on anything except beer and champagne. Not what I pictured the party scene to be after eating at such a trendy restaurant.

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JrBmqTcRlMmevjnHmM8bNA.text: Amanda is a fantastic hostess! She served us and had the most beautiful pose when she delivered drinks. She also has an amazing smile! Look out for her! Amanda's boss - give her a raise!!!!

i9dOFWKOoR52I3I1uL-gHw.text: I've been to LAVO nightclub like...3 years ago and my only memory of it then was how tiny and dark it was and having to weave in and out of the crowd.  I've never been back aside from now, but for their "Champagne Brunch" on Saturday.  I'm still confused why it's called a Brunch at 2PM, but whatever,  Everyone got in free, including dudes, if you have a good promoter. Only the bottom room is open where they have all the tables set up.   It was open bar for the girls as well from 2-3PM and the bartenders were not stingy about that AT ALL.  There's an indoor dining area, the bar, and an outdoor patio area.  They play loud club music with the windows drawn, but there's no dance floor if that's what you're looking for.   Inside seating is reserved for table service.  Outside is first come first serve.  Nice place to chill and get your (Free) drank on.    Crowd was kind of bougie looking to be honest, but then again, it is Vegas.  It was a nice pit stop before hitting up a buffet.

ud-K6Ry-lZBkFfaH_Vutpw.text: Great food! I nice refuge from the normal Vegas craziness. Try the wagyu beef meatballs and pasta. They are incredibly good. Also, if you're a Campari fan they make a good negroni.

BNkcWq5t8eTu2sBQ1ka2QQ.text: Hmm, the first time I came here to eat, I was very disappointed and did not enjoy my meal at all!  The food was bland and did not entice my taste buds.  Now the second time I came here, I came with my friend who was visiting Vegas for the weekend.  It was a late meal and we were both HUNGRY!  haha.  Walking around the strip, the restaurant Lavo caught my friend's eye and we looked at the menu and she wanted to dine there.  I was a bit hesitant, but since she was the guest, I complied and asked for a seat for two for dinner.    As we got the menu, we were trying to decide what to order.  We ended up decided to order family style.  This mean, 2 friends, 5 dishes, ranging from salad, appetizers, a main entree, and including dessert!  We ordered their famous meat ball with ricotta cheese, the truffle fries, a lobster scampi pizza, and a fish dish with a delicious crouton salad that I forgot the name of!    The meatball was actually really good!  I can see why everyone talks about it!  It is one full pound of wagyu beef (very tender beef)  cooked with lots of flavors and topped with marinara sauce and ricotta cheese.  Eating it by itself was a bit too salty, so I paired it with their complimentary garlic bread.  Both of use only had 1/4 of the ball since we wanted to try everything else.    When the truffle fries came out, it was DELICIOUS!  Now this is how fries are suppose to be!  Semi burnt! ;-)  Hahaha.  I loved burnt potatoes!  Not of those light gold colored fries you get at McD's, but the dark brown, crispy fries that has been in the fryer longer than it was suppose to be!  hahahaha.  Topped with parmasean cheese and truffle oil, my mouth was dancing in joy with each bit!    Next up, the Lobster scampi Pizza and the fish dish (which was not memorable besides the crouton salad it came with).  Now Lobster scampi on top of a flat bread pizza...need I say more?  It was DELICIOUS!  No complaints there!    As for the fish dish, It was okay...but the croutons side dish was so good!  I swear what they did was cubed bread, deep fried it to a crisp, tossed it was cucumbers and tomato and served it!  Simple yet amazing!    Last but not least...dessert....not I know Lavo is known for their deep fried oreos...but after hearing about its texture, I was not appeased to even try it!  The waiter basically told us it tasted like oreo dough...in my mind (oreo soaked in oil)  Ouch...heart attack!  So instead, we chose to order the toasted marshmellow 7 layer rolled cake....such a great decision because it was what we both were craving!  It was a thin layer of chocolate cake, rolled with a vanilla type of cream and covered with chocolate ganache.  Very sweet, but perfect ending to such a delicious meal!    Now I wasn't impressed with my first experience here, and after giving it a second chance, LAVO has won my taste buds!  I'd recommend my friends to come here, so you should come and try it too! =)

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toasted marshmallow seven layer rolled cake.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toasted marshmallow seven layer rolled cake.

034WgF7DUd5WSYRUIQWwAw.text: DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!! Man! Been waiting to eat here for a long time. I made an 830 reservation and weren't sat until an hour later. The gentleman that took my name was excellent. He comped us 3 drinks & 3 desserts. Awesome. It's my 30th birthday after all. We sit and are greeted by a sharp waiter named Eric. He was attentive, friendly & caring. We all order the lobster bisque. Pasty. So we send it back. Next, we order 2 sea bass' and a Caesar salad. We received our food at 1030. Mind you, I have another reservation at 11 that we cannot be late for. Now we are rushing to eat, barely touched our drinks and weren't even offered a to-go box. I ask for the manger. A man named Leo approaches our table, explains that it is also his birthday, comes to no resolution and simply walks off. As if, my problem is no longer his concern. We felt disrespected and saddened by the situation. He didn't apologize. He only offered a poor solution to my problem. I felt that because we were a table of women, our problem didn't matter. Had my husband been sitting beside me, I'm sure Leo would have been more than accommodating. The server offered to bring him back over, I said yes although I was running very low on time. He never came. As we walked out, we saw him hiding behind a plant. Like I said, not his problem.   DO NOT EAT HERE. Especially if it's a special day. Spend it an establishment that cares about you and appreciates your business. I'm disgusted. Pick another restaurant!!!

GKe7EwU0qDnIsYxDTxnswQ.text: If you are looking for a place that serves meatballs, plays dance music while you eat, and offers spankings, LAVO is your place!!   Came for a Bachelorette party, as did many other groups of girls.  Each bachelorette was publicly spanked by the hunky waiter with a paddle.  It was a creepy and silly spectacle.   The chopped Louie Salad was one of the best Louie's I have ever had tho.

sG0jXzU8X1aJ7rErFKkoTg.text: Four of us dined here last night before a show.  The atmosphere is chic and inviting.   The food was average but very expensive.  I ordered Branzino and received two small fillets which were dry.  It was served with a small salad which was tasty.   My dining partners had ravioli and another had a gluten free pasta dish.  She appreciated the GF item on the menu.  The fourth person ordered a flatbread pizza which was the best meal of the four of us.  Very nice crispy crust.  The wine was probably the best item on the menu.  The Italian red blend was delicious.   Service was average.  Friendly but not particularly attentive.  In Las Vegas there are definitely better choices.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AZ1HstC-24lqv9b9x8fJKw.text: I love coming for their brunch and it's an added bonus we always get drink tickets.  The ambiance is so much fun, the music is great and the staff is always on top of things! They have a convenient outdoor area for smoke breaks or if you just need air LOL I recommend this to anyone who is looking for something fun to do before going out on the town.

Hfvc0Oy1wrA2L8xOxlnKhg.text: Note: This is for the nightclub only!   1. LAVO needs a separate restaurant and nightclub business page 2. Apparently, Sunday is a "neon theme." This nightclub gave me deja vu  of my 8th grade promotion dance. That might sound harsh but the music was horrible rap that personally, gave me a headache.  3. The bartender that was making our drinks was rude. 4. This place is TINY and not well built in my opinion. I get that its a nightclub so you are supposed to feel like you are in a tight, enclosed space but that doesn't mean the venue is actually supposed to be the size of a bedroom in NYC. I wasn't there for that long cause I couldn't take the music but I only saw one bar which was extremely crowded. Around the bar were "tables" which was really just a booth style seating with no privacy because thats the only pathway to get around the bar.   Additionally, if I were dining in the restaurant I really wouldn't want people leaving and entering the nightclub to be walking above me with the chance of someone who had one too many sips of alcohol to hurl over the balcony when walking in or out of the club.
