o_P3EikMBoo6tfx7bMLoog.text: Dance floor is so small. On sunday got in free and open bar, guys paid 30 bucks.

YyGQW2yygEKRqL57UE1y2g.text: Review for the club:  Open bar from 11-12 with wristband...Michael Jackson medley for about 30 minutes....dance floor an ok size but still pretty packed...this place is a definite pre-party spot do not recommend for rockstar types....  Also many sinks to wash your hands in from the entrance of the club to the bathroom ..no im not kidding....that is all

JDEEBbSIloBFyguMPHigdQ.text: Lavo's Vice Sunday was easily the best night of the trip for me.  After a long weekend we were all ready to indulge one last time and Lavo provided the perfect atmosphere for that.  We managed to have a table for the entire night, I'm still not sure how bottles kept appearing, but it was a blast.  The music was the perfect balance of old school, hip hop, and current jams.  Lavo tops the list for me because it was laid-back, lacked pretense, and was filled with people genuinely enjoying Sunday Funday in Sin City.

3-f6NT1bkmfZcGe58lwkyQ.text: (This review is for the club)  I happened to be in Vegas on a weekend when there was a boxing match taking place, maybe that contributed to the crowds. If possible, get one of those club-hopper passes so that you can also get into Tao if you're into having a really long night.   By the time we arrived the place was hopping! Awesome music, and if I had it to do all over again I would have worn some more comfortable shoes. For some reason there seems to be a Vegas sisterhood between all those brides-to-be running around in their little veils. It's kind of cute.   Do whatever you can call in a favor to get on the VIP list because I felt really bad for all the sorry well-dressed suckers waiting in line outside.

aOcSKuCus_bbk3Cp1puwFA.text: I know that Lavo sits in a 5 Star Resort, and Maybe thats why I expected something awesome. But Seriously we ordered the Chicken Parm. and it was awful. The Calamary was good but not great, luckily the Tirmisu saved dinner from being a complete fail but 4.00 for DRIP Coffee is rediculous. Add in 12.00 for a shot of Baileys and you have a 20.00 disaster. This is a 6.00 drink at best.   We spent 2 days at the Palazzo and for convience we found ourselves at Lavo both nights. The first evening in the nightclub was much better than the 2nd (especially since we never made it into the club). Observations from the first night: The feather dusting girls on a chaise lounge act is cheesy; the girls look bored. Ladies with wristbands can get free drinks but you should take a paying male customer to the counter with you for faster service. The DJ was decent and the club was crowded. It was a fun enough experience that we did want to return the second night.    The second night we ate at the restaurant and the consierge at the hotel made reservations and added us to the nightclub guest list. We were told that the wait staff in the restaurant would take us straight upstairs after our meal. This was NOT the case. In fact the waitress had no idea how to actually pull this off. She sent us out the door and the bouncers outside Lavo tried to thrust us into the general wait line.  We stopped to discuss our options just out the front door and were quite rudely told to move along and keep the corridor clear. I asked the bouncer at that time why do you have a guest list if you aren't going to stick to it. I was told pretty flatly that the wait list just keeps growing and growing and then you end up with the line that we see. So we moved down somewhat and again the man continued to rudely shove us toward the lobby. At which point I was frustrated with the treatment I was receiving. At a 5-star hotel where room rates range from 250-500 a night I expect a certain level of royal treatment.  As I turned to explain that I was a guest of the hotel, we'd just had dinner at Lavo's restaurant and had been told doing so would gaurantee entry into the nightclub.  He wasn't kind or apologetic, he simply stated that the consierge was half right, and that I would still need to provide proof that I'd eaten in the restaurant with my reciept or a wrist stamp as proof. So, now I've been called a liar as well. He never asked for a name on the reservation nor did he try to accomodate our party.   In my frustration I decided not to patronize the establishment and I walked away, evening ruined.  I won't be back.  You can be treated like this at any hotel, so I'll pay less and get more somewhere else.

XHvRaYz6TpqWmcl6DhXNUA.text: ****Club Review****  Great experience, we booked bottle service which has quite a sticker shock initially, but always ends up being money well spent.  We got a great table thanks to Marc and Brandon followed by awesome service from the lovely Jillian.

SRC4ZY9SGGUiSe-BWJYRsQ.text: This is a review for the restaurant...  Beautiful Restaurant  Impeccable service...  But Food was marginal and blaring Techno music during dinner just sucked...  Average age in the restaurant was 40+ years old...Not that in to techno...  what a pity....

FHxParaJfOEApKcy_4ezmw.text: Nightclub only: There's nothing special about this place. It doesn't suck, but it's not somewhere I would be excited to go to either. I had a good time, but nothing stands out. We stayed at the Palazzo so getting in was cake. Some friends stayed at another hotel and found getting in pretty easy as well. We have promoter friends though, so I don't know how it would be for the general population. I think one of the main reasons this club isn't so 'hot' is because it's smaller than other clubs. It has a lounge vibe, which is cool. It's just not somewhere to go pop bottle and hook up with models. However, it's a good place to pregame.

jZrvJEqQ-DhoTZFeowQMvg.text: I got swindled into going here for dinner because I saw the Lobster Pizza on a travel channel show. The lobster pizza was way overpriced for what you got ($28) they put a few tiny pieces of Lobster on the pizza. We also had the Rice balls App - overpriced at ($18) and not good at all...The only thing that was good was the free garlic bread and sauce. Extremely disappointed with Lavo. Will not return.

wGAEJ1I5mzFeQf7To_YBEQ.text: Ok I had to 4 Star this one or else the designer would hang me by the Moroccan light fixtures lol.   Over all the decor is amazing (wink) but the food definitely steals the show. Not a Bloody Mary fan but the shots were our addiction that night.   A must visit if you want to do the total package of dinner/ lounge/bar 1 place call it a night, outing.   One of the better places in Vegas and I'd say a decent spin off from Tao that holds it's own.

KG0dFt1vMbp8QcyDPj39Ag.text: Food review only !   I'm a fan of Chef Lefebvre - 1st tried his food at the L'orangerie and then i thought he really took it to a new level at Bastide ( though i preferred Chef Giraud's food at Bastide - why can't any restaurant succeed on Melrose Place ?!?! )   I figured his creativity would blossom in Vegas - hmmm, after tonight's meal i'm not sure.   The roomie and I enjoyed the restaurant design - nice to see the fireworks across the street at TI , too.   Tried a pomegranate lemonade at the bar ( $13 ) - waaay too sweet !   ordered baked clams, caprese salad, the crudo plate ( a Mediterranean sashimi plate ? ) to start. The clams had too much breading and salt, the broth was tasty. The caprese salad - the tomatoes were delicious, the cheese did little to improve the dish and the basil ? what basil - a lone fried leaf in the center of the plate - why ? The crudo -ok, did not care for the salmon but the filet was nice.   main entree - roomie had the paella. i went with the sliders, the lamb quesadilla and we shared the wild mushroom pizette.   The paella - loved the rice, the seafood was a little dry, the chicken tasted old and the chorizo ? it actually tasted more like pepperoni !   the lamb quesadilla's ? Are you sure it was lamb ? The sliders - bread a little old and way too much sauce. The pizette - the mushrooms were great , a tad too much salt, but overall, full of flavor.  We shared the chocolate bread pudding with the leche sauce ( caramel ) and vanilla bean ice cream. the ice cream and sauce were very good. The chocolate bread pudding - looked like two french toast sticks with chocolate chips in them - decent taste but i had a hard time calling it "bread pudding . "   I came in with high expectations. Left a little disappointed since i've had some amazing meals created by this Chef. I feel obligated to try this place again.

AHE9eOjGNSWnIMTtCMwsKg.text: On our "Girls NIght Out", we came to Lavo for dinner.  We weren't sure where to go for dinner, so Jeff, from VIP Red Carpet, suggested Lavo and we werent disappointed.  Its located at the Palazzo, a short walk from the Mirage.  The decor was pretty cool.  It was pretty dim inside, but I really liked their chandeliers and lighting.  Anywho, we started with 2 of the tuna tartare and 1 caesar salad, which was more than enough to split amongst us 4 girls.  The caesar was pretty good, and the croutons were HUGE!  The tuna tartare wasn't that great for me...maybe im just used to Fusion, but I was expecting some kind of chip to go with it, and I didnt really like the lemony taste it had.  Next, they brought out some amazing garlic bread that you can dip in marinara sauce...pretty yummy.  They also brought out a pitcher of Saggio (kind of like a blueberry mojito)...they suggested the pitcher because it was cheaper than ordering individually...that probably lasted 1.5-2 rounds for us.  I really liked it...it was very light and summery. Perfect for those hot summer Vegas nights!  For my entree, I went with my favorite fish, the Roasted Chilean Sea Bass accompanied by a breaded/fried portobello. Man was that good. I was a little upset that I was getting full and couldnt finish it.  It was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was great.  My friends ordered the grilled swordfish, the penne ala vodka, and the filet...no complaints from any of them.   Keep in mind that you have to order trimmings and potatoes separately for $10 each.  I ordered the garlic mashed potatoes, and another friend ordered the roasted potatoes.  Its pretty huge, so you can probably split with the table.  I actually could've done without it, it was a little dry and I didnt want to waste whatever room was left in my tummy, on potatoes.  Last, but DEFINITELY not least....DESSERT!!!  We ordered deep fried battered oreos with a side of milkshake to dip them into.  PURE HEAVEN!!! It was so good...now im starting to drool again...lol.  This is definitely a cool place to check out for dinner.  The outside patio has an awesome view of the strip.  The ambience is great, the staff was friendly and they offered a ton of great suggestions.  They also knew we were in kind of a rush, so they happily accomodated.  I would definitely go back again.

g77f7d84-6KrvYOxKG02lw.text: Nice little night club.  It's pretty easy to get to.  Right next to the check/checkout area and straight across the casino floor if you're coming from the hotel rooms, Lavo seems like it was designed for the tourists.  We went there around 11... the walkway to the actual club reminded me of Tao.  It was pretty empty at first.  In less than an hour though, it filled up quick!  We sat at the bar and the bartenders were pretty friendly and quick.  We never had to wait long to order.  The setup was a little frustrating.  Everything was compact so it seemed like we were always waiting in line whenever we wanted to go anywhere.  All-in-all the club was decent, but we only stayed a couple hours before going elsewhere.

mfwhGhEyCOf0nCpYlqCJSw.text: Seems to have a tough time with parties, service wise. The flatbread pizza is excellent!! Didn't have anything else, but would like to go back and try.

Zf89PxQv230jLpHg9env2A.text: The restaurant was fabulous.   After a week of disappointing meals at Delmonico, Prime and Top of the World this place was a breath of fresh air. The service was fabulous. We were walk-ins at about 6pm with a toddler and they were more than accommodating.   Many of the dishes including the Caesar salad and desserts are family size which we were unaware of so we had plenty of food!   The pomegranate lemonade was an excellent cocktail as was the Ill Bello!   The Caesar salad was the best I have ever had in my life! It had a good amount garlic (maybe to strong for someone who doesn't like a good kick in the pants!) It was so good everyone at our table agreed that we could just keep eating that and cancel the rest of our orders.   The 4-cheese pizza I got for my daughter was fabulous, as was the Salmon that I shared with my Sister-in-law.   Dessert was to die for!!  There was an Apple pie with cinnamon ice cream that was fantastic and the chocolate cake was divine!  We can't wait to go back for more!

3HPACeHw1IXjTCdFS9W7GQ.text: Very popular place. The food and decor were great, but the music was at such a volume I'd either dine here on a Tues. when the club is not popular, or go to their dance club on a Sat. instead of trying to dine here late on a Sat. night like we did. The service was wonderful too, quick and attentive. Some portions are huge too. If you order the chocolate rolled cake with toasted marshmallow sauce it's big enough to feed a table of 6-8 people!

yY6mlm8A_zoUDBq1TDVFVg.text: I really wanted to like this place, cause I Love Tao; however, this was not the case. We had 7:45 reservations on a Friday night. We were not seated for over 40mins, which is unacceptable. The service was okay- not great, not horrible, just okay.  When you are spending around $100 a person the service should be exemplary. Certainly not the case here. I am a Vegan, so I ordered the broccoli, it literally came out with two partial heads of broccoli (not cut up at all) needless to say I had to cut all of the pieces myself while my colleagues looked at the monster head of broccoli and just giggled. I will certainly pass on the broccoli in the future. The bread dipped in marinara was yummy- but again it's pasta- just pasta...nothing that special. Seriously the Olive Garden makes a marinara sauce that might even be better. I would never go back. It's not worth the money, the wait, the experience etc. Total waste of an evening in Vegas if you ask me.

zs2AcHUso32Ay3CKbRu4dg.text: My girlfriends and I came here to have a nice dinner on our last night out in Vegas. This place lived up to expectations. The food was fabulous, and the wait staff was attentive and friendly. Even the starters (bread and salad) were absolutely yummy! Although it's a bit pricey, this place is definitely recommended to "class it up" in sin city. We initially chose this location, because we wanted to go to the club after, but we never made it there unfortunately!

uuYw7Yn3yQnhxxONCYihzQ.text: lavo is a good alternative to the bigger clubs in vegas like xs and tao on a friday night. the lines usually aren't too long and the cover does not cost too much. if you plan on going to the xs or tao on saturday, i would definitely suggest hitting up lavo for a less crazy night during your stay. the music here is pretty standard for vegas, they basically play a bit of everything.

XlAgYw0_9Q7kMRBpB4GBgA.text: All I know is that the music was cracking at this place (better than XS) and the crowd was bumpin'.  Girls from Canada, SF and LA were making their rounds to our table so it was @#$!ing awesome!  lol.  The girls were super nice although we had to hide a few of our bottles from a couple of them because they thought it was "all you can drink" or something...

Z90say_0VM-WThQSasMXPQ.text: Really liked the place. We stayed at Palazzo and I asked our concierge to put us on their guest list. This said we didn't have to pay and easily got inside around midnight. I'd say it's a little small, but music was good and drinks pretty good too. A night before we went to Tryst and I think these two are comparable in quality (besides the dance floor size).

___dS5jbyD4PhefCsdeaKQ.text: Restaurant was amazing after a so-so experience at their bar first at our visit this week while in Vegas. Walked in without a reservation at 7pm but decided to have a cocktail at the bar first. Bitchy bartender looked at us like we were stupid when I asked her a question about a cocktail and then when we were making small talk with her. It was apparent because we were over 30 we must be pretty lame and not worth her effort to be nice to. The tip she got reflected her attitude towards us. When we entered the dining room it was like entering another world. TOTALLY different atmosphere and service. The service was just right, waiter was funny, knowledgeable and attentive in the right amount,  food was wonderful, the best calamari I have had in some time, and enough for 4 or 5 people. Hubby and I both had basic pasta dishes which the portions were just right and the bread they kept us supplied with was Divine! Nice "by the glass" wine selection also with some affordable choices since hubby was drinking something harder that night. Atmosphere was dim lights and a warm setting and I'd recommend it for couples or groups. Not really a place for kids, tables were somewhat close together and it just wasn't a place to take kids. Parents have mercy on the couples trying to have a date night in Vegas and take your kiddos to Grand Lux.

RHcHm37qpypZS7AY4fSqcQ.text: This review is on the nightclub as I didn't experience the restaurant.   I woudn't go back.   The staff were rude and unhelpful, th drink selection limited and the sound quality poor.     On the staff - the two best mentions was the guy who's job it was to escort guests who had reserved a table from the door to their table.  he wasn't wearing anything that would identify him as staff, and didn't seem to understand that his methods of shoving past customers elbows first wasn't very successful.   He also got really upset that his little rope barrier kept slowly moving outwards because the club was so full - mostly because he was pushing people into it as he went past.     Not sure if was some scam to get a bigger tip, but the barman decided that he wouldn't take the $2 bill that was part of my parent for drinks...   Of couse after it was politely pointed out that its legal currency and we could discuss with casnio management he backed down, but given that there are so many places with friendly staff and good service, why go back?

xufXn6YjAqnpJvYwM7mr1A.text: Its ok, I think there are better Italian..If you go, seat outside looking at stip

tQyZ91vdBtiktn14WxeJoA.text: I went during spring break ... there was no lines... beautiful decor... the dance floor was small.. music was good.. beautiful lounge to rest and order drinks before getting back too the madness... I would say it was okay... staff was good... bouncers did there thing...

4qHK7ytwazf2mdaDRvN5rg.text: They changed their menus around a week ago from tapas to traditional sit-down steak/pasta dinners. The lobster pizza was really good, and the service is really quick. It's very pricey though. $32 for the lobster pizza.

GMrtilaoG_R627dKvOJxEQ.text: we went to the restaurant and the club, so i'll review both.   love, love, LOVED the restaurant!! i was a little nervous after reading all the reviews but we were so happy with everything. the decor is stunning. i went with a party of 4 girls and it was fantastic. we had reservations at 8, and they kept us waiting at the bar until 8:40 or so, so we got a free round of drinks - we'll take it. got sat and ordered a pretty cheap bottle of wine (for vegas especially). delicious garlic bread!! i ordered the tuna tartar - AMAZING!!! it had tuna and avocado with an amazing cilantro lime sauce. so refreshing and delish. then me and my friend split the salmon - herb crusted with some sort of zucchini salad. so yummy. my friends enjoyed their meals too - one ordered penne vodka and the other ordered... um... well i had a bottle of wine so i forgot. so yummy.   they came around and stamped our wrists and then we went outside to go upstairs. there was a long line but i guess we said the magic words because we were let into the club first. we could sit anywhere until that table was claimed, so we camped out at a sweet table for 2 hours til we decided to leave. the club became super packed and played pretty good music. i wasn't blown away by the club, but i think that had to with my company and not the club itself. loved the bathrooms. and loved the decor! 4 stars for you, lavo. i will definitely come back for that tartar.

HLIbLgrz4pzRbN6deiX1Rg.text: My favorite restaurant in LV and a truly intimate dining experience. I am Sicilian and have traveled Italy and this is still the best Italian food I've tasted! Great after hours spot as well.

frcQTtcyNXNSn-N9VsQpKw.text: Just like its sister property TAO, LAVO at The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino is a dining and nightlife concept that will be around for years to come. LAVO is an inspiration from ancient bathhouses with a menu that highlights Italian cuisine. TAO's own Corporate Executive Chef Ralph Scamardella serves up classic Italian dishes. In the entrance to the 300-seat restaurant is a chic lounge with DJs spinning eclectic beats nightly. The nightclub features state-of-the-art audio visual systems and sounds by resident DJs Vice, Five and Crooked.

3Jj1TK8PZg9a-pe4g9E7XA.text: My sisters and I all went to Vegas to celebrate our youngestest sisters 21st!  We originally made plans to eat at another restaurant but ended up at Lavo...and I'm sooo glad we did!  One of the best meals i've had.  We all ordered something different; kobe stuffed rice balls, clams, sea bass, pene ala vodka and for dessert tiramisu.  Everything was delish and we had a great time at the nightclub upstairs!  I would go back in a heartbeat!

BsKd6TBw-dBLC0ut8qs4Mw.text: Food is fabulous, the staff is great and if you like that type of atmosphere then you will love Lavo. My only words of advice is DO NOT be late for your reservations. The hostesses will purposely wait to seat you. My friend and I overheard the ladies talking about not seating us right away because we were 10 minutes late. The hostesses claim we were 30 minutes late but it was only 10 minutes. They will also not seat you unless your entire party is there. And I mean the entire party even if they are sitting at the bar. You must be absolutely ready to be seated or they will NOT seat you. It's unfortunate that the whole entire experience was not pleasant but most of it was.

EVHmIp-QG0DBMGGpPaPQsQ.text: I am leaving 1 star because 0 stars is not an option. I went to Lavo last weekend for my best friend's bachelorette party in Vegas, and unfortunately Lavo was the absolute low point of the whole weekend, solely because of their crappy customer service. We had a table reservation for bottle service, we arrived on time, and somehow they had messed up our reservation - we were supposed to have 1 hosted bottle and were promised the table for the night although I had indicated that we would probably buy a second bottle. When we got there they demanded a credit card and said there would be no hosted bottle to start. We said we only wanted to buy one bottle then, but they insisted there was a 2-bottle minimum. It is extremely common for a large group of girls to get 2-for-1 bottle service in Vegas, as I have done it many times, so this was already BS, but I didn't want to make a scene and stress out the bachelorette so we just told them to call us when our table was ready and in the meantime they handed us a few free drink tickets for the trouble (geez thanks, that totally makes up for it - NOT). We went upstairs to order 8 vodka sodas, drink tickets in hand, and they asked what kind of vodka, I shrugged and said 'Ketel's fine'. When she brought over 8 drinks and I'm about to hand her the drink tickets when I discovered they only gave us 6 tickets - again, thanks hostess for not even giving us one drink per person, Geez...No big deal I will pay for 2 drinks, I hand her my credit card and the 6 tickets. The bartender then proceeds to tell me these tickets are only valid for well vodka, not premium vodka. Umm you saw them in my hand and knew we were using them so why ask me what kind of vodka we want??? I asked to see one of the tickets and kindly showed her that NOWHERE on the ticket did it say ANYTHING about any specific vodka types or any order limitations whatsoever. In California this would be a breach of contract but apparently in Vegas where the house always wins, it didn't really matter. I asked to see the manager and the manager gave me the same incredible attitude. I said nevermind then can I please have 8 "well vodkas" and left the "Ketels" on the bar. They refused to make us new drinks and would not give me back my credit card unless I paid more than $80 for all 8 drinks. Ridiculous. At the same time, downstairs called me to tell us our table was ready - fine I will deal with this later. I go downstairs to get our table but now they can't give us the table without my credit card to hold it - ahhh! That's upstairs being held hostage! I hadn't stashed any more cards into my little clutch so I had to go back upstairs to reason with the idiot bartenders who were probably the rudest staff people I have ever experienced in my life. I just asked for the bill (for the 8 drinks which had been left on the bar and were now cleared off so we technically didn't even get the merchandise I had to pay for!!!) and when I opened it my credit card wasn't there. I asked them where it was and they were literally holding it away from me until I signed the bill!! Unbelievably disrespectful and rude!! I asked her to give me my credit card so my friend could run down and register our table while I settled the bill but they refused. The B**tchy bartender just stood there with a smirk on her face saying "no honey, not till you sign your bill and pay what you owe!" Ummm is that even legal?? Anyways I tipped her fat *ss zero dollars (although keep in mind I literally paid over $80 for 8 drinks which not one of us ever touched, and I had 6 free drink tickets in my clutch!!), and she pretty much threw my credit card across the bar at me. I really was being way calmer and more reasonable that anyone would have been because I didn't want to upset the bachelorette or make her feel bad but after all that, I decided there was no way in hell I was giving this SH&&Y club $2000 for bottle service. It was small, crowded, loud, and the music was just ok at best. The crowd was terrible too. They should have been begging us to stay haha. It's frankly so old that it's not that cool anymore (I never really thought it was great to begin with)...So I gathered up my girls, called the 8 more on their way, and we all met at the club at Encore (XS) which was amazing! Avicii was playing and we got an awesome table in the center of the club where the guys next to us ended up sending us nice bottles of champagne all night and we danced on the table all night! Thank god the night was salvaged the second we left this disaster of a club they call LAVO. I will literally never be back and will tell everyone in Vegas how crappy they treated a customer willing to drop thousands and bring in 16 girls! Unbelievable...Oh the best part was they tried to add a mandatory 18% gratuity for parties of 8 or more (which I found out when I got my credit card statement) but I called up Amex and called their bluff and they reversed the whole charge hahaha you lose LAVO!!!

OactC_5Ke-cj3JISazJZZg.text: such a great club!  as soon as we got off the plane, and waited for our stuff at baggage claim, a promoter had approached us to get us on his guestlist! YEAHHHH!!! he had actually gotten us on both his lavo and tao guestlist.  since we were staying at TI, getting to lavo was actually a pain.  but once we got there, we had actually been given some NICE wrist bands. not the boring kinds that you can get n e where else.  when we first walked into lavo, it didn't seem like it was our thing.  turns out that there was another floor, and it was most definitely our thing! played hiphop music that whole night.  can't really remember much, since my girls and i had VIP and got open bar.  what i can remember though, is that WE LOVED LAVO!

aq9VECT9dKBb87yiUfLBBA.text: This review is for the restaurant, not the nightclub.   Our second night in Vegas and I'm in the mood for some Italian. The first thing I thought of was Lavo, because I had heard they recently opened and are from the same people who brought us Tao. Wasn't really sure what to expect food-wise, but I figured we might as well try it.   First, the atmosphere: definitely a club first and a restaurant second. A DJ stood ready off to the side of the bar area, which was obviously going to be the dance floor once they got all the tables out of the way. The decor is like a combination of an old Mediterranean villa and a NYC nightclub. One thing that struck me as funny was what the waiters were wearing -- White shirt with an open collar, apron, and black suspenders. It looked like that scene in Godfather when Clemenza was teaching Michael how to make sauce, because everyone in the room was dressed like Clemenza. Anyway, on to the food...  Appetizer: I had a giant Caesar salad, which was really enough for two or three people. I only ate about a quarter of it, but it was good. My friend had their signature rice ball, stuffed with Kobe beef. I tried a little bit of it and it was absolutely superb. Ridiculously good.   Main Course: Rigatoni Melanzane (rigatoni pasta with eggplant). Pretty good, but nothing special. I've had the same type of dish at many other Italian places before, and, honestly, it's not the best I've ever had. But not the worst.  Dessert: Chocolate Bread Pudding. I can say without a doubt that this might be the best dessert I have ever had. Rich, thick bread pudding that looked almost like strips of French toast, infused with chocolate and drizzled with butterscotch. Wow. That dessert really made the whole dinner worthwhile.    So all in all, not the best Italian place I've ever been to, but the service was quick, the people were nice, and the decor was nice, if not a little amusing. Maybe next time I'll go back and see how the club is.

ArZ68Mow3HTd7TNVygFZlA.text: The Lavo meatball is famous for a reason. The flavors are rich, the meat is perfect, the fresh ricotta melts in your mouth, and you will never forget it! I had it for the first time, with truffle fries, which were also delicious! I will be back for more

Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Meatball

m-azLh3LjIzcOf0TdVIrCQ.text: LAVO is just amazing from the food and drinks to the service. Well, let me explain.  DRINKS First we started at the bar while they were setting up out table, which was only a minute or so. Brittany was tending bar last night. She was super nice and she is a great mixologist. I'm not just saying that, but I tested her skills last night. Generally, if a place does not have my usual drink, Macallan 12, then I will either try a specialty cocktail or test the bartender. Last night, I ordered a Nuts and Berries shot. She knew what it was, but I asked her if she knew how to make it. She responding by asking if I wanted it made with Frangelico. She hit it right on the nose. It came out perfectly and just how I remember. Five stars for Brittany, her service and her mixology skills.  FOOD The food here is AMAZING! This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. My family and I love to eat good food, and the food here is to die for.   Appetizers - There are two things I always must have when I go to a restaurant that has them on the menu, and that is Charred Octopus and Lobster Bisque. Here, both are delicious and I highly recommend having at least one, if not both.   Main Entree - This first time I ever came here I had a Macadamia Crusted Sea Bass. It was FIRE and it literally got me hooked on this place. Even though is has not been on the menu since, everything I have had since has been spectacular. Last night, I had the Chicken Parm. I've included a picture so you can see what you are actually getting. As you can see, the portion sizes are huge, so plan to taking food home for lunch, because you are going to want to save room for dessert.   Dessert - So there are two things on the dessert menu that are just wonderful. Every time we come, I must have either the Fried Oreos or the 20 Layered Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake. Even though the latter is my favorite, they are both mouth watering and I highly recommend getting them. The cake is amazing even the next day. I will eat it for breakfast the following morning. As for the Oreos, they are not soggy like you would expect. It is more like a doughnut with a warm, crunchy Oreo inside. They are so good, and my mouth is watering just writing about them. Both desserts are a must have!  SERVICE Jo Jo was our server last night. She was excellent. She gave us the best customer service because she was so attentive, she knew anything about the menu, and she was very nice. When I'm in Vegas I drink a lot of water. I usually have to ask for a refill at every restaurant. Not here, Jo Jo and her team were on top of it; my water was never empty. The food came out in courses. First we had our appetizers. Our food did not come out until we were done with our appetizers. That is one thing I hate, when you are in the middle of eating an appetizer and your server is standing at your table with you meal. It makes you feel rushed. But, I digress. The food came out after we finished the appetizers and empty plates had been cleared away. This also was the case with the desserts. After our plates were taken away and leftovers packaged, then the dessert came out. Why can't all restaurants have service like LAVO?  MANAGEMENT Everything here runs like a well-oiled machine. Jason was the manager last night. He is very nice and will make sure you have a great experience. He came over a greeted us at the bar, and then came and chatted with us while we were at our table. He was also visiting other tables that I could see. This is a great management style because the manager is on the floor interacting with the guests and not just in the back or the kitchen.   CLEAN LAVO is always spotless! I never see anything on the floor. The silverware and glassware are always polished! There is nothing worse than getting a glass of wine or scotch and the glass being all spotted! Not at LAVO, every last detail is perfect.  CHECK IN  When I checked in last night, there was a free dessert coupon. It was for or Fried Oreos. As previously discussed, you know how much we love those.  Overall, the drinks, food, service, and management are amazing. It is clean and you get a free dessert when you check in. LAVO is amazing and I highly recommend everything.

uxyOYP355v50dNcEEGuwYQ.text: Low class for high prices!!! Took 7 people to dinner and paid $800+ w tipping and I left my Mophe phone charger ON THE TABLE. When I called an hour later the hostess said "we didn't find it". She was very blase and not at all apologetic. A classy restaurant teaches all the staff to turn in LOST ITEMS. Not to STEAL THEM. I will never take a business group or even me back there. That's insulting and I would never have dreamed I couldn't go back to pick it up. Now I'm at a trade show for days without my charger!

ThiUcey_9imqfVSvULXVfw.text: One of my can't miss stops every time I am in town.  The atmosphere, service and food are amazing.  The 20 layer cake is to die for

KAKrAHU_ZbqXD_em5on9Bw.text: My first time here as a local! Super bummed that I missed the brunch by 5 minutes! It looked amazing. I will have to come back and try that. I had dinner with a friend who visiting from out of town and staying there so we went for dinner. It's a really cool place and the food and service were great!

5aB77dnIERlkzS29DEYjAg.text: had a set dinner.  Fun environment for groups.  Food can be heavy and on the saltier side.  Staff seems slightly aloof and busy.  It's standard dishes and you will be stuffed.  Everything ranging from meatball, roast beet salad, calamari tasted good.

HBfYJZyewDGPg-siaRRRmw.text: Great ambiance!! The food and cocktails was awesome!! We especially loved the 16oz meatball..

WDmvVvWDgoe5NgHgHxtl_g.text: We visited this restaurant for a private party sponsored by a famous IT vendor. The facilities were on the small size for the number of attendees. Fortunately they opened the outside but all of the seats were wet from a recent rainstorm. The service was great and the wine was great. I would definitely return here.

G-bV0p2kl54wwiI99KWJPw.text: I really like LAVO, it's my get-to destination when I just want to unfold and relax...best visited on a good day, sit outside at one of the best patios in Las Vegas, enjoy a big fat cohiba while sipping on some fine aged scotch...Ahhhh LAVO!  Their food is also pretty good, a little pricey but that's Vegas anywhere! The interiors are breath taking, service is always 5/5

Wb6I6-RyjEJxbcFee01ySA.text: I am pleased to report that on my most recent outing here with Diane and friends, everything was back to five-star level: five-star food, five-star service, and five-star ambiance as we sat outside at a table on the elevated patio facing Senor Frog's on the Las Vegas Strip.  Complimentary Garlic Bread was again juicy and superb, served alongside very nice Mediterranean Green Olives.  Crispy Fried Calamari was golden and delectable.  A Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail contained four elongated, very large, and tasty shrimps.  And I enjoyed a fine bowl of Vegetable Minestrone Soup packed with several fresh vegetables.  My main dish of simply grilled fish was a giant flattened Branzino perfectly seasoned and prepared in Olive Oil, accompanied by very good Crispy Truffle French Fries and good but hard Brussels Sprouts and well-cooked medium-sized Asparagus Spears.  Even the Jasmine Iced Tea was first-rate.  Service by multiple staffers was stellar.  Drinks were regularly refilled without request, and I was given a cloth napkin and soda water to help blot out food stains from dropped food on the front of my shirt, which has been a regular occurrence for me of late.  (At Nora's the next night I requested an extra cloth napkin, tucked it in at the neck, and Diane finally received a break from additional clothes washing on account of my recent spate of food spills.)  This was a memorable meal, and I will surely return to Lavo for another fine dinner, next time much sooner than in the past.

Vn_lgxOwwLB509avCnj7Eg.text: Terrible experience.We had guests over from Toronto and it was a crucial first impressions game for us. Decided to go with LAVO because of its location and menu. Had called to book a table for 7:30 but they said they can only do 8:30. Fine, no big deal. We showed up at 8:20 and checked in only to be told that 'others guests haven't left yet' and it we will text you when ready. We waited for 45 MINUTES!! Despite having confirmed reservations for 8:30, didn't get to sit till 9:20 for dinner. Was beyond embarrassed in front of guests. They had over booked for the evening. When we finally ordered food, it took forever to arrive and we didn't actually get our meals till 10:30. They threw in some finger foods to make up to us but damage was done, guest left in a bad mood.   Jason Strauss needs to look into this.. food is okay but the the management and service levels are not worthy of the price you pay.

dd7_WpA5Q5hZD8nEVFhfJQ.text: Normally I come to Vegas for the day parties at the pool but since pool season is over, we decided to try the Lavo Party Brunch. We all loved it! Even the people in our group who hate day parties had a great time.  Guys will have to pay cover (when we went it was $30 each). Make sure if a bouncer in line quotes you a price, you remember who you talked to. Because when we got to the front they tried to increase our cover and change it on us. But the cover is worth it if you have girls in your group to get drinks from the open bar.   I recommend coming early because the open bar is worth it. We probably got around 12-15 free drinks just in that one hour. Also, they give out free stuff like shot glasses, sunglasses, and hats. And when we went, they were giving free drink tastings at the front.  The patio outside is really nice and we got some great pictures in front of the flower wall. The inside eventually turns into a club with dancing once they start playing music and blocking out the windows. The DJ was great and overall it was a good party scene.  The only issue we had was the girls' bathroom. There were only 3-4 stalls and the line goes way out the door. Considering how many people are in this lounge, the line could take up to 45 min or more. We ended up leaving towards the end when we couldn't wait any longer, but probably would have stayed if there were more bathrooms because we were all having a great time.

nIwsBYW6TArxAASGcsQgZA.text: Excellent service as soon as we arrived we were greeted and allowed to sit wherever. Started off with a few drinks which were made promptly and recommended. Ordered the carne pizza which wasn't burnt or cold. Perfectly cooked and filling! A little pricey but you're on vacation, so why not?   One notable thing that did happen was another customer had fallen down and had trouble getting up. They had an issue with their hip. My cousin and I helped this elderly woman and the manager thanked us and gave us a drink on the house! Very much appreciated, cheers!

dXdIJxKkSEQyF-BTNTLjcw.text: I wish that I could give this restaurant less than a one star review for the terrible service they provided. My group made a reservation for 8:15pm and checked at exactly that time with the front desk. After 15 minutes for our check-in, we went up again and asked how long the wait would be. They promised only a few more minutes and that they were cleaning our table as we spoke. Another 15 minutes went by and we once again went up to the front desk asking how the long the wait was, the manager said to take us back to our table but there were people fully sitting and eating... they took us back to the front. We told the front desk manager that if they did not have a table, we were going to leave. He said that it would be a few more minutes, so we left.

bj_iXNtJGs5lgszP8_JDzA.text: Disappointed:  My friend and I were very happy to get a reservation for 8pm at the prestigious Lavo restaurant. We were even more delighted that we were able to be seated 15 minutes prior to our reservation time, as we made it there in record time.  We happily sat in a wonderful out door setting overlooking the Palazzo fountain and sidewalk with gorgeous landscaping.  My friend, being an avid vegetarian, was delighted the truffle mushroom gnocchi was vegetarian. I was happy to order the Bolognese Rigatoni (sausage based sauce) with fresh ricotta.  Then the wait came. After approximately 15 min our delightful waitress Shani states it was taking a while while in the kitchen, and some fresh bread would be out shortly. 15 minutes later a salad to share was brought out by another person in the wait staff. Shortly after our waitress Shani came by and again apologized for the wait and stated the manager would come by shortly.  Another 17 minutes came by and our food finally came out. We were overjoyed to see our food and happily began eating it. Our waitress Shani, still gracious and polite, came by and again apologized for the wait stating the manager knew and would be by.  After our meal was completed, my friend and i decided we would not get dessert, despite the complimentary Yelp coupon. Then a minute or two later Shani came by stating she wanted to verify our allergies, and would bring something nice to the table.  Shortly after tiramisu with the inscription "happy birthday" came to our table.  Shani even gave us a candle, lit it and gave us a wink stating "make a wish, it's your birthday". A truly sweet gesture.  We shortly thereafter paid for our meals, and departed. I let the manager Timothy B (whom i asked for a manager at the front desk), that my friend and i considered walking out before our meal multiple times, but Shani was so wonderful that we stayed.  Timothy B did apologize and state he would pass along the information to the Chef. He also provided a business card while stating to please call him in the future.  Please note our bread never came. The manager, never did come to the table. We never did get asked if we wanted another or different cocktail.  The food was mediocre at best. Quality & texture were 2/5. Presentation was 3.5/5. Wait time & delay for food after ordering 0/5. Shani's service was by far the only thing going for this restaurant.  I will most definitely never go there again. I am thankful that the wait staff made a poor night, tolerable.

X6plQPthVMLF-ReaPkbi6Q.text: Great Italian restaurant at the Palazzo! Service was amazing and the food was beyond words. Everything was delicious! The eggplant parmigiana appetizer tasted like no one else's! It was flavorful and had a light lasagna quality! The serving sizes and more than substantial so come hungry! Their appetizer specialty is a softball size meatball. Friends said it was very tasty. They have a nice selection of wine and desserts are beyond belief!!

eA-Y1ze2q9eXz-uQb_gOTw.text: My review is based on the weekend brunch special. I must say, I was quite impressed with the layout for brunch! I went here for my birthday and completely felt like I got my money's worth. It is $50 per person for buffet style brunch and an additional $25 for bottomless drinks (mimosas, rose, bloody mary, bloody maria, etc). SO WORTH IT! (especially the drinks). I tried the lobster fettucine, spaghetti, and caesar salad for my main dish but wish I tried their breakfast options. I think I felt somewhat overwhelmed by the amount of food on display lol. However, I did take advantage of their bottomless deal and tasted the bloody mary, rose, and mimosa. All food options tasted amazinggg, especially the pasta. Perfectly seasoned and still hot! For dessert, I only tried a couple of their small pastries andddd the chocolate fondue station with dipped strawberries. Let me tell you about the fondue station though!!! As a chocolate connoisseur, I can verify that it is, in fact, the best fondue I've had in a while. To top that off, my waitress even brought out my own complimentary tiramasu cake for my birthday. I took it easy on dessert since I brought my own birthday cake however, I definitely plan to take advantage of all stations the next time I visit Lavo's weekend brunch.

dXqEAmgW-hVZJfCUWDaP4A.text: The restaurant is quite, spacious and elegant.  Everything on the menu were overpriced.  We ordered the Seafood Plateau Grande at $135 and very disappointed of the quality of the seafood. As you can see from the attached photos- the clams and oysters are small and thin that you could barely see or taste it. The shrimps are dry and tough.... we did not taste the lobster or king crab legs. We spoke to the Manager, we want to return and cancel the order.... he told us that once the food on the table, we cannot return.  Of course we told him it's not acceptable... finally he removed the plate.  Our entrees and desserts were excellent.

euMJP7qAbEHwTLVm8Zs47A.text: This place was amazing!  The atmosphere is very cool and energizing!  They played great music.  The staff and service was perfect and the food was so amazing!  I will be back and I'll be sure to bring my appetite because the portions are huge!

V5__LvD2GSvD-5Grg-8bUw.text: Very impressive Italian rest. Service was tremendous. Order the rigatoni with marinara, othersin my party ordered pasta carbonara, chicken parm and chicken Alfredo. All meals were exceptional. All pastas were al dente and PERFECTLY cooked. Only downside was the extra charge for pre order bread. Comon boys you are cleaning up here, bread is gonna be on the house in ANY EAST COAST ITALIAN REST. It's really not all that great, so give it away.

dvZoyJMRLhOkGHLQ-jdEVg.text: I liked the grilled Octopus, but after the bar couldn't figure out how to change the tonic from soda water, I had to leave and get a drink. Hey, it is Vegas, and if they cant serve a Gin & Tonic, they can't serve anything!

N15Ai2TcQYsMSi4K04BVsw.text: Nice ambiance. Professional and knowledgeable staff. Reasonably priced for the portions and quality. For appetizers we had the calamari, giant meatball, and baked clams. Calamari and clams were delicious and cooked perfectly. Meatball was just okay. It's Wagyu, beef, and veal it was the least favorite out of our table of four. I had the Rigatoni Melanzana and it was delicious cooked perfectly Al dente as requested. Another had the linguine with seafood also cooked perfect and good quality fish. Grilled yellow fin tuna was delicious. One in our party had the veal parmigiano, and the main complaint was it was too much meat, and they wish it had an included accompaniment.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ol4mKwlDNPKeZZ9C4zJsyg.text: Went to dinner here for my birthday weekend.  There was a wait to fulfill our patio request, so we opted to be seated immediately in the dining room.  Beautiful restaurant, even the bathrooms are impressive.    Service was absolutely excellent and food was outstanding.  They start you with a complimentary antipasto and bread.  We ordered a bottle of wine and shared the Lobster Bisque, which was fantastic.  They pour the Bisque table side over the toasted bread and lobster meat.    My wife had a lobster and I had spaghetti and meatballs.  We shared a creamed spinach side.  She said it was the best lobster she's had....it's her go to for special occasions.  We utilized the yelp check in promo for a free desert and they brought us a second second desert for my birthday.  We finished with an espresso.    It was a very indulgent meal.  With tip it ended up being $215.  Expensive yes, but reasonable considering much of the check was wine.  You could have a great experience here for $80-$100 with tip.  We will definitely visit again!

QSwaS-OlSmeYyqJ0ieWFfg.text: The espresso is amazing !! No sugar needed. They severed coffee cake AND garlic bread as soon as we got there. All my friends did the bottomless mimosas and constantly had filled drinks.  Tyler the server was awesome. We are so happy we spent my birthday week here! A+++++ time. So much fun. Food was amazing :)

1gMGNe16arWxKR76JdDhCA.text: LAVO Saturday Party Brunch is so strange. Think night club where people are dressed to impress, brunching, eating AND DANCING on dining tables. Idk what the occasion was, but all the go-go dancers were dressed up like super heroes. Quite the experience.  I really wanted to go day clubbing in Vegas, but Marquee Dayclub Dome was closed this weekend and obviously pool parties aren't happening in the middle of January. This was a fun afternoon alternative before our night out! Thanks to our wonderful promoter, my friends and I (a group of 4 girls) were on the guest list and walked in for free with a very minimal wait.  Open bar for the ladies from 2-3 PM. Top 40's music. It was a little crowded with more tables than dance space, but hey free entry, free drinks, I'm not complaining. If you're looking for a place to sit and rest your feet, head upstairs (past the row of sinks, and up another set of stairs) to the ultra lounge. There's also quite a few TVs there so in between dancing and other merriment, it was the perfect spot to catch the Chiefs game!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LAVO party brunch

xNZCa2GoSu85Ee-vZTJ6ng.text: We had a reservation for 4, and were greeted by the hostess with genuine kindness and the we were seated promptly. The space is large, yet intimate at the same time. A fun spot to be.  The food: after walking past two different tables feasting on the fried calamari, we joined the crusade and indulged. Light And crispy batter, and served with a delicious marinara sauce. For dinner, my colleagues had the seafood linguine (not a bite left on his plate, the Bolognese (again, cleaned plate), and the seared yellowtail (which was delish!). I was in a weird combo mood and had the tuna stack appie and a baked potato (I warned you it was weird!). Both tasty. Also, they bring some killer garlic bread, also served with marinara, to the table - some of the best I have ever had! Finally, we shared a comp dessert, fried Oreos, compliments of a Yelp check in. Wow!  Our server, Ryan, was a rockstar in all categories. Funny, knowledgable and super friendly. Be sure to sit in his section. Also a shot out to all of his support team, refilling water glasses and delivering entrees.   -1 star for the noise factor, but we are in Vegas.   Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed seafood linguine
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna stack appie

qQ6Q-AWgK-2zk-0tPxm-RQ.text: Lavo has such a great atmosphere!!! The music is perfect!   I had the chicken parm. It was very bland and hardly had any sauce. My friend has the seafood pasta and it was better.  The drinks and the service is good.   The fried Oreos are also delicious.  I would not recommend this place.

bxrLae7pnSF_LCeRSxlU4Q.text: Excellent service! Molly was our server and took great care of us. The staff was also very attentive and accommodating The steak that came with the Cesar salad was my favorite. Will come again.

uP_u5qbfGI181wX9UFbNaw.text: This restaurant is pretty typical for what you would expect of an Italian restaurant in Vegas. The food is a overpriced and just ok. The portions are pretty big. The meatball we got as an appetizer was pretty good and the penne alla vodka I got wasn't bad. It's not a place that I would eat at again, but there aren't many good restaurant options in Vegas.

nGd-nJ2woAh8qXL4yTRRgw.text: This review is specifically for the LAVO Party Brunch. I've been to the restaurant for dinner and it was fantastic. Since we had an excellent dinner, we thought brunch would be the same. However, we were very disappointed. As brunch starts around noon, we were starving and excited for the amazing brunch food that is seen in all promo videos for the party. My group as well as many other guests attending soon realized an RSVP isn't going to get them the ability to eat. Since we were starving, we spent about 30 minutes there before dipping out. I get that it's a day club during those hours but it just seems silly to call it brunch and not be able to eat...

0k7uA4valGSKJnEVgl2Nag.text: First things first Tim our server was awesome. Mashed potatoes were the best I've had before. The garlic bread is to die for and the bubbles and berries cocktail is delicious. Those were the memorable points of our night. Try those and you can't go wrong.

2ds4fYLpWqmjeZu_C1q-4w.text: Nonsense restaurant, absolute nonsense brunch. Told our party of 30 would be seated weeks in advance then when we came we were told there'd only be 15 seats. Also fda should look into this place my friends got food poisoning from the tuna.

GfGiLQPSKuPp2AwOKwgGag.text: Been eating here for several years.   The wine list is great and the pasta is wonderful.  We usually sit at the bar to watch the sports.  April 8 was there for ncaa final game and the atmosphere was electric.   I recommend the spaghetti pomodoroif you are looking for something quick.

W6E0DUbMhgZb_999YngMmA.text: I went here for brunch and the first thing I noticed was the beautiful decor. We ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict and the almond crusted french toast. My Benedict came out cold at first but my waiter made sure to correct the issue very quickly. The food was pretty good and everyone was very friendly and accommodating. I wouldn't call it the ultimate brunch spot but the location, ambiance, and service makes it worth a stop especially if you are staying at the Palazzo!

4Mlm07jxD8DVO9hpYF5jLQ.text: Great service, great food, and the atmosphere was great. As we entered we were greeted the entire way to our seats. The server was a very intelligent and courteous person. They bring a complimentary antipasti plate which was delicious! I ordered a linguine alla vodka (penne alla vodka; substituted penne for linguine) the sauce was magnificent! We had to catch a flight the same night and we asked the server to expedite the order and she did! I'll definitely be returning!

LMbQn6_itnx5nloZzExnww.text: Wow amazing food! Best meatballs!!!! The waiter needs some improvements he was suggesting when we had ordered enough food, if im paying then i could order the whole menu! But besides that the food was amazing

aT2Qu58R3KrB2UCdJJNZtQ.text: I was hoping for something more given the location and atmosphere. Food was generic italian, nothing special. I did get the wagyu meatball that was good. The atmosphere is the best part of the experience. We sat outside and spent more time focused on the People walking on the strip than the food.

ihiVRjWaAl-Ff7EiNJf1Lg.text: Lavo definitely exceeded my expectations! We already had our sites set on eating here before we got to Vegas, and it did not disappoint. The ambiance was super sexy and fun. A nightclub feel but still intimate and quiet enough to talk. At the advice of our very attentive waiter we split the chicken parm and seafood pasta. We also ordered the famous Waygu meatball, and it was huge! It was covered in sauce and super tender, but the taste of it did not wow me as much as the presentation. The chicken parm was huge and sooo good. Perfectly done! Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside! Covered in yummy cheese and just the perfect amount of sauce. The seafood pasta was probably my favorite. The sauce was to die for! So creamy and buttery I could have drank it with a straw! The Suggested Wine pairing was pretty perfect as well. Overall really yummy, good atmosphere, and great service. Money and time well spent. Oh and The tiramisu they brought out for my birthday was the icing on the cake!!! It was so good with its creamy chocolatey layers!! Yumm

iX9vbrf-tRX_w9YQ6W_FiA.text: We came here on our Anniversary and Molly took such good care of us. She tended to our every need and spent such meticulous care and detail to our day. I truly appreciate all that she did and recommend Lavo any time that she is working!

4hIp0U5far4vW8P4Ug__cA.text: *This review is for Lavo's Party Brunch ONLY*  My Vegas Bachelorette Bash Extravaganza continues with what I'd probably consider my favorite portion of the entire festivity-filled weekend: The Day Club!  I've been to enough Vegas pool parties to know that I absolutely did not want to attend one for my bach.    Sin City's summer season ends late September/ early October when day clubs at the pools switch gears for day clubs located inside the casino hotels instead.  Namely at Palazzo's Lavo Restaurant and Lounge, the HOTTEST dance party held during the daytime!  My girls definitely know how to spoil me...decked out in all their beautiful blush tones for one of THE booziest brunches on the West Coast!  You know me and brunch honey...my favorite meal of the day! Add in some griddle faves, some greasy carbs, endless shots, bottomless champeezy and you've got yourself one helluva bash!  If you're ever wondering what's the haps in Vegas during winter, THIS IS IT!!!   Cannot wait to return before the season ends for another round at Lavo's Day Club Brunch! I'm sure I can wrestle up the posse for a repeat! ;D
