Also had a seafood mix salad (came with huge chunks of lobster).   Then came the entrees: chicken Marsala and the sea bass. The chicken Marsala left little to be desired: came with spinach and mushrooms and very thin pieces of chicken, topped with a very light rendition of the sauce. The sea bass was also very, very delicious. The skin was fried perfectly: it stayed together on the plate and just melted in my mouth. Comes with a small side argula salad which was pair very well with the fish.  This is definitely on the pricier side. Also, take note: this place can be a bit loud (we sat inside) but I'd definitely be coming back to have the Meatball again. Perhaps I'll try the balcony next time which faces T.I. and their pirate/syren show.  Tip: if you stop here, you would do yourself a disservice if you did not try their MEATBALL!

ySvLCY7xh9NmJ7KwOcmJDg.text: I will dream about their eggplant parm. Went here with a bachelorette party and it was perfect for our "fancy night". They played fun music, great food, and even better service. Their computer system went down that night but you would have never known! Our waitress Molly (I think?) and the manager that night (Javier I think? - this was a couple weeks ago, can't remember lol) were both amazing. We were 7 ladies and they catered to us like family. Even sent out a round of complimentary shots for us girls. Would def come back!

xhFxm2Hd9jQxl09Ck81nwA.text: Lavo is amazing. The decor was very nice. Formal dining. The ceiling was high. The lights were dangling. Very upscale. My group and I had purchased a package with lavo and Tao for $1,000 for 8 people which included pre fix dinner and VIP table at the club Tao. It was a great deal. We enjoyed appetizer, entree and desert. Location was really good in the midst of all the night clubs. Unfortunately when I visited in February the restaurant was not operating as a club at the moment

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PydVsUMa1ML1I1ZTMoZZIg.text: Came here for a bachelorette party dinner.  I made reservations for 8 people at 7pm, and we were seated quickly.  The hosts and servers are super nice and attentive.  You get complimentary garlic bread with marinara sauce, and your food comes out pretty fast.  The restaurant is HUGE.  I ordered the salmon, and the filet was a great size.  It came with a lemon sauce, and noodled zucchini.  My only complaint about this place was the pitcher of sangria we ordered.  It was weak, carbinated, not a lot of alcohol and it cost over $70!!!  The pitcher has tons of ice & then each cup was full of ice.  Talk about a rip off!

hMQedLT6HsIQK6vs4J3syw.text: Such amazing food! We came here for a bachelorette party dinner. Ask for Max! He was an amazing waiter and made our night!

wSmasweNTHO0vFfLbNqnLg.text: Came here with a reservation for a Bachelorette party. Staff were all very nice and accommodating, with overall good service. We sat outside which was nice and we actually were able to watch the Treasure Island show while eating dinner.  As for the food, I didn't think it was all that good. Most of us ordered the meatball, which was just one large meatball cut into 4 sections (we shared, too). The spaghetti was fine, but I would say is overpriced for what it is.   If you're looking for amazing food I don't think Lavo cuts it.

DV5hEjK4dWGwPlhHWCDMmQ.text: Our table wasn't ready when we arrived. They told that they will text us when the table is ready but we didn't receive their text or call. We walked in again and finally the table was ready.  We were very happy with the food we ordered. I had spaghetti carbonara and it was excellent. We ordered Calamari to share and it was so delicious, probably the best I had in US. Our waiter was good.  We were there for a date but it was full of hotel guests who stop by for a quick dinner. So the ambiance was nice but it was not a good place for a romantic dinner.  I received an email from Opentable the following day suggesting that I didn't honor my reservation. Apperantly Lavo is having some trouble at the enterance of the Restaurant and reservations. They might consider to hire more experienced hosts/hostesses.  We tried the day club next day with the complimentary tickets we were given at the restaurant but it was like a nightmare. The young guy at the door was disrespectful and unprofessional, so we skipped the club.  Overall, they need to work on some of the staff.

f5w8trZIR-tCDosvlXWqNw.text: I literally licked my plate. Yes I was a wee bit intoxicated but it was 100% justified.  My boss and his wife raved about how freaking amazing their Kobe meatballs are. I prepared myself for potential over hype, but they lived up to all expectations.  Going a step back, we arrived on time for our 8pm reservation and had to wait as the place was super busy with it being the last night of CES. A slight nudge and the management did what every restaurant should do, they bought us a round of drinks. Just as we were going to sweet talk our way into a 2nd round, our table was ready.  This place is sexy, though due to CES the male:female ratio was skewed to sausage. It is at this point that my boss taught me a life lesson. Rather than deal with the back and forth after asking 'What does everyone feel like eating?', simply tell your server to pick their favourites for you. Now this is assuming the server isn't useless.   As I forget the sequence of arrival, here we go:  Green salad - helped with carb guilt Calamari - perfectly cooked, well spiced A-5 Kobe meatball with fresh whipped ricotta - What transpired in my mouth was a little intimate. Wow^2. Rigatoni Melanzana - It had a generous dollop of buffalo mozzarella. Enough said. Chilean Sea Bass - Delicate, butter ocean joy. Bone-in Rib Eye with a side of garlic herb butter - Juicy, tofu-tender, carnivore heaven. I chewed the meat on the bone with pride. Deep Fried Oreos - I thought my boss was joking ordering such a thing at this kind of place, but he insisted. Dipped in gelato, they were magical enough for me to lick my plate clean.  I shall return. Tongue out.

KPSBfqUmy7UJxD7yXAAsmA.text: Great service and atmosphere. Waiter was professional and quick. We had The Meatball which was amazing but huge. The penne seafood was great and the chicken Marsala also. Good choice of music playing just loud enough not to hear everyone in the place but low enough to talk to the table. Would come back if we returned.

UM-aXN7Pt03Oo1FVNW53Ew.text: Food was good and customer service was on par. It took a while for the food to come out. The drinks were a bit pricey. We sat inside, when the real views are on the outside balcony. It was a bit dark and the music was playing quite loud.

WttG22yDIRWv_P3zKDc0eg.text: Loved the restaurant and nightclub. The restaurant has beautiful decor and delicious Italian food. The nightclub has all the amenities of the mega nightclubs but felt much more intimate because of how small it is. Great girl to guy ratio and good music. I'm a fan!!

cFBS0HVwsubgf3xGHHIEPw.text: Vegas has a price.. deal with it!! Nightclub and rest. review  The food was amazing there.  the Waiter was fun and set a great mood for all of us at the table.  the food came out promptly and the bread was awesome.  Bad news on the bread is they charge you the second time around which is okay because it just fills you up anyway.  The only downer was that when the check came we were trying to split it and he said he could... umm no he could not, it took 35 minutes to sort out payment.. bad news my friend..lol.  Nightclub.. we had table service because in vegas you should do table service.  It was amazing.  i am not a table service virgin, we get it every time we  go to a club in vegas.  This one is worth noting however the waitress was so so, but the menu was good and cheap as well, the area was small but as soon as the other table left, we were able to bust a full on move!  the music was great i kept moving all night long.  the bouncers and table gopher were amazing.  i would love to go back there just  because we had such a great time.  don't get me wrong the club is very very small but they have a cool outside space to lounge and the bouncers weren't complete "bags".LAVO  was a nice change of pace. I almost didn't go because of all the negative reviews on here, and that would have been sad.  watch out in the bathroom, they tried to kick me out because they thought i was one of the girls throwing up ... i had to explain that the bathroom person can not tell black people apart.  it was kinda funny, but that is for another time!!  lol

OMyJu_EsuosKWxzIib6AZw.text: Was here in September 2009 on 2 ocassions.  Decent atmosphere, but hard to have a conversation with someone and nothing special going on here.  Bartenders were OK on service

FrkQitJVDnkAKMdd7yh5Rg.text: Review of the nightclub only  I visited this nightclub on September 11th. As I was completely sober that night, I feel like I can review this place without the hindrance of alcohol. I went with a group of 5 girls and 4 guys, one of them who got the girls into the club for free and guys at a rate of $15 each. We were all thinking that it was a pretty good deal since girls would get free drinks until midnight. The decor was wonderful but unfortunately, that's where all the good stuff about the club stops. The club was fully packed that night, not like it was very big to begin with anyways. Rude security guards would shine their flashlights directly in your face and shout at you to keep moving in the walkways. If you didn't move (because your eyes needed to adjust to the dimly lit area, for example) they would shove you. First red flag. We made our way over to the bar where all the girls were trying to get free drinks. Timed, it took us 23 minutes until a bartender got to us, even though we were at the counter for most of that time. The AMF seemed to be watered down, as other reviews have stated. If the night had ended there, I would've left this club with 4 stars. One of our boys then got kicked out because he tapped one of the dancer/waiter girls on the shoulder asking where the bathroom was. The hostess proceeded to tell security that he groped her. The second boy was kicked out for being associated with the first. Seriously. How fair is that? The rest of us leaned on the bar because our feet were tired and there was nowhere to sit down. Security would kick you out if you sat at any of the couches along the walls because they were reserved. As we were watching a couple of people take shots, someone taps another of our guy friends on the shoulder and he gets kicked out because a dancer/waitress claimed he touched her butt. His hands were CLEARLY on the table where all of us could see them. Without warning, he was thrown out of the club, and our night ended there because were so angry at Lavo's treatment. The dancers at Lavo seem to enjoy their power and do not know the difference between an accidental brush and a grope. Needless to say, we will not be visiting this club any longer. DON'T VISIT THIS NIGHTCLUB You have been warned :)

2ADOkdP75xozprWE6Qsp_A.text: This does not include the nightclub, as I have never been to it!  However, I have been to the restaurant MANY times, and every time it is absolutely phenomenal, and by far the best dinner I have when I go to Vegas! The filet mignon and sea bass are as good as they get!!! The kobe beef carpaccio is pretty phenomenal also. I LOVE IT HERE!

9m-HaRKGDPX2BWz92A9Z9g.text: 4 stars for the restaurant, not the club. =P got a comped dinner here with a bunch of my girlfriends during the week. while we were waiting for our table, we got hooked up with a bottle of grey goose. to be honest, we didn't really know what to expect with the dinner. there was a pre-fixed menu...a little bit of everything. roasted beet salad, vodka penne, margarita pizza, chicken parmasan, french fries, garlic bread....i'm sure i'm forgetting something but the spread was BOMB. service was great and he was a cutie. =)

n51WmF_WyIlUe5luA2ADIg.text: Had a great time here. I ate at the restaurant and seriously had among the best steak Ive ever had.  The food was pricey but worth it.  The dance floor was a decent size and the sound system was nice and loud but not deafening.  Id be happy to go back.

rFUeTcwAXK0STgIFHpW5Ng.text: Terrible DJ mixing rap and bad 80s music to a packed, small house. Dancers were intertaining, but we split quick due to music.

Wcq3XKNk4wQmRPeRoOf8CA.text: Loved it.  Dinner for Bachelorette party of 8 and lots of nibbles.  We went to the club afterwards and got up there no problem.  Although it is small, it was not packed.  Definitely a great place to kick off your night.  We also watched the outside Pirates Show at TI before hand and the ambiance and ability to chat with your friends before going out clubbing was awesome.  Loved the restaurant, loved the club upstairs.  Spot on for a group of early 30s bachelorettes to kick off the party.

TEHN-Lcnqn6zISj91duB5A.text: A definite must NOT visit while in Las Vegas. It touts itself as a restaurant; however, the dining room is filled with super-loud dance music and non-diners using your table space as an extension of the dance floor. The service is less than attentive, very inconsistent and includes bringing all 4 courses at once.  Additionally, the food, namely pasta and seafood is not fresh. That recognizable sweet smell of old seafood was very prominent and coupled with penne pasta reminiscent of soggy cardboard made for an unappealing dish , but when coupled with a bastardized attempt at Alfredo sauce was the deal breaker.  Don't expect the service personnel to recognize your discontentment or the manager to know what to do. I was proposed the proverbial question from a rookie manager "what would you like me to do?". At that point, the check and a quick exit made me happiest.

XMQIiwcAQhrbz3tLJPXHnA.text: Dined at Lavo friday night aug 23rd. What an amazing experience! The food was as usual outstanding. Atmosphere always killer. But I want to mention what great service we had from start to finish. Being that it was the usual busy friday night we were being "navigated " to our table where on the way a very pleasant waitress smiled  as she stepped out of our way and wished us a great dinner! How nice! Turns out the same waitress is going to be our server. Off to a great start. Jojo was still just as pleasant and enrhusiastic as she started off w some wine and cocktail suggestions all of wich we took and loved. As dinner went on our whole table became enamoured w watching this pro at work. A table of older customers laughing smiling..clearly a bachelorette party of all girls joking about having an enviable little party w her. After encountering so many snobby money grubbing servers in vegas and all over it was so refreshing to watch a True pro at work. Everything else was secondary. She even escorted my wife to the ladies room! Wow! Blown away. Will be back again and will always request jojo!

C-jsuiuOBgYNxBu89mxGjA.text: RESTAURANT REVIEW ONLY - We wanted a nice dinner before attending the 9:30 PM performance of Beatles Love at the Mirage. Lavo was recommended to us as having great food and being across the street from the Mirage. Latest reservations available were for 6:15 PM on a Sunday evening, so I figured we would have a pleasant, leisurely dinner and then spend some time wandering around the Palazzo/Venetian before heading over to the Mirage. We were seated promptly at 6:15 at a table for two set up on the "long bench" seating along the far wall. They have small tables for two that can be moved and combined to accommodate any-sized number of group. On the ends are larger circular booths.The center of the room was set up for tables of four. The restaurant was sparsely filled at that time.The small tables and close proximity of the adjacent tables (less than 20 inches away) did not bother us at first, since they were empty. There was a group of six in the end booth on the other side of the open table next to us. Since we had an open table between us and the booth, it was no problem. We did have to rotate the table so my wife could get in to sit on the "bench" side. The music was so loud, I felt that I was in the night club and on the dance floor, rather than in the restaurant. I could not talk to my wife without using a very loud voice. The waitress had to keep repeating things and leaning over the table - and even then my wife could not understand much of what she said. We considered leaving to find someplace more quiet, but decided to stick it out. We ordered the special (lobster Fradiavolo). As the restaurant got busier, a couple was seated in the table for two next to us. This is when the lack of space between the adjacent tables really became apparent. It was almost as if we were all seated at the same table. They had to raise their voices so loud to hear each other across their table, that it sounded as if they were sitting with us at our table. After a few moments, he got up, went to the manager and they got seated elsewhere. Three other couples were also initially directed to this table, but when they saw how close the tables were and how loud it was, they also requested to be seated elsewhere. Eventually this table was filled as was the table for four on the other side of us. By then we were almost through with our meal and were trying to get out as soon as we could. To summarize: Positives (1) Waitress Tashia was excellent. (2) Lobster and accompanying pasta dish was very good. Negatives: (1) LOUD Music (2) Small tables - when our food came, not enough space for all the dishes - had  to combine food items - there goes the "presentation". (3) No "personal space" - tables so close that we felt like we were seated with a group on a bench in a pizza parlor. (4) Garlic bread was baked all the way through - crunched and tasted like croutons. Tashia said it was not supposed to be like this and offered to get us a replacement, but the main course had arrived and no room for the bread basket anyway.(5) Prices - I would have no problem with the prices if the atmosphere/setting were consistent with the price level (diet coke - $4.50 each, no free refills, small sides of green beans and asparagus $ 11.00 each). But when I feel like we are sitting at a fast food place or food court and I just want to finish my meal and leave as soon as possible, it's very annoying to pay that kind of price. I wished that I would have checked the reviews before booking, as there were a number of reviews that also complained about the noise:  "loud"; "deafening house music"; "couldn't carry on a conversation"; etc. I don't expect a night club, dance club, lounge or bar to be quiet or have a romantic atmosphere. But I had hoped for a better experience at a supposedly top class RESTAURANT. If you decide to go here for the food, which was very good, get an end booth or table in the middle of the restaurant or dine outside (thunderstorm happening when were there, so that option not available) and don't expect a romantic or conversational atmosphere - unless they turn the volume down!

B9K7WJanIdNyxcS3DWU80w.text: The service here was downright awful. My girlfriend and I went in to check out the club around 10:00. The door guy was actually nice and told us the club opened at 11 and we could have a drink in the restaurant area until then. So we sat down and a waitress brought us a drink menu. However, she never came back to take our order. We were there for about a half hour before we finally left. She stopped by many times at the tables near us but never came to our table. We eventually left and when we came back to go to the club, we were greeted rudely by the bouncer and told to not even bother since we weren't on the guest list, even though we had a VIP coupon. Zero stars!!!! There are other clubs in Vegas.

vClYBVMdxJgqPkgEN1hRQg.text: While the food was fantastic and service almost great, the nightclub was a let down. After you wait in line to get in, you'll listen to music that encourages drinking, you will see people holding full bottles of liquor from their table service, and when you try to get through the crowd a young pup of a bouncer will stop you to see if you're intoxicated. He did this as we made our way through the thick crowd  to the bathroom. He tried to separate us( females) and take one to a back room ALONE. I became irate and demanded he go get her husband first. I would NOT allow this nor should you!  We did go back and dance and saw someone WHISKED away by the guys in dark suits to the backroom. Yet the drunk with the Vodka and the other with Patron bottle stood around. Total harassment that was extremely intimidating.

zHHIG8pNJbSsC9wKIfH-Rw.text: Ate here last week (7/16/2011) with wife and brother and his wife. All four of us agree it might have been best meal we ever ate. Kobe beef carpacchio, lobster bisque, 12 oz filets and the 20 oz ribeye with bearnaisse left our jaws on the floor. Steak was as good as or even better than Ruths Chris or Mortons here in Orlando. Price felt like we stole our meals. Thank you Lavo for making our last meal in Vegas unforgettable after some shoddy dinners in other places. A must eat when staying in Palazzo or Venetian, or for anyone out there!

nTi7Rvlc_gey4Zaw1g1XXw.text: Restaurant - incredible.  Meatballs were amazing and service was great.  Funny enough, the music going in the dining room was better than in the club later that night!  Definitely get the oreo dessert!  Recommended.

XjgM5NrEn1ENhn1Y2Wr90A.text: The most rude and obnoxious run restaurant in Las Vegas. i was there this past Friday night. The food was awful, the service was ok but the people who manage the place are the most unprofessional that i have ever seen. I have a lot of friends who travel to Las Vegas very frequently and i will tell them to cross this off their list! I have friends in the media as well and they will get the word too! Get off your high horse Lavo, Your place is not all that.  i also told the concierge group at the Encore and they  felt the same way.

AlLE_YBV6AFt0xPORJ6fXQ.text: I have gone here about once a month for the past four or five months. Ive never seen much of a line outside. Never waitied more than two minutes to get in. I usually go around 11:30PM. This past week, I decided to eat dinner there for the first time. I made reservations for 9pm yet I was not seated until 9:20. I had one of their meatballs which was good but not heaven like some of these other reviwers claim. I also had the 8 oz filet mignon. It was overcooked. Ambiance and feel of the place was good. Tables were a little large. Employees friendly. Bathrooms clean. 3.5/5 for the restaurant. If you eat here or if you are local as I am admission will be free to the nightclub. Also, if you are a lady you will get free vodka drinks from 11PM to midnight.  I usually have a great time at the nightclub. It's one of the smallest ones I have been too but Ive also met some really cool people in here and that's what going to the clubs is all about for me. 4/5 for the nightclub. I'll be going again so maybe I will see you there!

uI_hOkz5eZIKsd7nziwMSA.text: The Lavo nightclub is the kind of place that you wait for hours to get into, pay too much for cover, then have to push through a crowd of sweaty guys in affliction shirts and girls that look like Snooki to get to the bar where you pay $22 for a watered down drink. Any women in your party can expect to be unwillingly groped by strangers and any men can expect the bouncers and staff to give them a hard time about letting them in. If stress and douchebaggery are what you're looking for in a nightclub, Lavo is your place.

x6hG9yfMCB8OJVZUfV0u0A.text: My friend and i only went to the restaurant, not the club because it was a Monday night. I do have to say that this was the best meal I think I have ever had; just absolutely amazing!!! I wish there was a LAVO where I lived. Our server and other helpers were incredibly nice as well.

fh3x-M-8ErovJBTQW7zdcA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this club! We went on Friday night for a bachelorette party and I loved that it was not too crowded. It was just right actually. It didn't feel dead but there was room to actually move and walk around, even room to dance on the floor room! (I know I was shocked too). It's located inside the Palazzo, which is right next door to Venetian!

08RPFDsOyjy408O96AxdbA.text: LAVO = Douche bag central   It was our first night in Vegas (Sunday). We walked by around midnight and saw the small line and decided to check it out. We were staying at the Venetian so we got in for free. Thank friggin god. I would not want to pay $10 and $20 for the boy to get in here. You'll see why...   The lounge was chill. Lots of loungy couches with hookahs on each table and plenty of seats at the bar. The decor was chic, dark and inviting. I enjoyed the music much more downstairs as they played the euro-house-trance type music.   We watched an abundance of Asian girls dressed in their skimpiest Forever 21 dresses (the faces did not match the outfits...hilarious) walk the line of 20+ running sinks to the upstairs club. The space was very small.   There was a small space on the perimeter of the dance floor for table service. There were TONS of douches here with what it appeared to be hired escorts. No joke. There was another group of euro douches who were standing on their table attempting to "make it rain". What friggin idiot posers. Ick!   After I threw up in my mouth several times, I decided it was time to go. I would definitely return to the lounge area but I WOULD NOT pay to get in.

ENuPlhNSus8Wn3xIsaDK5g.text: Went for dinner with a group of 8 as a way to finish our Vegas trip with a nice relaxing dinner.   I wouldn't say the food was anything spectacular, but it was certainly good.  Appetizers: Mussels: a little bit too acidic for my liking, but I did like the sourdough bread in the bowl  Eggplant Parm: Decent, we only got this one to please the vegetarians in our group  Prosciutto: Excellent.  Calamari: Perfectly friend and not soggy at all. The garlicy marinara was also very good  Entrees:   I ordered the Mushroom and Chicken Ravioli. It was very tasty, a little salty for some of the others at the table.  Other entrees ordered included the Veal Parm (pretty good, but didn't come with any pasta), Short Rib Risotto (so salty it was inedible and had to be sent back), and 1 or 2 of their flat bread pizzas (definitely pass on these)  Overall, the food wasn't bad, the atmosphere was great, and the service sucked

HdwkDVo3efdkCLvpVcCELw.text: You don't have to read my reviews to convince you this spot is just terrible. The Palazzo itself is grand, awesome and has beatiful places for pictures.  I was reluctant to come here. My girl stated,"Yeah a friend of mine has hookups there." Truth of the matter Vegas has no hookups for men, yet we usually pay the bill in Vegas. I already know and understand this about Vegas. No biggie.  Let me illustrate to you how poorly run this waste of space is. From the beginning. The line causes confusion. You have an entrance door that within close proximity to an exit door. Once you enter, you eventually end up at the exit door. Then you ask yourself, "Why don't they just use both doors?" One can be used as a VIP entrance. No fire codes would be violated in the process.  Bars are poorly stocked. Lost count at the amount of times bartenders were calling for replenishments. Then you get other employees trying to squeeze past you carrying drinks "by hand" to get to the bartender. Aisles are super tight on the second floor. This is the main club area. Security here is inefficient too. Keep the aisles clear guys. Cmon.   Very frustrating place to be. We exited within 20 minutes.

7BiKHPom1O9f4fEkCGzAsA.text: This was night two in Vegas. I was at Tao the night before but left after a short time because I was in a foul mood. I'll start this off by saying that I am not a club person at all so I'm hardly in a position to offer good pointers. However I had a good time here. I was in a substantially better mood and it doesn't hurt that we had our own private area....and bottle service so I guess I'd REALLY be a tool if I had a bad time after that. I like the layout of this place better than Tao. The bar is elevated and slightly away from the dance floor so it makes getting drinks easier, and the bathrooms are much more accessible than Tao.  The music was good and it was just a much more enjoyable time. I'm willing to wager that you would like this place if you're a little older (i.e.late 20's-mid 30's) and not quite as pre-occupied with the scene. Didn't seem to be as many douches. The only downside is that there are no hot chicks in bathtubs or in clear boudoir cubicles like there are at Tao. However, if having a good time is more important than being seen, you'll probably like this place.

55_3O_cpfI-6mWlK13urrg.text: Lavo is the best restaurant in Vegas, been almost 20 times, come every time I'm in Vegas and have recommended it to everyone I know. LOVE the calamari, Kobe beef spaghetti and meatballs, and the manager Paschal is the sweetest and makes sure you have a top of the line waitstaff and experience, gave us the most delicious Oreo dessert!!!!  You won't regret it!!!!

Q7xqdMFQMK29vr2-fiJvvQ.text: Although we originally decided to eat here because of the convenience factor (we were staying at the Palazzo), it was probably the best meal me my friends and I had while in Vegas.   The night started off with a great server who helped us choose a few things to share, warning us of how big the serving sizes were. And this is a rare quality to have in a server as they usually roll their eyes and get annoyed about people splitting dishes (I know... I used to serve too!)  Between 6 girls, we had 2 salads, the cacciatore pizza, spaghetti carbonara(yum!) and the spaghetti with kobe meatballs. We added a side of wild mushrooms. The bread that they bring out with cheese/garlic topping and a side of marinara sauce was UN-REAL.   Overall, great service and food made for a great night in Vegas!

mO3pfl1403rE3fI_q8wE5Q.text: Fire hazard and a shithole to boot. Was there over july 4th weekend, and the club was so dangerously overpacked that people would have probably died if any sort of fight or fire broke out there. We ended up having our table moved downstairs after the host tried to put us in a broom closet sized table for 8 of us.   XS made this place look like a dump.

MjzhJdbFSJ4cCXGFIg4FaA.text: After seeing a dead guy in front of Tao, we were a lil fucked up and got all bad vibes, freaked out, and headed back to our room at Palazzo. Came across Lavo; were able to bypass the line and went inside...   Its nice, for a small club, its big on decor. The mosaic mirrored pieces everywhere and the catwalk with the faucets is pretty cool.   Super crowded. Not enough beautiful people, that's for sure.   And I know I am probably in the minority for this: But I HATE what everyone is mixing these days, progressive house? Untz Untz, BOOM!  I hate it I think it really sucks. No one can dance well to it, the go go chicks look a lil strange trying to rock to it.   Really pissed me off in fact.   To almost every other review that complains about drink prices in a club in Vegas- you probably shouldn't be at a club in Vegas. Moronic complaint.   Not impressed, maybe would go back if it happened to be easy and convenient.

MKTy_cxFM6q0Vt36tnJc4Q.text: Came in for drinks with a dreamy little hunk of man meat and had a nice time.  Had a great lemon blueberry drink and a glass of prosecco.  It was pretty quiet at the bar, so service could afford to be friendly and attentive. The bathroom attendant freaked me out; she wasn't there when I walked in, but then she would magically appear when I came out of the stall.  Is she materializing in through the walls?  Hiding in a stall?  Weird. Really a gorgeous location.

uBYQMxQYdx3g0QcUV0XSIQ.text: I have been pleasantly surprised by LAVO.  We've hung out in the lounge area and upstairs in the club portion.  Awesome mixed drinks downstairs!   The door men are excellent.  They gave us a little grief getting in trying to charge us, and I pointed to my friend with great boobs wearing a short skirt and I said don't you want her in your club?  He smiled and moved the rope.  ;)

yuN1CFLtE5iR-hk6seSzxA.text: LAVO was created from the creators of TAO. Where is it located? Well friends, LAVO is  located at the beautiful Palazzo Hotel & Casino! This place was the first nightclub that I started my night off in my Halloween Vegas weekend extravaganza.   Upon arriving, I saw that there was a line formed to get inside the nightclub and another to eat at the restaurant. My best friend knew the promoter and we were on the guest list. Walking in the establishment, you entered at the restaurant. The restaurant was on the first floor and the club was on the second floor. I guess this would be an ideal combination if you were dining at LAVO and then wanted to start dancing right off the bat. Burn them calories ya'll :)!  As we walked up the stairs and through the hallway, I was a bit confused of why there were a bunch of faucets with flowing water and ice cubes that were lit up. I expected like fire or something else because LAVO reminded me of lava but then reminding me that lava means wash in Spanish and  lavo means bathe in Latin. Therefore,  I concluded that it made sense for the faucets to be there haha! :D  Supposedly LAVO overlooks the The Strip where you can see one of the  best views in all of Las Vegas. When I went, however, the place was too packed and the music, vibe and the people were not very happening. There were more people just standing and sitting down  trying to look classy than getting down on the dance floor :/.  Overall, okay place to get your pre-dancing legs on. Nice decor, okay music. If you're a lady, you'll have a shot to get in for free and get some free drinks. The dance floor is small and there are stairs you need to watch out for when walking around the club.

1hLR1xrErHIV0yxmJiPVCw.text: So I have been to LAVO twice and it is both the best and worst Vegas nightclub I have been to. The first time I went, back in August for a friend's birthday, was awesome. My friends and I were full of liquid courage and willing to dance ourselves stupid. The second time, however, last Sunday to be precise, I had a miserable time. I went there for another friend's birthday and it was so crowded you could barely move let alone dance. That wouldn't have been so bad other than the fact that my friend was belligerent and had to be prevented from inadvertently throwing bows into people's faces. This too would have been fine if it wasn't for somebody lobbing their drink glass on to the dance floor and hitting me square in the back of the head. Luckily I didn't have anything more than a bump and headache to show for it. Suffice it to say my night was put off a bit by that incident.   Anyways, LAVO is a pretty cool club; it has some interesting decorations such as the mini sinks/ fountains in the hallway between the restaurant and the dance floor (into which my friends and I have seen some drunk fellas relieving themselves). The line to get in (for those of us non VIPs) goes pretty quickly and it doesn't seem particularly difficult to get in anyways. Also, for those of you whom the downstairs men's room confuses, the way to turn on the sink is to use the foot pedal located at its base. Oh, and if it's your birthday the bartenders are happy to make you the most potent Adios Motha F**** you have ever experienced.

f2TebNr9_AZ9yZwr4mWprQ.text: This was really a pleasant surprise. Food was more than just decent. Granted, the price can be a bit much, but definitely worth it.

T8Yu99fyOMZjaYli7iQI8g.text: A club is only as fun as the people you go with and what you make of it. With that said, I had one helluva time.  The bouncers were friendly, and it was a breeze to get in.  Our table waitress Crystal was adorable and attentive.      They had storage boxes at our table to put our purses in.  Nice touch.  The venue itself was nothing breath taking - not ugly by all means, but for Vegas - usually it has to have some je ne sais quo, right?  The music was typical - hip hop then change - then something else - then change, but all together was fine.  My girls were dancing on tables, having drunken fun.  And thats all that matters.

h-8QQP92bPT1hTRYgOiTyw.text: Not sure if I missed something or if I wasn't fully prepared for what I was in for but, I didn't love this place. I really am normally drunk enough that I don't notice random strangeness. But, this was far more then that or maybe I needed more drinks?   We came here after a great dinner at SushiSamba and I was so excited to check this place out hearing so much about it.   We walked in and loved the decor going up to the club area. But, it took a quick turn for the worse. Not even 30 seconds in this place we spot a little person dressed in a unique costume - he was wearing a collar and a leash that was attached to the bull nose ring on a very large woman. I looked at my girlfriends and we all had the "WTF?" look on our face.   We exited stage left 30 seconds later!

0fXLHRWoQf6UUQdjxjsfbA.text: I actually had a lot of fun here. IT's REALLY EXPENSIVE HERE!!! We didn't have to wait in line, but originally it was supposed to be $10 for guys, but it ended up being $30, oh well. Free drinks for the girls. I was quite thirsty, so thanks to the girls in our group hooked me up with a couple of drinks, quite refreshing because there wasn't much alcohol. I bought 8 shots here, and it came out to $120!!! It's more expensive than Club XS!!!!! Dance area is pretty small and stuffy, music is okay. Overall, I had a good time with good friends! =)

Y9OvHK6yvfHfFyRtok95Gw.text: I had dinner at Lavo the day after Christmas. It was a very slow night, but the host, waiter, and busser didn't use that opportunity to slack! The entire crew was very attentive and professional even when they were idle. No shenanigans like the employees filmed on the Food Network's Mystery Diners or Restaurant Stakeout.  The menu is simple, but delicious. I had the Spaghetti w/ Kobe meatballs with wine - surprisingly pleasant. I just assumed pasta can be like pasta anywhere else. I do wish they would include more seafood pasta on their menu, such as crab and lobster ravioli.

n2EFhfF3reLfo__6FVKcMA.text: LAVO Restaurant. Bathhouse. Lounge/Nightclub.   What the hell is a bathhouse? The only thing I could make from it was that there were about 20 sinks lined up in a row on the way up to the dance floor. Go figure, I was confused!   The first floor is more loungey, chill, relaxing. The second floor consists of the 20 sinks I just mentioned. And the third floor is where you shouldn't go if you're epileptic. Strobe lights going, people dancing, dark then bright, loud, etc. I couldn't see much up here since it was mostly dark all the time but after say 10 minutes, we left.   Maybe I'll come back next time...but for now, it's definitely not one of Vegas' most poppin' clubs.

EdTOcDuYcAgMwY5W8XkXCg.text: Touche, Venetian...Touche.  I was impressed with Lavo. It was an interesting decor walking up with floating Tuscan sinks trickling water and crystalline beads all around...and then getting into what can only be described as a Moroccan meets Greek UltraLounge.   I was amazed at how much seating there was. Finally, a club that understands you shouldn't have to pay hundreds of dollars for a VIP booth in order to be comfortable! The music was popping, and the scene was fresh...It got crowded quick after 11, and I was having a great time on the dance floor...  The drinks were a little much (12 dollar shots of Jager? Please.) But this is Lavo; the "IT" Venetian club on the week days...Its in a prime hotel, in a prime location...of course it'll cost a couple green ones. Check it out if you're in the 21-30 age group...

8Dr6jFx3BI5eDKQ8_tqbCQ.text: Loved Loved Loved the food.   My guy took me here for my bday, and it was amazing.  It helped that we ordered everything on the menu.  Here goes the food:   Garlic Bread - OMG amazing. it was so tasty.  The nice thing is that this was the bread served at the table.  Looks like its baked upon being seated.  It was fresh and accompanied with tomato sauce.  Spinach Artichoke Pizza - 2 foot pizza.  It was so tasty and definitely something that can be shared at the table.  It was flaky and full of flavor. Kobe Meatball - Okay, i don't eat meat...but i was told this was to die for.  Also, our waiter told us that this is one of their signature dishes.   Ceasar Salad - definitely large enough to be shared at the table.  we didn't even finish it.  But it was tasty and flavorful.  croutons were well done.  Filet Mignon - again, i dont eat meat but i was told it was cooked to perfection.  Chilean Sea Bass - yummy, full of flavor, accompanied with tomatos.  Polenta Fries - OMG....so good.  I'm still thinking about this today.  Oreo filled Pastries with Ice Cream - Yummy...how can you go wrong?   Less one star because i've been to the club...and it's small, stuffy, and I wasn't too jazzed about it.    My new favorite restaurant in Vegas!

NsJIWB17uPjNGj5yfq703g.text: Lavo is located in what I consider to be the best casino hotel on the strip; Palazzo. Decor is modern Moroccan and they have a restaurant, club, and hookah lounge. The service is fast (perhaps too much so) and the food is great. Unique dishes, but not unrecognizeble. The cocktails are unique and fresh as well. The one drawback is their liberal application of sauces. Our dishes were good but would have been better with less sauce. Might want to specify this when ordering. Other than that, Lavo is worth the visit.

gaJViDXyvJn40nijYa-UBA.text: So I went to the nightclub part of LAVO and my oh my I had a great time. The energy coming from the dj to everyone out there was flat out crazy. I'll keep this short and sweet, if you go to vegas, you better hit up LAVO! Especially on a saturday, I had the time of my life :)

Zm5FJNsvzbd53tRnt-pLaw.text: This is a dinner review and yay! I'm a fan.  Our reservation timing was off but our hostess took us to a comfortable location of the very dark dining room.  I just have to accept that all dining rooms in las vegas are so dark that you need a flash light.    It's a great italian eatery with somewhat affordable prices at $22-36 entrees.    We started off with cocktails but I had a nice cava sparkling wine.  They were perfectly blended and very chic.    I had the kobe meatballs and spaghetti and one of my friends had the chicken parm.  Note that the main entrees like chicken parm do not come with sides.  Here comes ginormous mounds of food to our table.  My kobe meatballs was so delicious and such tender meat loaded with big chunks of basil.  The spaghetti was homemade!  And the marzano tomato sauce was delicious!  The chicken parm was pounded to 1" but the length of a 9" dinner plate.  It was smothered with cheese and looked very good.  I was so disappointed I couldn't take it home since we were going out clubbing but you definitely need a doggie bag.  The meals here fill you up!  I would recommend this for dinner but reservations book up very quickly.

X3z3sJPXfQQsgvkiJZfBOA.text: The ambiance is nice at Lavo, but the service & food were unsatisfactory. Had Saturday brunch outside on a beautiful day with friends, however, when I ordered the hamburger & it was served, I asked for mustard. That's when the silliness by the wait staff began. First, the waiter said he would go get it. Then, approximately 5 minutes later, he came to the table & said they were out. When I told him I couldn't believe a restaurant that serves burgers would be out of mustard, he laughed & said that the head chef actually hates mustard & refuses to have it in the restaurant. I had not realized the burger had already been covered with mayonnaise, which I can't eat. The fries that accompanied the burger smelled awful and apparently had been fried in some sort of truffle oil. The meat was overcooked. All in all, a pretty bad meal with a big price tag. If you're looking for a great American hamburger, although it's on the menu at Lavo, skip it. After this experience I won't be going back.

oOLUWFj18FZHsbfYbt_fBA.text: Went here for dinner on Friday night... We had 8 dudes, but even though we had a reservation and it was late (9:45)... we had to wait a bit and they sat us outside...in the 100 degree heat.  The heat wasn't a big deal, but we kind of missed out on the whole decor and atmosphere of the inside.  The kobe meatball was very good.  I just got an 8 ounce filet.  It was good... but it doesn't even come w/ a potato or anything... but the side of asparagus i got was heaping and tasty.  The filet was good though... cooked to my specifications and seasoned nicely... most other people got pasta dishes... do'nt know what they thought, but most looked pretty normal.  Service was good.  They got everything right.  Not super pricey, but pricey.  But overall I was underwhelmed... I just had the feeling that I would rather pay more to eat better or pay less to eat junky.  No real complaints... but I wasn't wowed by anything.

Ba8BUzDhgm3QmesWhaQuyg.text: This is a review for the dinner not the club. My girlfriend wanted to eat here for her Bday dinner over memorial day weekend. The ambience was ok. It was EXTREMELY loud in the restaurant like the club was in the same room. We had a party of 5 and we had to almost yell at each other. i guess our expectations were different. The bar area was cool with a little lounge area. The food was OK nothing great about it. The service in the beginning was fine the guy was informative but after the food arrived we NEVER saw him again. I had to get other people to help us with our table and they were less than impressive. Overall Definitely NOT going to dinner there maybe the club it looked pretty good and saw some celebrities.

EKz1jan2PhzAxD2FIToZ0A.text: y'know, they all seem to be the same after a while.  some theme (bathhouse here at lavo), pretty things dancing on elevated platforms, top 40, they all are so similar.  lavo is relatively impressive, but really, im not that much of a nightclub kinda guy. they do have some of the nicest promoters though (rob) and i did get in for free, but the danceflo was a tad too tiny for my liking.

5A3fRiLDifm_6c4QprQ8qQ.text: Lavo is an interesting place. It gets high marks for its theming, which is what I tend to look for in a nightclub. The 'sinks' upstairs on the catwalk are quite interesting. As far as the drinks: expensive, as you might expect in the city. When this place gets crowded, you can expect being smack dab next to another soul, sharing the tiny space that is the dance floor. The mixes can be OK, but not great. XS is a better bet.

Ilk0WAhRCUuSCXwYnBPr2Q.text: Just got back from Vegas for friends 40th and read all the reviews before we left. We went on a Friday night for dinner and the club upstairs. Here's an ''old timers'' perspective on Lavo:  Dining Space: 1) Younger crowd and place was packed at 9:30. 2) Interior had stunning decor with candle lighting to set great mood. Decor says anything but Italian but certainly spectacular. 3) Restaurant had lots of energy and DJ was mixing dance music in the dining area. Music was loud but not so loud that you couldn't have table conversations. 4) Had to wait 10 minutes with reservation. 5) Good mix of tables and booths. Large expansive space with tall ceilings. Comfortable lounge areas around large bar. 6) Good service at table given the busy atmosphere. Not a place for a quiet, romantic type dinner though hostess recommended the patio for a quieter spot for dining. 7) Extensive Italian Menu with many updated and good executions if classic Italian dishes. 8) Prices were reasonable by Vegas standards. 9) Meal came with ultra-buttery garlic bread and marinara dipping sauce which took a while to get to our table since they make batches fresh. 10)  Chicken Marsala was best I've had. Tender chicken,  rich sauce and fresh mushrooms. Wife's Filet was tender, flavorful and cooked perfect. Fried fresh Mozzarella appetizer/salad was excellent and worth the bucks. Fried polenta side also excellent as was the baked potato. Chocolate bread pudding dessert was also excellent and big enough to share. Overall very impressed with the food. 11)  Read reviews and strangely, bathrooms are a point of interest in the place.  Club Space: 1) Guy comes around to our table and asks if we intended to visit the club upstairs. He stamped our hands which allowed us to enter the club without cost and waiting in line. Ladies I guess usually don't have to pay but guys usually do. Getting free admission with dinner is a nice perk. 2) Club was small and packed at 11:00. Typical club music and decor was similar to restaurant downstairs. 3) Didn't stay long because of the crowded space but definitely a fun and lively place.  Hard to find a restaurant that pulls together a great space, food, drinks, service AND nightclub too!

oa8R-U7Ghz_3b2lKuRMwHw.text: Classy looking place, but the food quality wasn't that good. If you're going to charge $30+ for your entrees, at least have them taste really good. Everything we ordered was over-salted. Probably the saltiest food I've had in a restaurant ever. When we told the waitress that, she didn't really pay any mind. We noticed that the same sauces and breadcrumbs were used in the apps and the entrees. At least be a little original with your dishes. I think any other restaurant would care more, but since this is Vegas, they can charge top dollar for average food. The crowds will keep coming in I guess.

BnHpm3kDLANaUf4cz4k1xw.text: Single handedly the best Italian restaurant I have been too. The food there is amazing from the appetizers (suggest the pizza), soups (Minestrone is beyond words), entrees (you cannot go wrong here), and dessert (the zeppoli is amazing). The nightclub is small but the service and atmosphere provided at LAVO is unmatched. The TAO Group has really struck gold here.

cxnvZLWkMSxelZfV8YPKeQ.text: so I came here on a Tuesday night, with 4 other girls. I guess one of the girls knew a guy who worked there because 1st we went into the lounge where we had bottle service then after mayev 30 mins he took us upstairs to the nightclub. It was packed inside. Another guy who worked at the club got me a drink and then took me and my friend to the stage. we dance up there for awhile and then left. The club was okay, maybe wouldve been more fun if I was drunk.

0NoOt-6eEq4qAghU-OT8dQ.text: Several things seem to be amiss with this restaurant.   One, when I made the reservation, I was told I had to make a $150.00 deposit in case I failed to show. I've NEVER heard of this policy even at some of the best, but my friend really wanted to go, so fine.  Funny thing is, with the three of us, our dinner was only $115. (We didn't order alcohol)    Two, I ordered Shu-Mai, and it came with raw shrimp and pork, which sad to say I ate half of one before I realized it. Second attempt was met with the same results.  Thankfully I eat raw ethnic food on a regular basis, so I did not get sick.       There were many other inconsistencies with service and the food, which were relatively minor, so I won't bore you, but added to the deal breakers above, I just think this place is odd.  I love raw bar, but prefer it be stated on the menu.       On the plus side, the concept and Decor was very cutting edge and made for one of the coolest restaurants I've ever been in ambiance-wise..                          All in all, too much trouble and expense for normal to below average food. (my friend liked his noodle dish)

eFTD5WriPc4kg50oVIYBSw.text: ***Nightclub*** To sum it up in a sentence "The 5hit is wack"...   So after a late dinner at First Food & Bar at Pallazo we were able to take a stroll over to Lazo to cap the night off since this seems to be one of the new spots on the strip that everybody says is oh so must go! Usually that spells disaster, as you get the clueless crowd that just wants to be seen in the newest club (even though it sucks), so they can go back to work the next day and tell the girls "Giiiiirl, i was so f' in it up over at Lavo last night".. i guess.  Upon entry i felt like i was going thru a maze before we finally got to what they called "da club", this place is SMALL. The great room in my home is bigger than this place, not to mention decorated better as well. I could tell from the moment i walked in that this place was going to be wall to wall in about 30 minutes and its going to be a mess. Unless your bottle service is comped do not waste the money, the tables are damn near on the dance floor, crowded and way too over ran with bopper kids. I have never seen a decent club with VIP table service and no security, it truly becomes a mess after it gets packed and then you have people crowding your table, trying to drink from your expensive bottle of vodka and the ability to not even really dance. We left early for Vegas time lines at 1am and said yeah never again.  I prefer that if your paying $12-$15 a drink and upward of $300 for a bottle serv'ed table that it has somewhat of an atmosphere, and gives a little more to offer than what Lavo has to offer which really was nothing special at all. Save the time and effort and go somewhere else.

-NFwiuyQGnBMalz75HClDQ.text: The club might be awesome but restaurant is a different story. The food was very disappointing, and the hostess even worst. She wouldn't seat our party (we had made reservations the day before) until the rest of the group showed up. What kind of a place makes you stand to wait?!

v_CrWx-YCiTyYZHq03p83g.text: YUM!!!! This place was awesome! I loved it! We came here for a 21st birthday party and I am so glad we did. The food was insane! And as a vegetarian there were plenty of options and the servings were huge. I had the Rigatoni with buffalo mozzarella and tasted a few of the other dishes. Then we ordered several of each dessert on the menu and I have to say The fried oreos and strawberry shortcake were my favorite. I would definitely go back here again for the amazing food.

ZelcPTU6-N9Jid3XhtA2vw.text: Mediocre Italian style food. Definately a hit or miss but do not try the horrendous Chicken parmagiana or spaghetti with fresh tomatos and basil unless you have never tasted good Italian food before. In defense of the restaurant, my wife did love her lobster cocktail and zeppoli oreos, (my apple tatin was horrible). Server was very helpful, telling us to only order 1 chicken parmagiana as the size was the size of a dinner plate so it was large enough to share and also advised us against ordering another dish that she said had to be bad as whenever it was ordered it was always sent back (I think it was their braised short rib risotto if I recall). As the French say in Quebec-never again!

vxbOFEZDszwSf-NIOEesvQ.text: Lavo, the night club, didn't really rock my world. It was crowded and stuffy but the bartenders that served our table was really attentive and sweet. Initially, they didn't serve Tokyo tea, but she made it happen. Yayy her. Anyhoo it was packed like sardines and everyone was sweating. Hmm maybe Tao wouldve been better.

FASic1O2Xhs0_WKIyiEy-w.text: Our anniversary dinner at LAVO was outstanding. The food and our server, Lucas were equally exceptional. Ask for him. He is outstanding.  We had the meatball salad, the 2 lb lobster, the filet and mashed potatoes and asparagus for dinner. The deep fried oreos were a delicous surprise. I didnt think it would work but it does.  I am going to plan this dinner for our anniversary every year.

5GxtzZAfUdO827ECR0AU_g.text: Nice atmosphere but service was not good at all. I always expect amazing service from big high end restaurants. The server took a while and came by to say bread was coming. It never came, in fact a table who sat after us got their bread before we did. I never got it except when my carbonara pasta came and wanted bread with it which I then asked the manager who came to check on us and sent it right away and apologized. The pasta was alright. The drinks were good and strong. In the end, again had to ask a porter/runner to get our waiter to get us the check. Never checked on us. Im not sure if its a vegas thing and they just dont care cause people will soend anyway to eat but service needs to be better than this @ Tao. Scene is nice and decor too. Thats it.

AB13lsv1dC2HoonOIJeo6A.text: Drinks: Liquid silk drink, basically a dirty martini with blue cheese olives. One of my favorite drinks, HOWEVER, it was so poorly made. Not enough of any of the ingredients except the olives. Tasted watered down.   Whiskey sour was nothing special, they should invest in better drinks.  NY drink was pretty good. Fresh blackberries and whiskey! -Mojito did its job, was a better choice.   Food:   Margarita pizza is a good one to share between two individuals.   Tuna tartare- the avocado chunks were too largely cut and too ripe. The sauce on the bottom was of some vinegar taste and did not mesh well with any of the ingredients and the tuna itself was so bland. Don't bother ordering this.   The sea bass was bland but the portobello mushrooms accompanied with the fish were delicious.   Side mashed potatoes were fabulous, didn't taste like the powdered kind. Was also not too heavy.   The filet mignon (medium) with Bernaise sauce was the best of the bunch. Cooked perfectly, however the outter layer was too salty.   Whoever seasons the foods needs to figure out what they're doing with their lives because they're doing it all wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8oz. Filet mignon

EpNUukxNKlfZ7Pndzqz9AQ.text: I've eaten at Lavo a few times. Their food is hit or miss dish-wise on the menu. The oysters & shrimp cocktail are delicious. I rarely enjoy oysters and I can eat a dozen here. The burger is great too. But I wasn't impressed with the pasta I tried, the chicken parmesan, their famous meatball, etc. it's all good but not great. So I kind of have a love/hate relationship with the dishes here! Love the restaurant itself though. Great patio right on the strip, awesome people watching, and a spacious indoors.  They do Lavo brunch, a club scene brunch on Saturday, which is always a BLAST. Service has always been wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail &amp; Oysters on the Half Shell amazing

yK6xcUqH9Z4IHJeSGz_-0Q.text: I don't know how this place is receiving a 3.5 when the service we received here was beyond spectacular. My friend and I came here after exploring a couple of the hotels on the strip and were served by two amazing waiters who catered to our needs on a timely manner given the rush we were in to get back in time for EDC on Sunday. We got the Mac and cheese, which was very filling but a little on the salty side; delicious nonetheless. We received a complementary dessert too, which was a nice surprise too! Cheers Lavo, thanks for accommodating us at our brief visit to the Vegas strip :)

-jehzyxmN3Np8nSGSwFlxg.text: Extremely great service, great food, and even better drinks!! The Lavotini is a must and for those who aren't looking for an alcoholic drink, the cranberry spiced mojito is great too.  As per everyone's suggestion, I had the meatball for my appetizer. Again, it was AMAZING   P.S. don't forget to check in to get that free Oreo dessert! It's big enough to share!

BMizdxhiaLyI26fsSnQ5Jg.text: I'm just commenting on the day party I attended this past weekend (Sunday 12/30). I was impressed by the amount of people there and how fun it was. The music was good, the crowd was great and it was good entertainment to get in the mood for later night festivities. I would definitely come back for their day parties.

PzRY13Z3NbZNAJk_GD0lyA.text: Ok, I'll start off saying that the service was fabulous and so was the meatball. Our server was quite pleasant and made honest recommendations on the menu.   The one star review comes from me getting food poisoning and puking my brains out and pissing out of my back side for literally 24 hours.. while on my honeymoon. We had a reservation for dinner at 9pm. I had the seafood linguini. It was good, nothing terrible, totally fine in taste and nothing about the seafood made me think the seafood was undercooked or anything. Around 1am I started to feel super queasy. Knots in the stomach, heat flashes. I ran to the casino bathroom and spent about 30 min with my head in public bathroom toilet. Not how I wanted to spend my honeymoon.   I finally felt well enough to get into a cab and make our way back to the hotel. Where I hugged the toilet for another hour or so.   So if you're planning to eat here, steer clear of all seafood and just get two meatballs instead.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood linguine
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatball was delish
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and antipasta

P-IBOd7JYnwv6pbugEOlsQ.text: Awesome place for brunch, extremely awesome staff and management. My server was Erin and she was exceptionally terrific. She really made the experience stand out for us. We had the bottomless mimosas which was well worth it. The manager on duty (don't recall his name ...tall guy with dark hair) was awesome. Came to check on our table and helped Erin out. Excellent service  Keep up the great job

YVLybqSl4kDZ2EQTA_j4IA.text: Fancied this location on a Sunday with about 10 people for brunch. I had never been here before and did not know what to expect as I had heard it gets crazy fun. My friend had made a reservation the day before and had requested a specific server. When we arrived the receptionist advised they could not accommodate us in his section. My friends that come on a regular basis were quite bummed by this. We sat inside and the decor is beautiful, large chandeliers and nice place settings. The crowd was everything from large groups of bachelorette parties, people with their parents, dates and the occasional well mannered children. We all got bottomless mimosas which were fabulous. I was quite buzzed walking out, which tells me that they did a good job serving up the drinks. I ordered the eggs Benedict and substituted bacon instead of ham. It came with a refreshing green salad and I really enjoyed the whole thing. Only hiccup is that I requested hot sauce (cause every egg dish needs hot sauce, right?) And it took like 15 minutes to get it, so by the time I ate my food, it was cold. For dessert, our check in with Yelp allowed for deep fried oreos with icecream. Well Im not sure if it was ice-cream or sauce, cause if it was ice-cream it was completely melted like a sauce, but tasted like icecream. Did not complain as it was complementary, but it was disappointing. The oreos though were on point, and I chowed them down. I got the pleasure of mingling a bit with some of the staff and met the Manager Mark. He was very accommodating to make sure that I was happy and that my drink was refilled and given a to go cup. I also met one of the waiters, Jason. This guy.... He is so fun. I would definitely request to sit in his section next time, if they could accommodate it. Overall, fun times and I should be back again.

Fs4uuQCEbl73XTVesSte3Q.text: Walking inside lavo is so beautiful! My friend had her birthday brunch there today at 1130 am, and our sever was gave great hospitality! I wish I can remember her name so she can get credit for this post, she served 8 of us. The food was beautifully served. I'll be coming back for my birthday brunch !

A79PDlgp5Wi8s---kGaj1A.text: Amazing food, service, music, and ambiance. Went for my birthday, so got a free birthday desert. Had the seafood pasta with spicy marina sauce. (Wasn't spicy at all to me, though so good) My husband had the chicken parmesan which he enjoyed. Delicious garlic bread, olives, marinated vegetables, and chunk parmesan to start. Prices are reasonable for the food taste and portions. My husband and I aren't into super expensive, really fancy places, so Lavo is perfect for us. Will go back next time in Vegas for sure!!

dJADQGKBi3VugMzm2ePIZQ.text: 5 of us went for my friends 30th birthday on August 20th. The service was poor; especially considering the price point. We weren't told of any daily specials despite the server asking if it was our first time which it was. It didn't appear to be particularly busy; it was a Monday night- yet our server was oddly missing for most of dinner. My girlfriends first entree, a pasta dish with chicken was extremely salty. She has a a seafood allergy so several of the other pasta dishes weren't options for her which we knew going in. Only after she had to send the 1st dish back did our server tell us about their pasta special of the day! Turns out it was something 3 of the 5 of us would have ordered had we known it existed. While waiting for my girlfriends 2nd dish to come out no one checked on us; no manager came by to see if we were okay which is pretty standard in establishments of this supposed caliber.  My food; a seafood Alfredo was good at first bite but by the 4th bite was also very heavy on the salt. And I enjoy salt! I didn't bother sending it back as I typically try to avoid doing so; but I didn't eat anymore and I didn't get it to go.   The meatball was good but the seasoning was not evenly distributed - some bites were more seasoned and some bites were blander but overall it was good.   The 2 stars are for the atmosphere because the service and the food didn't stand up to the price point nor my expectations.   Needless to say I won't be going back or recommending it to anyone else. There are much better places to spend your money.

T9hD3HxaY9GM1kFOiQj7BQ.text: The meatball is a must! One of the best meals on the strip. You can't go wrong with any item on the menu.

DoHwSWyJ4NhNSsVgt8wrWw.text: Made reservations for 8pm, showed up 15 mins early waited over 75 minutes and went across the hall to the steakhouse instead. After a hour they gave me a drink voucher. This was after we already got two drinks from the bar after the long wait... What's the point of a reservation? I finally got a text the table was ready while I was having my calamari at the steakhouse  Edit So glad I came back to give them another shot. Made reservations for 830 no wait, Friendly staff and great ambiance. The manager Jason B recognized me and expressed that he was sorry for the long wait the other day.   The meatball was huge and delicious. Highly recommend.

IO4tGV5z4SFhFdUT_6WYCQ.text: This has a dark and sexy atmosphere. The whole experience was just wonderful!! We had reservations but we ended up eating at the bar. The bartender was really nice and had some excellent suggestions. We had 4 appetizers. The best salad, calamari, oysters and  bread dip. Every with delicious!!!

dT0_ErVhLRRjVu34c3h0Qw.text: My daughter and I went for Brunch. The service was very efficient and professional.  Our waiter greeted us  quickly after we were seated.   After we placed our order our waiter  brought is a mini coffee cake, which was hot and crusty. We were informed the first one was complimentary.  We both ordered omelets which were served with a small salad and side of home fries. The food was served hot and the presentation on the plate was very eye appealing as well as delicious. I also ordered a Mimosa which was very good.  I would highly recommend Lavo for a good dining experience with nice ambiance.

4oQfekFZsk1WQX_zUA8_9w.text: The restaurant was beautiful the waitress was nice but she was to busy to finish listening to what we wanted and ended up messing up our drinks twice -  the food was just ok. We had the spicy lobster bisque and the beet salad to start with a steak and the dumpling styled pasta as the main meal. I would go somewhere else to eat Las Vegas has better options.

t0R3OFp_RTldw1VYfrVUXg.text: LAVO has become our go-to place for bouncing back from serious caloric deficiencies after a weekend of rowdy Vegas partying. The portion sizes here are gargantuan, and so too are the flavors; surprisingly, the prices aren't necessarily so, especially if you're smart about what you order:  _____________  I'm not too sure as to why LAVO seems to take heat from some for the quality of its food preparation; everything that we've had from here has been nothing short of delightful & delicious.   + If your server doesn't offer you a basket of complimentary garlic bread, be sure to request it. LAVO's take on the textbook Italian dinner bread has a distinct buttery taste & satisfying initial crunch. The marinara spread offered alongside the bread was also a winner...I'm not ashamed to admit that I shoveled spoonfuls of the sauce into my mouth when no one was looking.  + We've sampled a handful of LAVO's appetizers in the past, including the delicious Calamari served with spicy marinara. The portion size of this starter is certainly enough to feed 3, possibly 4; it's a whole lot to split among 2 (you're pretty much guaranteed leftovers if you try!). The calamari themselves are crisp, meaty, and tender - some of the best that I've had.  + LAVO makes a damn tasty wedge salad. The restaurant's take on the classic is much heartier than what I'm used to; big chunks of meaty pancetta are used in place of bacon crumbs, and the creamy bleu cheese & gorgonzola do a great job of offsetting the bold savory flavors of the various entrees. Much like the Calamari, the Wedge is practically an entree all on its own, so come hungry!  + My GF insists that the Eggs Benedict at LAVO (served during brunch hours only) was one of the best that she's ever tried. I sampled a few bites and was also quite impressed at the perfectly cooked eggs & expertly flavored hollandaise.  We weren't big fans of the accompanying side salad, however...the whole mix had a strong, overpowering onion flavor that rendered it practically inedible.   + Don't miss out on the signature Wagyu Meatball; it's as filling as it is fork-tender. I recommend pairing the Meatball with the complimentary table bread, and slathering the bread slices with big bites of Wagyu beef & rich ricotta. Well worth every penny!   + I'm pretty confident that a party of 2 can order up an appetizer & two entrees and still get away with having some leftovers to take home. This can really play to your advantage if you order in moderation - for instance, our Wedge Salad, Eggs Benedict, & Kobe Meatball came out to about $65 during our last visit...not too shabby.  _____________  + You'll immediately notice how pretty the dining area is upon stepping in. It has an upscale, yet inviting vibe that matches well with the overall decor of the Venetian resort. The high ceilings, plush seats, and ornate fixtures set the stage in a classy way that doesn't spill into being over-the-top.   + LAVO is home to what I consider to be the coolest restroom sinks in all of Vegas. The foot-operated pump mechanism isn't the most 21st century setup that I've seen, but it's quite fun to operate and makes for a hilarious photo/video op.   + Service was attentive, if a little bit scripted. Everyone was polite, but in a forced, by-the-book sort of way (i.e. "Pardon my reach"). Loosen up, guys! That said, I did appreciate how the waiters promptly switched the channel on the bar TV to air the NBA playoffs per my request. (Evidently, many other male diners appreciated this request - though their wives/GFs didn't look too happy to see them glued to the screen!)  - I do have to dock a star for the lack of men's room upkeep/cleanliness that I witnessed during my last visit. Paper towels & toilet paper were out-of-stock, and there were tissues scattered all over the floors of the stalls. I was surprised to see that there was no restroom attendant - it looked as though the bathroom hadn't been checked up on for quite a while. Not impressed with this, especially considering the premium sort of vibe that LAVO tries to maintain.   _____________  PRO TIP:  LAVO offers a free tray of Oreo Zeppoles + Malted Vanilla Milkshake with any Yelp check-in! Don't miss out!!

b4aToAZKm0P_ogOsnSv5vw.text: Had dinner here last night at the bar with friends and it was fabulous!! The Meatball was delicious, filet cooked and seasoned perfectly and the seafood Alfredo yummy as well! Not sure why it's rated 3 1/2 Stars. I'm very picky and truly loved this place. Beautiful restaurant!!

qtG2C6dRgzQqso-nPZsYSw.text: I had somewhat mixed thoughts about this restaurant. This was a last minute decision to host a customer dinner after a group reception. Someone in the group recommended Lavo as being one of the best restaurants.  I used Open Table to make a last minute reservation for 6. When we arrived, we were seated immediately. The staff was very nice and let us sit where we could talk and still hear each other. Lavo used to be a night club years ago, but they still play loud dance music after 8 pm which was when we were seated.  I had the lobster which was excellent and actually less expensive than the veal parm. I felt I deserved it after a long day. Their mixed drinks are very good. For 6 of us, they included the gratuity of 22%.

6MO9eJIIFejZXUFrdLzsfg.text: Review is for the nightclub portion only.  I was here for Dash Berlin on a tuesday night, got guestlist from dash berlin world.  Went to the front, mentioned that I was on guestlist to about 3 or 4 people, and sent to a line that I thought was for guestlist.  Got to front of line, ID was checked, and sent inside where the lady said I needed a handstamp, or it will cost $20 each for cover.  Uhh, what? She mentioned I had to go back to the front, which I did, and of course they sent me back to the cashier, where I again mentioned I'm on the guestlist.  Apparently the fact that I had won a contest on DashBerlinWorld made things confusing for them.  Fortunately DB world had given me a printout that I was able to show them.  This is Vegas, things really shouldn't be confusing - you have a line for guestlist, a line for GA, and a line for Bottle service.  The guestlist line should have a bouncer with a clipboard and he should be checking off names while verifying ID.    Sound was good, club was definitely on the small side, drinks moderately priced at $13 for a well mixed.  Secondary bar near the bathrooms were helpful and didn't have too long of a line.    Solid 3.5 stars, rounded down due to the guestlist circlejerk.

TD8eAs7YunjYJ9e2mEgj0A.text: Came here as part of our five year wedding anniversary celebration in Vegas. We decided on Lavo since the Venetian gave us $100 resort credit. Thank god this meal was free because I would have been pretty upset if we had to pay for it. In short, the waiter was initially very friendly and congratulated us on our anniversary.  However, once we declined cocktails because we were still feeling the drinks from the night before, his entire demeanor changed. He went from friendly and semi-attentive to non-existent. What if I was a recovering alcoholic? A Mormon? Kind of rude to treat people differently because they aren't in the mood for a $20 cocktail. I was willing to overlook the service if the food was able to make up for it, but it didn't. The burrata was tasty, but the rigatoni melanzane was completely devoid of any and all eggplant. I actually think they forgot to put eggplant into the dish. Literally just pasta, cheese and sauce. Disappointing. Again, would have been very, very upset if I had to spend my own money on this meal. You would think the Italian restaurant in the Italian hotel would be able to knock it out of the park, but sadly it did not. ALSO, they had a cute little photo booth thing at the front where we snapped some photos and put in my e-mail address to get the photo electronically. Nope, never received them. I was pretty disappointed about that because the photos we took were actually pretty cute. Oh well. You win some, you lose some - that's Vegas!

62sujCdoe-dNnP6JrS3Acw.text: We went on a Sunday night and we ordered a few bottles for bottle service. The club was pretty small and stuffy. Our cocktail server was supposed to stay with our group and pour drinks for us the whole night, but instead left and came back and forth. We were paying a lot of money, and it would be nice to have the server at least stay at our table and keep pouring our drinks.  It wasn't that busy for her to be gone majority of the time.

gm3B7Bx50SBiYeDnLeNzXg.text: You're in Sin City and you feel dangerous, mischievious even.  You lurk around at Palazzo and follow the sound of thumping, booming....your feet can't help it but to follow the beat....you look into this mysterious dark restaurant and say ehhh why not?!    I was here for my sister's 21st birthday and was told for every entree you order you get a free stamp into Lavo the club.  We were told by concierge the food is great at Lavo so it's a win win.  We made reservations for 13, was seated promptly and orders were taken....unfortunately when the food arrived my mouth dropped and I was thinking....THE F did I just pay to eat COLD pasta?!  I ordered the Seafood Alfredo and Oh em gee it was cold, crusted with sauce.  The prawns on the plate looked amazing but the dish was anything but.  We also ordered the bone in rib eye. It was cooked medium rare which was fine but it wasn't anything to write home about...well actually it wasn't anything to write on YELP about.    Bottom line if you're looking for a free club this is your place.  They let ladies in for free on the guestlist and ladies drink free from 11:30 to 1am.  The dance floor is TINY.  I mean TINY!  I think it only fits about 30 Snooki's at most!    As you are bumping and grinding along strangers drinks are being sloshed all around you and sound system is horrible!  I say come here to pre party but dance and boogey somewhere else.   Ummm wouldn't come here for the food.  The consensus from our party was we paid a shit load for the food to get into a crappy club.  Just our two cents.

bEOH-pXVR-hq8GQsb3RDVQ.text: This is a review for the nightclub, not the restaurant:  I surprisingly had a really good time at LAVO this weekend. It's pretty small, but the thing I liked most about LAVO was the music! Lots of hip hop... so if you want a change from house music (which I noticed is played in most clubs), you should swing by!   Decor is really nice, though a waste of water, with those fountains by the walkway that overlooks the restaurant, haha. Of course, my OCD self had to turn off all the faucets when I walked by them..

A_7-nZ7JNvQs32klRePA5A.text: Interesting place... restaurant by day and bar/nightclub at night... with private tables in the rooms above the flub/dance area. A tad expensive bug it'd Vegas so what do you expect?  Breakfast menu is amazing... fresh blueberry pancakes, sausage made by the gods and a. Mac and cheese dish that'll change your reason for living! Eggs Benedict is one to write home about as well...   Only real complaint I'd that when I went for breakfast I was hung over... and therefore thirsty. They charged me for every coke I had..  so it was almost $40 for my drinks alone... had they been actual cocktails that would be one think but for softdrinks... that just irked me!
