Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass July 2017
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Bolognese July 2017

KbosMCJoeMEcJwSOTAhk2w.text: We had the worst experience at Lavo. Our first waiter was very rude and not polite. The second waitress  was also not nice at all. We ordered 3 plates of pasta that arrived COLD. And when we asked to have them heated up they looked bothered about it like if we were annoying them. Then we ordered a fruit salad for desert - 40 minutes later it was still not here and the waitress didn't even apologize for it when we asked why it wasn't here it. She answered in a really disrespectful way and turned her back on us.  We were so disappointed about our experience and would not go back. We expected so much more as we are used to go to Lavo in New York City which has the best service.   This Lavo in Las Vegas - WORST SERVICE

Xpav6IaMDHyL6xPcw1-aeQ.text: Lavo Lounge is a great spot to have some tasty Italian food or hang out for drinks in LV. The outside space and patio overlooks the strip and has some nice ambiance which is perfect for nights and getting outside in this city that doesn't really encourage getting out. The beer selection was fairly good with some craft options and the food was quite tasty.

uKAzy54Gb2OUZ8QHzgKMXw.text: I came here for my Bachelorette weekend dinner with 14 girls and the service and food were both AMAZING. We were given multiple choices for price fix menu and a la cart, the waitress was very helpful. Everyone loved the food and the service was fantastic for such a large group. I highly recommend, moderate prices for Vegas and great Italian meal! The spaghetti and meatballs was a clear favorite.

wno_hJPDDAl0-yuLpOWS7g.text: We were staying in the Palazzo and figured we just start here with some drinks and apps.  We were seated in the lounge area.  Nice selection of seats and couches.  Our server was a tall Asian woman and very nice.  Of course my friend Dave couldn't stop staring.  She could be a super model!  Ordered a Jameson ginger and it was good pour.  Steve and Tom ordered food for the table, and while the other night we were on the hunt for the infamous $1.99 shrimp cocktail on Fremont Street, there was a shrimp cocktail on the menu, so Dave and I ordered it.  Imagine our surprise....  Dave: Excuse me, we ordered two Other server: Yes, that's two...it's by the piece  Holey Shmoley!  Shrimp cocktail....singular....$8 for a single shrimp...and not a prawn or a tiger shrimp....LOL!  The Wedge salad was ok as was the Caesar...but for those prices, I expected something spectacular!  Or maybe gold plated China to eat off of...LOL!  The best thing was the Baked Clams Oreganato...very good flavor!  I also thought the bread was premade and was just in a warmer to be grabbed and set on a plate.    The ambiance is very nice!  The story behind the faucets above was interesting, and the deejay played some great tunes from the past and present.  However, there wasn't that "WOW" factor with the food which is a shame, considering how beautiful the hotel is.  If it wasn't for our server, I probably would've given two stars.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oL8Nre4j5KJaEVPUiWFsyw.text: Brunch - just because we wanted to visit the Strip. We decided to eat at Lavo - because it has GREAT food and the Venetian/Palazzo is really scenic indoors, especially if you have time to walk through the Grand Canal Shoppes.  Food was decadently delicious - awesome breakfast pizza - cocktail was Hail Caesar. Staff was delightful and attentive - I'd go back for brunch in a heartbeat!  And did I mention parking at the Palazzo is free?

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fDXCyvBbNRW_UfsPIxVPgA.text: This review is for dessert only. I've had dinner here before, but it has been years. So, I'll stick to reviewing only the desserts I had.  I showed up at Lavo with the intention of getting 2 desserts to go. The front staff kindly pointed me to the bar to order and wait.   I ordered the 7 layer rolled chocolate cake and the peanut butter cake. The bartenders were super friendly and did their best to make my wait as enjoyable as possible. I did expect them to be faster, since I only ordered dessert, but once they brought out the dessert, I understood what took so long. The peanut butter cake is so large that thy had to get creative and wrap it in a pizza box.  The decor at Lavo is beautiful. I would definitely recommend Lavo for a drink or a date. Before the club gets started, this is a quiet and relaxing place to be.  As for the cake, it's amazing. Both were really great. You need to really, really enjoy peanut butter to love that cake. It's super filling and rich. It's a dessert to share. I preferred it to the rolled cake, but I love peanut butter. The rolled cake is like a ho-ho only bigger and denser. Overall, I would get both again. The prices are also super reasonable for the size. I highly recommend dessert here.  P.S. I've had the Oreo zeppoles in the past. These are awesome, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Layer Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rolled Chocolate 7 Layer Cake
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut Layer Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake

gsl1e1aoktBmh8spBnATBg.text: Good solid Las Vegas Strip Casino restaurant.  The prices are not insignificant but not stupid.   The service was very good albeit a little slow.  The drinks were excellent and we ordered several apps.    Out apps were the signature meatball which lived up to the hype.  We also ordered fried calamari which was hot and properly cooked.  We also ordered the seafood tower which was quite delicious.    I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with a side of broccoli.   I have to tell you, it was truly one of the best prepared, beautifully presented pieces of fish I have enjoyed in a long time.  The rest of our party represented a wide variety of dishes ranging from chicken parm to a rib eye steak.  Nobody was disappointed with their selection.  This is a solid Italian joint on the strip.

68fx64aneoeXUCH5LSfSow.text: Public Service Announcement:  Do not let the waitress tell you that this is family style.  It's not.  Just order your own dish and don't expect to share anything.  The food is decent but really, this is just another New York restaurant trying to capture business in Vegas.  It's not even the best Italian restaurant in the Venetian/Palazzo

k5YMIFs7kIRtG7arX2T5cA.text: Attended a dinner for a bachelorette party of 16. Probably the worst meal I have ever had in Vegas . The pasta was undercooked. The sauces... so bland and flavorless . The worst dish was the eggplant parmigiana. It was so rancid I nearly barfed in my mouth. Please, do not eat here. The food is not edible . And don't get me started on how the bathroom has an attendant. You can't dry your hands with a towel unless she hands you a paper towel . You feel obligated to tip her . It feels like Tijuana! This is an upscale restaurant in Vegas !!!! WTF !

fNJebc8f_regx57zwnIHVA.text: Tyler is AMAZING!!! And equally amazing is the FOOD!!! Especially the meatball!! I can't speak highly enough about this place!!

nzKFl-wwAVZu-DsZePHvNA.text: Ive always wanted to go to LAVO since i moved to Vegas. Something about an elegant Italian restaurant with lots of hubris that just gets me going and builds me up to  expect  a lot. By a lot i just mean good food, filling, great service and a fair price.   Well, this place checked off all the marks. The service wasnt rushed, they gave us comp antipasta dish which was nice, but one of the three items was hummus and there was nothing to eat the hummus or salumi with. LoL. You just have to roll with the punches at some of these thought processes.   We ordered the salmon which was phenemonal. It came with a bread crust and just tasted divine. Other person got the spaghetti and meatballs. I know ground breaking night but lets be honest Italian food doesnt really break the mold. Its either done well or not and thats all you can judge this cuisine on.   We ended up getting strawberry shortcake for dessert and it wasnt my fave. I suppose shortcake is suppose to be dry, but my goodness its okay to use a little butter and sugar on dessert. I rarely go for Italian desserts anyway but at least we tried.  I overlooked the beginning and end mostly because service and entrees were stellar. Id for sure go back.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shortcake.  Looks wonderful a bit dry though.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was fantastic.
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs. Spaghetti should always be served with a spoon.

GLGJNDZ0CON19ua8VbYlVQ.text: Great service management helped me every step of the way with my VIP client. The food was delicious, staff was there for everything including a phone charger lol. Seriously definitely coming back for more on the next trip to Vegas!!!!!

nOJXl1G9pxD2Zz8QUpOOvQ.text: If I could give zero stars it would be too many. Long wait in a long line where they let in anyone up to the ages of 65 it seems like. If you like a crowded place filled with troll lookalikes you're in luck. If you like rude staff who confiscates your stuff you're in for a real treat here. Never been to a worse club full of quintessential midwesterners-visiting-Vegas hooligans. A complete joke.

XQ6DuwOAirbrDeDVosxGvQ.text: Nice restaurant at the top of the Marina Bay. The staff were nice and the food is good but it is on the expensive side. There also is a dress code, (long pants, closed toe shoes,) which is fine however the service was quite slow. If it's going to be a nice higher end restaurant, the service needs to be better.

SRfieMhnaoXa8HImJm0sXA.text: Lavo Italian Restaurant & Lounge is an Italian restaurant located inside of Palazzo. The restaurant had dimmed setting and background music.   For drinks, I ordered a Raspberry Cucumber Spritz, which consisted of fresh raspberries, cucumber, club soda, mint oil, and agave nectar served over ice. It was bubbly and tart. Another guest in my party ordered the Cranberry Spiced Mojito, which consisted of fresh orange juice, agave nectar, mint oil, cold pressed lime juice, cranberry juice, and sliced cane sugar served over ice. It was fruity and refreshing.   Shortly after, our server brought us an Antipasto Plate with three compartments - salami & olives, hummus, and pickled vegetables (cauliflower, tomato, celery, and radish).   For appetizers, we shared The Meatball, which consisted of a pound of fresh ground imperial Waygu, Italian sausage, and veal rolled into a ball and baked in a marinara sauce topped with fresh whipped ricotta and herbs. It was probably the most delicious meatball I've had in awhile. I liked how they sliced it for us.  For dinner, my mom ordered the Roasted Beets Salad, which was tossed with mixed greens and toasted almonds in sun dried tomato vinaigrette. My dad ordered the Branzino, which consisted of whole fish served with a panzanella salad tossed in extra virgin olive oil and capers. My aunt and uncle shared the Chicken Parmigiano, which consisted of thinly pounded chicken topped with mozzarella and fresh herbs and served in marinara sauce. I ordered the Grilled Yellow Fin Tuna, which was cooked to medium rare and served over slightly spiced roasted tomatoes, asparagus, and artichokes in a lemon vinaigrette. Everything was delicious in their own way. I requested my dish to be pepper free due to an allergy but I found a whole chili pepper (with the ends cut off) in my vegetables. We ordered a side of  Creamed Spinach to go with our meal.  For checking into LAVO on Yelp, they gave us an order of Oreo Zeppole, which consisted of six deep fried Oreos served with vanilla ice cream and oreo crumbles. Since we were on a tight timeline, they allowed us to return after the show to redeem the treats.

uP3FiL_ZOANDifyYFYDSzQ.text: Had a late night dinner here during our man trip. Beautiful room was packed but fairly quiet. Started with complimentary bread and butter. Oysters were terrific as was the grilled octopus appetizer. Pasta, fish and seafood Alfredo were all hits at our table. Service was competent and friendly. Decent wine selections. Reasonably priced. Overall, the meal was very good but did especially distinguish itself from all the formidable competitors at the Venetian/Palazzo.

sswEM9Kk7tGavl1r_SPD0A.text: Came here for our wedding anniversary. Its a nice lounge/dinner spot. However, we didn't like our appetizers. Our main courses were ok. My husband didn't like his tuna dish (cant remember the name). The salmon dish i ordered was really good however there portions are small. Cocktails were good though. We ordered bread pudding for dessert, not the best but it was alright. Overall, we wouldn't come back. For the price, there dishes were not the best.

aLkRdYvbOCURAXoDD6NkNA.text: I would not recommend going to Lavo Nightclub. They have the worse staff ever. If you think about going to this club think again and walk over to TAO which is next door.

91bqyebwXv9VOqQCfXPISQ.text: STAY AWAY: This was quite simply the WORST meal I've ever had in Las Vegas, end of story. I ordered the pasta with seafood in what was supposed to be a spicy tomato sauce.  The seafood was OK but the pasta was virtually raw (I sent it back and the second coming was only marginally better) and the "sauce" might as well have come from a can of crushed tomatoes.  When I complained to the server I was told the kitchen prepares it "al dente" and did I understand what that meant?  Please - I'm a freakin' chef!  This linguini literally sat on my fork PARALLEL to the plate!  To add insult to injury, the whole mess took more than two hours with some of the most indifferent service I've ever had, and for a princely sum.  Maybe the Vegas glitterati see something I don't (starting with the head-pounding noise and the nausea-inducing lack of lighting) but with all the other options in Las Vegas, this one deserves to close IMMEDIATELY.

NZXkUkmrTy7KCjK-nKMc9A.text: id have to make this place one of my favorite clubs to go to... why? cause  GOOD MUSIC WINS, ALL THE TIME.    and by good music (in MY opinion) i mean hip hop... not faux hip hop- like when youre else where and u get all excited- and they turn it into some house mix.  its not as big or lavish as the other vegas night clubs. its actually kinda small.  but the dance floor is easy to get to.. the bar is easy to get to.. the restrooms are easy to get to.    oh and when my girl-friends and i went it was free well drinks on a friday night from 9-10..or 10-11 one of those. WIN! thank you lavo for reimbursing me all the money i lost at palazzo on the slots.   5 stars from me.

14hfGEf6Uhrk22HpoSXC2Q.text: Two things that made the night:  1. There's a dancer there who dances at Lavo and Tao named Meek. She is an amazing dancer, and whenever she danced, people would totally just stop and stare. When I was washing my hands in the bathroom, she was right next to me freshening up, and I just had to say hi. Totally expecting her to be snobby, she wasn't! And when I complimented her on her dancing, she was so humble about it!   2. The day before, we'd run into a promotor named Jesse at Tao who promised us VIP table service, and he definitely did not disappoint. My girls and I were SPOILED, and Jesse took care of us pretty much the whole night. We felt like celebrities.  My favorite part: Meeting the Canadian restaurant owner who wasn't too handsy, good dancer, sweet, AND when googled the next morning, was actually a Canadian restaurant owner. (He also told me he was a professional snowboarder. Yup, he wasn't that.)

RHdsdNPp2Du2wUNShbwNhA.text: So disappointing! We sat outside with a great view of the show in front of Treasure Island. The service was extremely slow. I ordered a filet which came out so over cooked that it resembled a hockey puck. My husband ordered a flat bread pizza which was greasy and had an overabundance amount of garlic. When we expressed our concern about the steak, the waitress got out her flashlight to examine it and discovered how overdone it was. She said she was going to tell the manager, however, no one came by our table. This was our worst experience by far for dining in Vegas!

f1BuvmyYTCPh6UcnQj_M8A.text: Lavo is really small but I love the little sink/bathtubs that line the hallway as soon as you get up to the 2nd floor (the club area). I only come here because we met this chick at Caesar's that promotes it and Tao. The last 2 times that I went, they have open bar so of course I was ecstatic! I mean, I had a great time for free although the type of alcohol you can get is limited. The music is OK....with the occasional old school ones where people leave and disperse from the dancefloor. Their go-go dancers are pretty hot and they have girls that bathe each other by the bar or something like that. Oh! And sometimes you'll see a midget slave walking around chained up to his fat lady master...hahaha! I swear!

JqhusMAsBUIhNYoSYCVyPw.text: I really had high hopes for Lavo. Looking at their menu online beforehand, I liked pretty much everything I saw.  I started out with the Kobe Riceballs. They were severely lacking in flavor. Next was the Chicken Parm. I was expecting something along the lines of the best Chicken Parm I've ever had for $26, but it was no better than the $10 special at my local pizza shop. Way too much cheese and way too little sauce. At least the gelato for dessert was good.  The highlight of the meal was probably the excellent bread with marinara sauce that was served shortly after I sat down at the table.  Wait staff was excellent and attentive. Clientele was all over the age spectrum. My older neighbors at the adjacent tables were friendly and talkative.  I was offered a hand-stamp for some kind of VIP entry to the club that night, but declined as I am not really into the whole  "wait in a line for an hour to pay $20 for the privledge of entering a sardine can to buy $15 drinks" thing.

cuBb2ij-uaWH0_88RrYe7g.text: A dark lil hideaway for whatever you don't want people seeing you doing in Vegas.

yQGflhyY2SY2vIlu2Fc2iQ.text: Definitely ask to sit on the patio.  Service was good, food as expected with large portions.  A bit pricey but it's the strip.  Overall just fine and worth the visit.

nIYWU1NFQEPUaYC2kmkL-w.text: I went there once, and I had a good time.  No cover cuz I got on the list since I was staying at Palazzo.  It's like a smaller version of tao.  good time though.

nwMEq5b0o4031zukvF5inQ.text: hmmmm i went there on July 4th. So what happened? FULL OF PEOPLE!! People were lining up for hours outside. I wasnt part of them thank god for that. My bf and I were given 2 VIP passes by a group of girls who work for LAVO when we were shopping around. They spotted us from far and waved their hands. I looked at my bf and said "oh, do I know them? But they are cute! " . So the girls came up to us and one of them said "u both look so cute together, and I loveeee your dress". I don't normally like being stopped in the middle of my shopping immediately cut her off and said do u want to sell something? She said oh no, we want to invite you guys to LAVO and TAO tonight, we want to give you these VIPS passes so you guys can go in just fine, no need to line up. I said what's the catch? She said nothing, just show up, we love beautiful people in there. We were like ok, if we can make it because we have a show to watch. But we indeed made it. =)   LAVO was crowded, the line was looonnggggggggg but we did not have to line up for hours like the rest of them, club goers. They were there since 8.30 pm!! Noone questioned us, nothing. The bouncer treated us like VIP =) He walked us in. LMAO. I mean, I never had to line up anywhere because I don't like it. I wont go to a club unless it's a VIP pass or a bottle service. I don't care how fancy the club is, I am not the type that go ga-ga over some stupid clubs. I love dancing and loud music, no doubt, but to wait in line? NO WAY! OK, back to LAVO. All the tables were booked. I, like the rest of the crowds had to line up to get some drinks. It took us about 15 -20 mins to get some. And they were expensive!! We spent about 50 on 2 small drinks, and another 25 on some stupid shots and I did not even taste the alcohol in it. Then we went to the dancing floor, and it was packed! Cant even move around much but heck, we enjoyed the night. We stayed till 1.30 am because we were tired. When we walked out, there was still a long line to get in. Wow.  It's a small club really, don't think they can fit more than 300 people? I don't know but downstairs is a bar/lounge area. So who ever needs some fresh air, away from the crowds and dance a bit, they can go there!

AwOGaS0mA0T8_Zpl2fQKcg.text: didnt eat here  lounge pretty chill

lHEs3FHKfE5xLIeks6S5IQ.text: "A Better Experience in Vegas"  I love how the line is worked out.  They stick everyone into one line unless there is bottle service.  No pushing need to get to the front of the line to get in.  Didn't need to tip or anything either.    My night - Drank about 10 shots in line in 5 minutes waiting for me to get in.  I was surprised on how well I did and didn't start throwing up everywhere.  But I met some nice people in line and decided to give them some since I couldn't finish a 1.75 liter bottle to myself.  I took about a quarter of the bottle.  Then took some and mixed it with the rest of the pomegranate juice I had left.  Just kept sipping on it with the ladies in front of me.  Random girls and random nights.  This save me over 200 bucks.  I'm really surprised that the bouncers didn't really care while waiting in line.  That was a really really big plus.  They saw me, and they still let me in.  Now lets get to the people - Wow... I might have paid to get in, but I barely spent any money on drinks.  I just made my rounds dancing with random people... Not sure how this started to happen, but random girls just started pouring me shots.  Which was nice.  I guess they liked my costume, since it was for Halloween.  But yes, this one girl in particular, just kept poor me drinks.  The guys in there group weren't dancing so I pulled one guy to the side and was like, it's Vegas... Just dance, they won't mind it.  I think they would prefer someone they know than a random guy like me to dance with them.  The guy started to dance, the girl danced back.  Yes, success!  Then I just simply started dancing with the other girls.  I'm not sure, but the thing that probably broke the ice was my costume.  They had a batman and robin outfit, and I had the (Joker - Nurse scene outfit on).  They the guys wanted to take pictures with me, then it happened.  Then the girls and me just started dancing.  I left to go look for my friends...  I didn't find them and this random girl comes up to me and was like what would you like to drink.  It's on me, I offered to pay, but her response was, this will probably be the only drink that a girl will buy you tonight... Which was probably True...  So I took the offer, and she gave me her number... I love Canadians!  They are so friendly...  Then I went to go dance some more... I love dancing!  This is where the stupid asses come in.  I was randomly dancing, then I started to dance with this Japanese chick...  A random ass dude comes up and pushes me.  I let it slide.  Then I went to go dance with the girl again, he comes out of no where and pushes me again!  I went to go talk to the girl about it...  She told me that was one of her friends and tried to convince me to not to beat his ass... The her other friends saw and they came and talked to me, and said that he was one of those rich white boys that daddy will take care of him if anything happens.  I waited for him outside to get an explanation for the shove.  The girl didn't want anything to happen.  So she told her friend to leave and watch out for me.  Which did happen, because I didn't see him anytime after that... But I just wanted an explanation.  After that incident, it just killed my night... From being filled with alcohol to being filled with adrenalin!  It basically took my mood away to dance...  I didn't mind confronting him about the pushes(these were not lite shoves, these were shoves causing me to take a few steps back so I wouldn't fall)...  That's what got me so angry.  I wanted to confront him, but security said it wasn't a good idea since his friends calling him stupid and drunk, he would probably do something stupid...  So I decided to leave.  STUPID STUPID PEOPLE!  I swear!  People go out to have fun and stupid people like that kill the mood for everyone!  But other than those 20 minutes... Everything was fantastic!

e0eio-TFAkNmlFQNJDOxRQ.text: The outside looked nice but what place isn't in Vegas.  The club was small.  Service was bad.  Doorman was not nice.   The music was ok, but couldn't overcome the overall bad vibe.  Drinks were typical.  Did not compare to XS.

uBVoRF8__1I1aUZWveYyJg.text: The restaurant busy and noisy, the food very good. Kobe meatball (awesome) as appetizer, sea bass, baked shrimp with fennel. Our waiter Casey, a friendly, energetic and engaging sort made our dining experience memorable.  The nightclub: Overcrowded without a doubt. Sunday night and the joint was packed tighter than can be. Bouncers told us there was a coat check...get upstairs..no coat check...damn...had to go back out to baggage claim to hold a coat.

WkmnkuCj560rSHULsk3Rsg.text: The food has been fantastic since they switched the menu to Italian.  Very knowledgable staff and food was expedited quickly.  They gave us a stamp to enter the nightclub for free.  We walked right up to the bar and had a cocktail before dancing the night away.  Very intimate and sensual decor.  Loved every minute!

7oVyOq69TQeRPR5E8QyiNg.text: Eh! I really hate to hate but I gotta balance out my profile...I feel the bad karma already coming to get me.. but oh well..... Was in Vegas for my sister's grad party and the place was bumping. AMAZING ambiance and the music was my steez. But I am after all from the SCO and I know good eats and ESPECIALLY Italian. The food was boring for $32 ....Kobe beef Spaghetti and meatballs with Dry Dececco Pasta no thanks. The service was good but the food just didn't deliver for all the hype. Hollywood may jock this place but i'll Never bring Angelo and the guys here for dinner. HOWEVER i'll bring the boys back for drinks.

36gXo39oTlLTEAUJoUiHmA.text: This review is for the nightclub:  Bottle service sucks because there is no separation between you and the bar/dance floor.  At 2PM they close half the place and kick my party our of our two tables to one.  That sucked.  Service was only eh..     Really really crowded on a Friday night, I did not feel safe.  Nothing special (except the decor) about this club, go across the street to the TI and go to a club with some breathing space.

Q9CWIKE_iGFAefeyR-80sQ.text: im torn on whether to give this place 3 or 4 stars..  it wasn't what i expected... i thought it would be bigger but the dance area was relatively small and i felt a bit claustrophobic...  BUT... then I went downstairs... and apparently after the restaurant closes, you are allowed to sit at the tables and just order drinks and hookah.  yes.. the hookah is expensive and i have no intentions of ever hookah-ing there... but it was nice to have a place to sit down and rest and relax... plus, they made some super stiff drinks ... which were actually quite reasonably-priced!!!  we also ventured outside to get some fresh air and the patio area provided a new view of the strip.. which is always a plus in my book.  overall, i wasn't that impressed with the dance area but I really did like their decor and the downstairs/patio area... so i guess i will bump LAVO up to 4 stars...

xLx9cGMeuo5F9xUado16AQ.text: Quick dinner at the bar, it was great. Vodka Penne was perfectly al dente, great flavor and presented nicely. Garlic bread was good too, I'll be back to experience a full service sit down dinner.

FQS4biGb4nINspRuS3Pw6w.text: Excellent service and cool room.  Cocktail and wine list is creative and they execute well.  Very interesting offerings.  The Sea Bass rocked, the garlic bread that comes with dinner was great.  Dessert and espresso were fantastic.  Worth going for dinner!

YYa10FrwkveowviDmbw9BQ.text: Very pricey, but I have to say this was an awesome place.  Atmosphere was exceptional.  Service was great.  Menu was interesting and had many options.  We had a great time!

2Yi3KQA-u6Hc6Yf61UTPkA.text: 3.5 sorta mini tao.  easy enough line (free passes avail), small space (thus elbow to elbow), chill downstairs, crowded dancing space upstairs, hip hop, foam.

2SHpiWoy3JoiyUDlKpvPQA.text: This was the first place we started the evening after having some wine and appetizers @ Palm by Ceasar's Forum Shops.  We had gone to our room to freshen up and then came back downstairs to hit up LAVO. We got a line pass and free drinks for me and my friends because we were guests at the hotel.  We got here shortly after 1am and there was still a little line outside the place on a Friday night. The music was just OK but the place was extremely packed! We managed to make our way to one of the bars to get our drinks and then head to the dance floor.  OMG, it was like a can of sardines.  There were a lot of drunk girls on the floor and one or two jumped up on the gogo stage to rock it like they got it like that.  LOL...  So we thought we'd check out the other dance floor. It was crowded too (boooo....) and tough to get through that crowd.  There were some big people and I am small and petite so I wasn't feeling it.  We took a few pix and danced for a little bit and then we left to go checkout the outdoors patio.  The patio was nice and lots of places to sit out there.  It was cool outside, not too hot or cold so we took a nice breather and met a couple guys from Boston.  It was nice because it wasn't converted to a bottle service area so you could sit at the tables and comfortably chat with others hanging out there.  It was almost 4am so we decided to go hit another club. I thought this club rated a 3 overall but I give it 4 stars for the patio, the energy in the crowd and the free drinks/pass.

D6VJgzSw-lNODJBnw9y0Xw.text: Lavo restaurant was nice.. waitress was nice... but the bouncer was mean just trying to get into the club... he couldn't tell that it was my driver license!!! and so I got the run around for trying to get in and that pissed me off... they were telling me this guy was trained in telling if its a fake or I'm borrowing someones I.D... well guess what buddy... the black guy who was dark skinned and had a little bit of a jerrycurl... YOU ARE WRONG... YOU NEED TO GO BACK AND GET TRAINED AGAIN... they need to be nicer... you are lucky I didn't cause a scene...

yGkZPQwzL4KSc7PP_rUvDw.text: four words: Polenta Fries and Tiramisu!

ZLsrLuRfxJR5nwKRIBopyA.text: we went to lavo for dinner this past thursday night! we went around 8 and it was hopping, so id definitely recommend reservations- and im glad we had them!   arrived and were promptly seated and our cups were filled with water..tables were not overly crowded, which was appreciated. the decor in lavo is really neat...it's very posh and aesthetically pleasing. especially loved the wall near the bathrooms with the candles along the wall also, for how crowded it was, it wasn't that loud and my friend and i could hear one another well, which was also nice.   we each ordered a glass of wine (i got a rose/syrah blend...it was okay) and we got a ginormous steak to split (it was the special...this kobe beef steak that was like 20 oz. ...but was $85...yikes), polenta fries (YUM) and 2 sauces for our steak (the horseradish cream and hte gorgonzola butter...the horseradish cream was AMAZING)  overall, our food was great and the decor was really fun, but my friend and i were really annoyed w/our server. he was overbearing, stopping by our table every 5 minutes and he tried to upsell us. by his 5th stop over, we were starting to worry he was eavesdropping on our conversation! he was also incredibly misleading about our steak and how much it cost. he basically told us it was the same price as the 20oz steak on the menu...so we were a little bit ticked off when our bill arrived and it was double the price. our server sort of tainted our experience...but other than that, the food, drink and atmosphere of lavo is really very nice!

cqmacsWBsnVMAEQZCp46xg.text: Nice las vegas club.. If your a chick you get to get in for free and free drinks before 12:30pm.. And guys like us get to pay $30 to get in and struggle at the bar trying to purchase a drink past all the chicks trying to get their free drinks... Lol over all the club is small and tight when filled to capacity.

jjhPfMtoLkhHA8v3No6LGg.text: Dined here on a Thursday evening as a walk-in, before the club filled in. Sat outdoors which was pleasant and scenic. Oyster sampler for appetizer - super fresh and sweet. Spaghetti with Kobe beef meatballs for entree... the best meatballs I've ever had. The table shared a warm banana and chocolate pudding and a strawberry ricotta cheesecake... both of which were incredible. Service was extremely slow, especially the long waits for dishes to be cleared and for the payment to be processed. But it's Vegas and I was relaxed so not a huge deal. Would absolutely dine there again, and without question I would order any dish that featured Lavo's meatballs.

tMImABH3r9TshbaYUNxtXQ.text: came in on a thursday night looking for a low-key start to the weekend.  we walk up to the front (no line to be seen) and were told we weren't getting in without a table because there were too many of us (16 people and pretty much an even female/male split - wtf!)  we were only required to get one bottle so we said what the hell.  you've got the vegas table surcharge so we were on deck to pay around $500 for a bottle of Grey Goose that you get at BevMo for $40.  we walk in and it's DEAD!    on the plus side the bottle we got was the magnum size Goose bottle.  we finished the bottle around 12:30 and the waitress asked us if we wanted another one.  none of us were looking to blow our wad on the first night, so we passed.  the waitress comes back ten minutes later and says they'll give us two-for-one.  Us being chinamen, we couldn't pass up a deal, even if we didn't want to drink anymore (and i think they knew that).  Sale on vodka in vegas?   who can pass on that?  that shit never happens!  we ended up drinking about 3/4 of one bottle.  but again, we're chinamen so we couldn't let the rest go to waste, especially if we paid for it.  we bought a few bottled waters, downed them and emptied the leftover Geese into the water bottles under the table to save for a rainy day.      NOTE: the two-for-one isn't probably going to be offered on a good, busy night.  it was dead when we went so they were probably trying to make as much money as they could off of us...bastards.

TnhXanoGapnyGoqHDBi0wQ.text: I went to meet some girls I knew at Lavo on a Friday night we had a table that was a crazy amount of money to start but hey u do what you need to do!!!!  While we were having a decent time and there was this one bouncer who was the smallest one of all with a bald head who had a hard on for one of my friends, decided my buddy had his shirt unbuttoned one button to many and by the way he had a shirt under a shirt. Well while we were having fun the runt came over with 4 of his cronies and tossed my friend out the back door with know warning at all.  Thank god for texting other wise I wouldn't have any clue where my buddy was. I just feel after spending $800 dollars at the time we should have had a chance to make it right but that J--- off fucking ruined the night for us . Never in my life would I think a good customer would be treated that way unless he was trouble. I wonder if a girls dress was to short or her top was to low would she go thru the same ( I don't  think so ) so to the man in charge you should take a good look at your staff and polish them up and get rid of that runt of the litter.

K8uUImTL2Nd5zOe3ymCOcw.text: I had a pretty good experience here, I was celebrating my b-day here with some friends of mine. My good friend was able to comp us for practically everything that night, all we had to do was tip. We had a huge dinner; not even 7 girls could finish the amount of food that they brought us.  There were several starters and several main dishes. The salads were great, really fresh ingredients. Some of the entrees were a little questionable. The chicken cordon bleu was salty, but the flat bread pizza was really tasty.  We had drinks during dinner and upstairs in the club. The service for dinner was okay, it was pretty packed on a Sunday night. The dj that was playing in dining area was playing some good music, the dj upstairs played okay music, mostly radio stuff.   Another plus was that we didn't have to wait line, we were escorted in. As soon as we got upstairs we were given more drinks... wOOh! The place was going crazy, people dancing all over the place on top of anything and everything. And for some reason two guys dressed up as Mario and Luigi started dancing, with the Mario game music as background... really random, but funny. However the biggest con is that the place is small and that Sunday was just crazy; I could barely move it was so packed. It seemed like everybody was out that night. Other than that, its a pretty good place to start your night off!

a76qqqAC2Y-m4ZwmqeioAw.text: First let me start off by saying this review is SOLEY just for the restaurant, NOT the club. I absolutely LOVE Lavo Nightclub and it's staff.   That being said, let me start my review with my first encounter with the restaurant, it's hostess BRITNEY. It's disappointing to me that such a 5 star restaurant would employ such a 1 star hostess. She has EXTREMELY poor phone etiquette, unknowledgeable about the menu and restaurant, and at one point during our conversation was giving me attitude! Ive worked in the restaurant & food business for 7 years, and know the importance of the Host, being the first person the customer encounters, and I beg of TROY MORGAN to PLEASE consider getting rid of, or re-training your front host staff, so she could be more than just a pretty face!  Moving on, as many of the other reviews stated, the restaurant and club are literally on top of each other, so there no separating the music or loud crowd..so if youre looking for a nice quiet dinner, try some where else. Food was "meh" ...Ive had better italian @ Sinatras in the Wynn. However some of the other guest in my party really enjoyed it. However, once again, I had already had a bad taste in my mouth from my first encounter with the hostess, so maybe that had something to do with it.

HWjCy_YlY1_ZazseWFF5Lw.text: We spent some time on the terrace at the hookah bar.  It's was good fun as we had a view of the strip and it was quite relaxed.  I'd recommend it for a low key stop early in the evening although it gets a bit crazier as the night goes on.

o2DADuRMn-t_4hracQkaLg.text: This review is for the nightclub and the lounge. We did not get around to eating here. The lounge is nice and laid back with outdoor seating that overlooks the strip. The nightclub was wayyyyyy too crowded. A nice club but they need to either expand or have less people in there.

Cq5_4BAPLpPZpFtq4aZzuA.text: Excellent food.  Great Service.  Don't miss the meatballs.  Nice Bar, but not really a "nightclub", pretty small.

n1HUfKYCGassk6GEGvuNYQ.text: good food! I had the Louis salad (with lobster) and the sea bass. Both tasted very fresh. Cocktails are good too. Then it's noisy and quite dark, but it's part of the fun I guess.

Atw5zVW44wDZGDM9QQuIYg.text: We had dinner here for a bachelorette party.  I have mixed feeling about the restaurant part.  Since we had such a big group, we had to do a set dinner menu.  The price per person for the menu was about $100.  For the food we got, it was not worth the price.  BUT in Lavo's defense, we picked the food.  So I guess I'd like to go back and try something off of their regular menu.  For what we did have:  Mussles in marinara sauce, the sauce was good, but over  1/2 of the mussels were not cooked all the way and did not open.  Garlic break and marinara sauce - the flavor was there but the presentation was an F.  They brought out a plate with a bowl of marinara sauce and a loaf of garlic bread wrapped in tin foil.  They put it on the table and I was confused.  Also, there was no serving pieces for the sauce or bread.  In a restaurant like this you'd think the presentation would be looked after a bit more.  The flat bread was yummy, served on a baking stone so that was fine.  The dinner (again this was partially not fabulous but only bc of what was choosen by our group): 2 pastas, French fries, mashed potatoes, broccoli.  What a strange combo, but all I can do is rate each item on its own.  The pastas were cooked al dente and the sauce had a great flavor.  I like al dente so it didn't bother me, but some girls didn't like it.  The starches were good - but how can you mess up fries or mashed potatoes.  The broccoli was steamed - that's about all I can say about that, it's broccoli so how can you really say any more? The service was outstanding - our waiter was super friendly and funny (and cute!) and he kept the wine flowing.  I'd definitely give Lavo another try, just because I don't think I got the full experience with our personal tasting menu.  On a plus, they put a personalized menu out for us with our bachelorette's name and the date - a nice keepsake.  I enjoyed the ambiance - it was super upbeat, chic and trendy.  The music was hip hop and everyone was just dancing in their seats having a good time at dinner.  For now I will give Lavo a 3, but I have a feeling it is just because I was there for a event that required a set menu and I was thrown off by the garlic bread wrapped in tin foil, LOL.  If I return,  hopefully I can give it a 4 or 5.    The club - great music, EXTREMELY crowded, but drink and shot prices weren't terrible.  The dance pit was insanely crowded. I think if you had VIP or table service you would have the roped off area that surrounds the dance floor.  I don't know if that is a good thing though bc the dance floor was so crowded I would feel trapped at your table.  I heard from a waitress that we met at Tryst that the night club is notorious for having extremely long lines.  The club was a bit on the smaller side (compared to places like Tryst, Jet, Pure, Moon).  For the club, I'd give it a 2 just for the reason that there are so many other fab clubs in Vegas.

SzjNNlG7GW1Mg9E8GWhKgQ.text: This place offers a 5 star customer service. My friends and I experienced a pampered experience at this nightclub. Great customer service by all the staff including security/ hostess/ and bouncers. Great work guys!

jUjLANw4wyKVgUbbd9ACbA.text: Did not eat here so my review is for Lavo the night club/lounge.  One thing I liked about Lavo is that it was not overcrowded like some of the other places I was at on previous nights.  There wasn't the long line that you find at Tao, and the bouncer was not nearly as pretentious.  The decor inside was beautiful, classic Italian style.  The crowd was very cool as well.  They had models that stood in a classic style bathtub and washed themselves which I had never seen before, so even if you are bored there's something to watch.  :-)

GJDZO4i4k-Iq3mfqOv3Fxg.text: Food was good. Service was average. I would return. I would probably not order the same dish. It did not have enough seafood in it. Management was excellent and handled my concern swiftly and to my satisfaction. It's a beautiful restaurant.

6bkc4oiTJ57gQaKqbjCwew.text: I was here for a work dinner with a larger group of 9 of us.  We opted to order 2 meatballs to start the table off for dinner.  While the meatball was good, it was not the most amazing meatball I have ever had.  Maybe with the price point and advertisement of Wagyu beef I had too large of an expectation.  Again it was good, but nothing over the top.  Some of my group opted for salads as well and they all seemed fresh and larger portions.  I ordered the Truffle Gnocchi and did not want to fill up on salad before the meal.  When the food came out it was hot and the gnocchi was cooked perfectly and the flavor was great.  I could have used a little more truffle flavor, but there was still good flavor.   For drinks, I opted to try the cucumber mojito, which was delicious even though I was a bit confused.  Mojitos are made with rum and this option was made with vodka.  Vodka is my preference so this was fine with me and the drink was fantastic.  Our server was fantastic.  She would stop by to check on us often, but not where it became a burden.  My water glass did run empty once or twice, but promptly filled up once flagged down someone.  It was a good experience at Lavo and would come back when I was in town.

wBixpVFoos8X2iviA8ZNfQ.text: Service was five star! The food was great as well the only thing holding back a 5 star is the old fashion was missing the bitters. Will dine here again!

lvpT8ElCvBxK_8sRjS6oJQ.text: One of the best restaurants to sit and enjoy your meal slowly, while sipping wine or a cocktail with an incredible view of the Las Vegas Strip. Go at night and sit outside. They have one of the best Eggplant Parmesans! And the pizza is a nice indulge, too! Also a big fan of the Caesar salad here. The inside of the restaurant is just as amazing, but a totally different experience. Just depends on whether you want to look out over the city or not. Great friendly service here, too! One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas, been coming for 10 years!

uBpTKip4nCBf6ojjKMvxCw.text: Came here for dinner and really enjoyed ourselves! I had the chicken parmigiana which I didn't like, however that is just my preference. I do recommend "the meatball" for appetizer and "the meatball and spaghetti" very delicious! The meatball is very well seasoned and tender! My family member also had shrimp pasta that they liked very much! The lobster bisque soup and beet salad was also enjoyed very much by other members of my family. It is quite expensive here but the food and ambiance is very good! Highly recommend!

2BGNALD5idPxwB_VHJwyQg.text: Came here with a group of girls for my friends bachelorette and had a fun time. The line was very long when we first got there but moved very quickly and we were in within ten minutes. We were also on a guest list. Staff was very nice and the complimentary rose was great!

a_B_vAiKf-EORpRBJZN1dg.text: Was searching for some octopus in Las Vegas and this place came up.  The experience started out good with free parking and continued to roll that way. Started with the octopus that was cooked perfectly and incredibly tasty. Next was the Louie Salad that consisted of lobster shrimp and brooks salad items such as beets and lettuce. It was as fresh and tasty as you can get.  At this point it was time for The Meatball. The sauce was incredible and the quality of the meat along with the flavor were outstanding.  Lastly was the NY Cheescake.  Not quiet NY to me or anywhere near Juniors, but it was damn good.  You have to love the Italian bread with sauce along with the complementary anti pasta that comes with everything too.  So, it looks like I've found another " go to " place. And believe me, I won't forget it.

pk0I572H8Le6UkZLpmDKMA.text: Very good, very pricey. The service was very attentive and professional.   The carbonara was good. Big cubes of pancetta, with a good ratio against the pasta. Not too cheesy.   The sea bass was amazing. It was fresh and did not have any fishy smell. Smooth and soft would describe this goodness. It was my favorite dish.   Everyone says to get the meatball here and they were not wrong.  A mix of wagyu, Italian sausage and veal, it was the size of a tennis ball with marinara sauce. Very good texture and flavor.   Anything deep fried can easily win me over. The calamari was done well. It's pretty hard to mess us though.   I also liked the New York strip. It was cooked to perfection and delicious.   Dinner was definitely good.  Expect to pay a premium.

Xhiu2zX8VyXkgSiBC9mocQ.text: My husband and I went here last night for our anniversary. The service was  wonderful. We arrived prior to opening for dinner and the hosted offered everyone champagne while we waited. I made a note on our reservation that we were there for our anniversary and we were congratulated by all the staff who spoke to us.  The ambience is very sexy. Dim lighting, corner bench seats to sit close, and an excellent DJ. I wanted her mixes. As for the food, it was delicious. We ordered the clam appetizer, I had the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and broccoli and my husband had the seafood alfredo. For dessert, we were given a complementary tiramisu that was nice and light. We truly enjoyed our meals. It can be pricey once you start ordering courses, but it was well worth it.

F-sb8NsQf3aye1dyEFyXQA.text: PLEASE READ (REAL REVIEWER) I hate leaving negative reviews on places... but I need people to know what a night at Lavo is actually like. Long story Short- There were at least 30 tables that night and there were only TWO servers. My guests and I were regularly ignored by the waiter and when I spoke to management they were absolutely no help at all. I do not blame the waiter for this, I blame management. The waiter kindly let us know that he was running around like a chicken with their head cut off trying to keep up because the manager had sent all the other waiters and waitresses home thinking it would be a slow night.  I have literally never even received service this poor from Applebee's, let alone a "high end" restaurant. We ended up spending well over 2 hours at Lavo for 4 drinks and 3 meals. What. A. Joke.   AVOID at all costs and indulge in one of the several True high end restaurants at your disposal.

N1k-4CvLW2V-d59_dJnJFA.text: Stopped in for a spontaneous dinner. We were seated right away. There were many choices. I had spaghetti with Wagyu meatballs which was delicious and a big step up from any run of the mill pasta dish. The calamari was amazing. My dining partner had the NY strip and loved it. It was a great meal with stellar service in a beautiful setting. Also - the tiramisu was the best I've had, too decadent to eat more than a couple of spoonfuls.

oqz0uYO1T22h7pcvKyGkJw.text: I had a great Chilean sea bass and tuna. Always great coming back to Lavo every time I'm in Las Vegas.   Great service as well. The glass of water gets refilled immediately whenever it's empty

y2RZIKH6ibJLjP8b2bRFGg.text: If you are in Vegas having a Meal in LAVO is the mustttt!!!! It has a beautiful interior design and a super cute patio! You can have a yummy mealin a nice environment with a perfect service! I tried the tuna tartar as the appetizer and it was really good!  Spaghetti Carbonara as themain course and it was a ''TO DIE FOR"!!!  Also, when I was sitting there waiting for my food, I checked in on yelp and guess what?! I won a free desert... their most popular desert... fried oreo! Gosh! It was really good! Trying spaghetti carbonara and fried oreo is something that you have to try whenever you go to LAVO!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartar! Yum yum
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti carbonara(to die for) The sea Bass! Delicious

FePkVkSBL4zop6Ae8gqqqQ.text: We were in Vegas for our honeymoon, and since we were staying at the Palazzo, we decided to have a nice dinner here. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful, and it has a fancy, romantic ambiance. Our waiter brought a drink menu and asked what we would like for beverages. We had been sipping drinks ALL day at the pool, so we actually didn't feel like wine or anything, so we said no thank you. His eyes almost popped out of his head. Two adults, at an expensive Italian restaurant, NOT ordering wine at dinner?? He really looked like he had a problem with it. He unhappily brought over two waters and gave us the dinner menu. We ordered ravioli and a flatbread pizza. The food was so delicious! After we were done, he handed me a dessert menu and said "I'm assuming you're not having dessert either?". Since pasta and pizza are filling (hello carbs!) we said no thank you to dessert. He snatched the dessert menu out of my hand and stomped away. I could not believe his childish behavior. It's like the meal wasn't going to be expensive enough for his liking to get a big enough tip. When the bill came, my husband put some cash down and asked for a $50 bill back. The waiter took a $50 bill out of his pouch, but then stopped and looked at the bill again, and said "Um, how about I give you back two $20's and a $10 instead?". I knew right away he was asking because he wanted the $20 (at least) left for him as a tip, as we were likely to pocket the $50 bill. To say we were unimpressed with his service and attitude would be a severe understatement.   5 stars for food, 0 stars for service...averages out to about 3 stars I guess.

akPlaOwKZPB8Ux7kH7riHQ.text: A special family event sometimes calls for some special Italian cooking and fancy cocktails. LAVO delivered a friendly, professional and fun vibe along with some pretty impressive food to back up the high end decor and price tag.  The Wagyu meatball was a phenomenal appetizer. Enough fat content to be decadent, wonderfully cooked, a flavorful tomato sauce and just a little too much cheese (no such thing really). It makes me wonder how that spaghetti and meatball entree would be!   I went with the Chilean sea bass as my main course. It was seared beautifully. I soon realized that the knife was unnecessary. The crispy fried Portabella mushrooms were an interesting and unusual pairing in the plate as I expected a meaty fish and meaty mushroom to get in the way of each other. No worries though! The mushrooms were thinly sliced and crispy as advertised. I wouldn't have wanted a chunk. The tomatoes also provided a bit of lightness, freshness and acid to the dish. Spot on.  Value for money is reasonable considering the location. LAVO was worth a visit and likely worth another.

GTkwmDeOcsjG4MsC-jA1_g.text: We ended up here by accident and boy are we glad we did. The food was quite good, the menu fairly varied, and the atmosphere quite pleasant. The staff at greeting were quite pleasant and worked hard to get us a good spot.  The best part was Maya Maya Maya - fantastic service for our oddball party of 6. She was fast, always seemed to appear when we need her, was friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and, as odd as it seems, seemed as if she wanted us to enjoy our meals and experience. Imagine that.

DKZh4RvaFRpbxJK1KUr5fg.text: I started with the rack of lamb, one of my favorites when prepared properly; unfortunately, it wasn't. I then had the chicken which was also over cooked, Bummer. However, there is a cool atmosphere and great drinks, so not the end of the world.

8VRmuAq1rU7sJqG73GSBug.text: Reviewing on Sunday Brunch as these are the only times I've visited LAVO. Time to review up after the 4th and BEST visit this year. (so far) I visited on a Sunday at 11 AM without reservations catching up with my favorite flexitarian yelper. adaywithdiana.yelp.com =) Service: 5/5 We were seated immediately on a Sunday at 11 AMish without a reservation by the friendly hostesses at the front. Erich R (name from check) was fantastic and provided the best brunch experience I've had so far this year. He was witty and kept the mimosa glasses filled all morning. I was taking it easy, so I only had about 6 but Erich kept checking on us and making us laugh. One of the managers in a suit also stopped by to check on us. At the end, Erich gave us a bonus mimosa in a to go cup without us asking, that's what I'm talking about. Food: 4.5/5 Here's my current brunch faves: "Back to School": Truffled Grilled Cheese, Applewood Bacon with Calabrian tomato soup on the side. Wow, sounds so simple but was so bomb .Everything compliments each other so well. If I tried making this simple sandwich at home with ingredients from my local Smith's, disaster af.. When you use high quality ingredients and prep it perfectly, you get next level stuff. Chicken & Waffles: Cliche foodie breakfast dish, but once again, ingredients and preparation. Chocolate Chip Pancakes: I always share these and it's a win win for everyone. What's odd to me is that most of the portions are on the smaller side, but I always end up getting full very quickly. Value: 5/5 Considering you're in a beautiful high end restaurant, at a premium resort on the Las Vegas strip, the average dish was $13-$17 which is fair imo. $30 gets you bottomless options of: Mimosas, Kir Royales and Rose Sangrias. The consistent top notch service is what really brings the value home for me. When you leave a brunch in a better mood before walking in (and I'm happy af in general) that's great value. Hold onto it, and don't let it go.... Ambiance: 5/5 Attractiveness at every point of contact. The hostesses, the bar, the tables, the decorations, the server uniforms, the bathroom with the huge well sinks, etc Very high end classy but yet inviting vibe. No douche vibe in such a lovely high end establishment... Lavo is 4 for 4 this year for brunches. Food is always on point and the service has always been top notch. This is one of the few high end restaurants on the Strip that is hitting on all cylinders. It's just a matter of time until I time a Lavo dinner in there, but that's another yelp mf tale..=)

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $18 &#34;back to school&#34; sandwich..so so tasty..truffle in there takes this to another level..
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 6th and 7th mimosa, they provided a to go cup without me asking..saweeet
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake has a creme brulee steelo..which I totally dug..

QPNQ6av3stqTLm8p4W0Dvw.text: Came here the other night for dinner with my Fiance. Could have been a really spot, ruined by the service and music.  Came late on a reservation, but the manager at the hostess stand was awesome and sat us right away. We were offered both inside an outside seating. We chose wrong and went with outside. Terrible vibe and music outside.  Let's start with the good. The food. The food here is actually really good and huge portions!!   We ordered:  Calamari - Pretty good. Not very crisp. Tons of food  Beet Salad - Skip  Meatball with Ricotta - So good!  Carne Pizza - wasn't terrible, wasn't all that impressive either  Cavatelli bolognese - Bomb! Fire!! The best!  Chicken Parm - Surprisingly really good!  Wine - ok  Now - this is what takes good food and destroys the experience. Bad/lack of service.   Server if I can recall was named Eric. And this is where it went downhill. Barely saw him the entire night. Came off super cocky and followed up with sub-par skills. Took 15 minutes just to get our first drink out. Messed up our order, we asked for half and half on the pizza. Told us he would ask and then let us know. Instead - he never came back (ever). Before we knew it we had one of the pizza's that we ordered.  Asked for side of marinara sauce....twice from him and a bus boy. It finally came when they were clearing our table of food. Debated ordering dessert - we wanted it. But our sever never came back, so we asked another server after 10 minutes of waiting for our check because we decided waiting another 15-20 minutes for our original server to come out and actually bring the dessert would not have been worth it.  3 stars....food is pretty good. Huge portions. Inside could have been cool. Very loud and not that good of music. Service - awful.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Salad
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

EOguOIDL1P_zJZyeXPl4Dw.text: The food at Lavo is why they are receiving the four stars, but the waiter is why NOT 5.  I, along with my husband, cousin, and good friend, came here to enjoy a birthday dinner Saturday night. Once we were seated, the waiter came to ask us for our drink orders. My husband and cousin were not quite ready to order their drinks, as the drink menu is quite extensive, but the waiter (I know his name but will not call him out) seemed frustrated. He took my iced tea order, but then took him 10 minutes to come back to finally take the rest of the drink order, but by then we were ready to order our food.   It was busy, but he was joking around with his coworkers RIGHT in front of us for several minutes. It really irritated me, as he acted more as if we were a nuisance than patrons. I am a bit disappointed in his lack of attentiveness, care, and focus--for what you are paying, those should be automatically included. For the record, I still tipped him well, post $220 bill later. But he was a stain on our experience. I am really bummed about that.   But the food--wow. I highly recommend the Cavatelli Agnolotti--this was my husband's dish, but was the best pasta we ordered. The Penne Vodka was OK, but I would have ordered something else if I would have known it was just standard. I really liked the Lobster Bisque and Minestrone soup to start. The starter bread, sauce, and antipasto were fabulous. Overall, the taste explosion blew our minds!

wCn7PoqrTYE-nEnJrWFPmw.text: Excellent food and service.  Our server Tim was very attentive.  The calamari and chicken parmigiana was excellent.  Kids pasta was very good.  Enjoyed with our family!

QgcHVxWro3BE8VOmZe1rqg.text: 10/10 LAVO HAS OFFICIALLY BECOME MY GO TO RESTAURANT IN VEGAS! From the mouthwatering food to the classy ambience this restaurant completely exceeds expectations, BUT what really made the experience memorable was our server Lee. Plainly stated, guy was an absolute superstar. From his spot on wine recommendation to his personality we felt completely at home. For anyone looking for an amazing meal in Vegas Lavo is a must have!

9BxfbxEPXQaQRKGDtBO1gQ.text: Tyler was theeee best server ever Great food and amazing service! Ask for Tyler!  You will not be disappointed. He was excellent for a bachelorette party of 8.

_irU6IO7CZDMDZ490Wswzg.text: We had a brunch reservation a week in advance yet when we got there, they didn't even try to accommodate us all sitting together. We ended up at 3 separate tables which was kind of annoying especially since the place wasn't busy. The food was ok. We were told that the chicken and waffles were the best thing on the menu...the chicken was literally chicken nuggets and the butter for the waffle tasted horrible. The waffle was extra basic as well. The fries were good. The Nutella and banana crepe was good and the service was great. $61 on breakfast was not worth it at all. $14 for 1 mimosa. Ridiculous.

CT5TtFkw3Z58ZJszK4LKkA.text: My wife and I dined here for our first year anniversary. We ordered the meatball for the appetizer, and the carbonara for our entrees. We finished with tiramisu. The food and service were fabulous. We'd highly recommend LAVO.

F3VetgZ1wRywtdGrCs0j5g.text: Get the meatball!!!  Heavy but excellent appetizer. Wonderful experience, excellent food and service.  I had the grilled Brazino.  A Mediterranean fish very light and well prepared grilled.   The wines by the glass from Italy are nice. Outside dinning is perfect this time of year. As others have noted, it's expensive but you get what you pay for here.  Highly recommend.

tGvXqb7LfgFXN18mT0-JXw.text: I have never been to a high scale restaurant with a dj.  The music was so loud I couldn't even hear what other people were saying.  The food was pricey and average. My spaghetti carbonara was swimming in sauce.  It was a horrible experience.

NLqaqbETfX0-OrYQb6mlWQ.text: I was looking forward to going to LAVO for months while I was in Vegas this past week on vacation, total letdown. Reservations were at 7:15, still had to wait until 7:45 to get seated. The bad service started with the hostess. When we went up and let her know we were there for the reservation, she informed us we needed to tell the other hostess (the one standing right next to her) this was after we stood in line for her. No, "ok, I will let so and so know" just a rude, you told the wrong hostess. Throughout the dinner, waters went unfilled, we were without drinks most of the meal. We were treated as though we were inconveniencing the waiter when we asked for simple things. We finally asked for the bill after waiting with nothing on the table for over 20 min. My food good, not worth feeling we were forgotten about though. I will not return or recommend. 8 out of the 10 workers we encountered were rude.

bffRLwvxgILMYNzq5GxPSA.text: Made a reservation for brunch but my group was running late. I called ahead to let them know and A girl named Madi answered the phone letting me know that there was no issue and she would see us when we got there. When we finally arrived Madi greeted us with a smile, and even wished my friend a congratulations on her engagement. I had never been greeted so friendly and warm when walking into a restaurant. We got to the table and Molly was our server. She was absolutely adorable and made the whole brunch worth it. I ordered the lobster Benedict and it was outstanding. From the amazing staff to the wonderful food, I will definitely be back.

FDnoWuXARKeHRrAa5RnQXw.text: You hear a lot about LAVO -- especially regarding brunch. It's Sunday morning. It's a three day weekend. You got one more full day and night in Vegas. Come to LAVO for bottomless mimosas. Even if it's a normal weekend, I would recommend it anyway. It's a solid brunch spot with reasonable prices. No. Seriously. and it's perfect for when you're staying at the Palazzo because it's right there.  The service is pretty solid. Granted, the few times I have been here have been either normal weekends where it's not too crowded or earlier in the brunch hours. The staff was attentive and made sure we have enough water (and mimosas).  Most recently, we got the breakfast mac and cheese and chocolate chip pancakes on a lowkey brunch. It really was one of the best decisions that we made throughout the whole trip. I have to admit that I wish that the fried eggs on the mac and cheese were more runny and there should have been more pancetta but it was still a solid decision. The pancakes were fluffy, delicious, and had the right amount of chocolate chips. The complimentary pastries were also delicious.   Portion size relative to price was good. I felt like the mac and cheese was richer than I expected and filled me up quicker that I thought -- and for Vegas, the prices, vibe, and food are pretty difficult to beat.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavo Lini
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary pastries
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Mac and Cheese

-8COp0m5-IiOAN9523z6wg.text: We sat outside and had the yummiest dinner and such great service - and what a view!  Highly recommend you ask to sit outside. Also- ask for Tim, great server :)

9xTHruBUSEy9KVYr6gIoXA.text: We stayed in Palazzo so we wanted to check out Lavo restaurant as we walked pass by. Justin was our waiter and he did such a great job. We ordered The Meatball, roasted beets salad, pom cocktail, Italian beer and everything was perfect. Loved the delicious food, loved the ambience, loved the great service. I strongly recommend Lavo's The Meatball which is the best meatball I've ever had. This is a "must have" once you are at Lavo. And don't forget to check in on Yelp's for your free Oreo desert.

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b98-9R4YOqc5h7vUvUpDrA.text: love the ambiance of this restaurant. my husband and I ordered lobster benedict and it was absolutely delicious. lemon ricotta waffles and mimosa are a bit disappointing but will still come back. staff are professional, friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu.

B5y1o7ZoUL1j9u4-LCsFkQ.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat before catching a show at Caesar's Palace. Service was very quick (as requested) and the waiter was hilarious and kind. Very cunning! The food was great -  I opted for a salmon meal that was served with zucchini noodles and seasoned just right. We got a bottle of Pinot Grigio for $50 - nicely priced for a high-end dinner in Vegas! We will be back next time we're in town. Pro tip: make sure you get the meatball with ricotta!

llXwPCabXxdCdaSe1vbq0w.text: Delicious food and incredible wait staff!!! I couldn't eat the garlic bread they bring out in the beginning (allergic to dairy), and a few members of the staff went to a lot of trouble to accommodate me and find me some plain bread to munch on before my meal arrived. Super kind and accommodating. Had the simple spaghetti and marinara sauce, but it was some of the best I've ever had! Amazing place to go to while in Vegas.

vFegV_tddT2MibCuKZnOQA.text: Sat for over two hours before dinner finally showed up. Sure the appetizers were good but seriously TWO hours?  The waitress never came to the table and the managers ran around like chickens with their heads cit off. Food finally came, eh. I've had better. Beautiful restaurant but there's pretty restaurants all over the strip.

nEbIm6hpN9YSkpIK2d1nYg.text: I don't often write a review but I was a really happy customer yesterday at this restaurant. The service was great. Our server was really great and friendly despite the fact my family and I can't speak English and didn't know much about menu. He was very patient with us. The food was decent. My family loved every dishes we got. (The ones he recommended, tuna, lamb, sea bass, salmon and hugeeeee meatball.). Osyters and clams were very fresh.  My only complain was that seafood pasta didn't meet my expectations. Everything else was perfect.

cwDZ4wwxI46LulLTcT1puA.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem in Vegas. Do you want a quiet, beautiful, serene part of Vegas? This is an excellent reprieve from the strip. We saw the Wagyu meatball on ginormous foods, so we added it to our list. The 1# meatball did not disappoint! However the rest of our order was incredibly fresh seafood. Yum. One of my best meals in Vegas! Can't wait to go back!

tG9u7hcEhrY6DvpvEhyWlQ.text: Nice ambience , good drinks but the food is a little greasy and menu could use updating. Not a bad spot though for a solid experience. Just nothing exceptional .

rGn6uEB5t2en-R2J3gPMfA.text: We were a party of 8 with a 7:15 reservation #1698931983. We were from several companies and had a key customer with us. One of the companies CEO was also present.  Got there early and had drinks while waiting to be seated.    ONE HOUR LATER, we were still waiting to be seated.  The person who made the reservation went to the host 4 times asking on the status of our reservation.  After the 3rd visit,  the restaurant bought us drinks and we were told we would be seated next and had a buzzer that would light up when our table was ready.    A few minutes later we see them seating another large party.  WTF!!  After a 4th conversation with the host, one of our colleagues had to leave so now we are 7 people.  When we were finally seated,  they bring us to a tiny table for 6 people WTF!  So with all of us squeezing in and sitting shoulder to shoulder and one of our colleagues standing there in the middle of the restaurant like an idiot waiting for a chair,  someone comes running over with a 7 th chair.   After we all get started and stuffed around the table,  the manager comes over and says he has another table where we may be more comfortable. Great.  We all stand up, grab our drinks and make our way across the restaurant where we finally settle in.    With our pre dinner drinks, we easily spent $150+ per head. We were late for our after hours event atTao that one person in our party's company was hosting.  He paid a lot of money for that event and there were hundreds of his customers there.   The food and table service was good. .. but so what! For that kind of money and in front of a key customer,  I'm trusting and expecting them to get it right!

photos.caption: Photo of LAVO Italian Restaurant & Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big ass, literally,  meatball
